Big data engineers implement complex big data projects with a focus on collecting, parsing, managing, analyzing, and visualizing large sets of data to turn information into actionable deliverables across customer-facing platforms. They have a strong aptitude to decide on the needed hardware and software design and can guide the development of such designs through both proof of concepts and complete implementations. Description: Qualifications Required Qualifications: PhD in Economics, Public Policy, or related field Proficiency working with large datasets in software such as R, SQL, and MATLAB Understanding of statistical techniques and machine learning Preferred Qualifications: Expertise in energy technology policy Understanding of engineering science of solar photovoltaics, solid-state lighting, and lithium-ion batteries Experience working in interdisciplinary teams Self-sufficient work style About the Job Postdoc Position in Science, Technology, and Environmental Policy (STEP) at the Humphrey School of Public Affairs at the University of Minnesota. This position is for a Post-Doctoral Fellow with the Center for Science, Technology, and Environmental Policy based at the University of Minnesota’s Humphrey School of Public Affairs. The post-doc will work with Prof. Gabriel Chan and a team of investigators from Harvard University and Cambridge University on a sponsored project titled, “What factors drive innovation in energy technologies? The role of technology spillovers and government investment.” Primary responsibilities for the post-doc will involve developing novel methodologies to identify breakthrough innovations in three technology areas: solar photovoltaics, lithium-ion batteries, and solid-state lighting. The key research question is: How can each technical breakthrough be understood as originating from within an area of inquiry vs. spilling over from another area of inquiry (usually different sectors, technologies and/or scientific discipline/tradition)? Methods will rely on automated patent classification and citation network mapping based on the application of machine learning techniques to the international patent record. This work will be integrated in a larger study that includes interviews with technology experts, engineering cost modelling, qualitative review of research organization management. This study has the overall purpose of quantifying the role of innovation spillovers, determining how the spillovers occurred, and identifying opportunities for policy innovation to harness spillovers to accelerate future clean energy innovation. Duties: 90% - Research This is primarily an independent research position. The post-doc will conduct research activities related to this project, working independently with bi- weekly check-ins with the three Primary Investigators (PIs) on the project. 10% - Research Coordination The post-doc will assist with the planning and execution of annual meetings of the full research team. Additionally, the post-doc will execute necessary tasks to coordinate research efforts digitally across the research team (e.g. by maintaining a digital reference library, datasets, and draft papers). About the Department https://www.hhh.umn.edu/ https://www.hhh.umn.edu/areas-expertise/science-technology-environmental- policy How To Apply Applications must be submitted online. To be considered for this position, please click the Apply button and follow the instructions. You will have the opportunity to complete an online application for the position and attach a cover letter and resume. Additional documents may be attached after application by accessing your "My Activities" page and uploading documents there. This position will remain open until filled. To request an accommodation during the application process, please e-mail employ@umn.edu or call (612) 624-UOHR (8647). Our presumption is that prospective employees are eligible to work here. Criminal convictions do not automatically disqualify finalists from employment. Located at the heart of one of the nation's most vibrant, diverse metropolitan communities, students on the campuses in Minneapolis and St. Paul benefit from extensive partnerships with world-renowned health centers, international corporations, government agencies, and arts, nonprofit, and public service organizations.

Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started. Facebook is looking for a Hardware Prototyper to support the development of our novel communications technologies. In this role, you will use your experience as an electronics/RF technician to work side by side with the design engineers, developing proof of concept hardware in the lab, troubleshooting problems as they arise, evolving these designs into robust solutions for field testing, and delivering scalable systems that can be transitioned to our partners in the telecom industry. This position is based out of our Northridge, CA office. RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in all aspects of the prototyping, integration, and productization process, including quality and safety Use your fabrication and assembly skills to support delivering first of a kind RF systems, including mechanical assembly, PCB inspection and rework, cable harness fabrication, electrical bring-up, system test, field test, site deployment, and documentation Review procedures with the engineers prior to performing them, proactively identify issues, and suggest solution Support system testing which may include vibration, thermal, environmental, and antenna pattern measurements Maintain Tool Control, ESD, and FOD standards in work areas Independently resolve routine questions and problems MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 4+ years of experience as an electronics technician Experience with cellular based technologies & associated testing parameters Technical experience tackling and understanding new technical and engineering designs Knowledge of electrical and RF test equipment, including spectrum analyzers, signal generators, oscilloscopes, DMM/DVM, etc. Knowledge of RF components, including amplifier and switch testing, antennas and antenna-related components Knowledge of electronics theory, circuit design, troubleshooting, and repair Ability to lift up to 60 lbs. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Knowledge of the installation, integration, and commissioning of wireless communications equipment, including 2G/3G/LTE base stations, cell site passive equipment, and related electronic equipment and systems Familiarity with FCC Rules and Regulations Understanding of solar power systems including charge controller, battery subsystem, etc. Experience supporting remote sites and/or customer installations Experience troubleshooting antenna systems from transmitter to antenna Experience with radio access networks (RAN) and optical/microwave/satellite Certifications in crane or forklift operation
IT Skills: Electronics troubleshooting, RF testing, PCB inspection and rework, Cable harness fabrication, System testing, Antenna pattern measurements, Electrical bring-up, Wireless communications equipment installation, Circuit design, Knowledge of RF components, Use of electrical and RF test equipment, Assembly skills
Soft Skills: Problem-solving, Collaboration, Communication skills, Attention to detail, Ability to work independently
Education: Education:, Certifications in crane or forklift operation

Description: Overview Who we are: Meridian Health Plan is a family-owned, family-operated company of passionate leaders, achievers, and innovators dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our members, our providers and in the healthcare industry. We provide government-based health plans (Medicare, Medicaid, and the Health Insurance Marketplace) in five different states (Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, and Ohio). Our employees work hard, play hard, and give back. Meridian employees enjoy: Happy hours, special events, company sports teams, potlucks, Bagel Fridays, weekly Executive Lunches, and volunteer opportunities. A Day in the Life of a Business Analyst: The Business Analyst position is primarily responsible for requirements gathering, requirements analysis, impact assessment, and creation of Business Requirements documents and Functional Specifications for system development projects of various size and complexity. The Business Requirement documents are at a detailed level, including related functional requirements, use cases, testing considerations and functional solution design. This position collaborates with Business Leads and subject matter experts, Delivery Leads, Architects, vendors, and technical resources on a regular basis throughout the project delivery lifecycle. The Business Analyst 2 is responsible for adhering to corporate software development standards and methodologies. Secondary responsibilities include creation and maintenance of various types of documents, testing support, issue investigation, analysis, and resolution, and assisting in responding to new corporate initiatives and work requests as needed. Responsibilities Collaborate with the business units and/or external clients in the definition and documentation of project scope, and identification and documentation of project risks and assumptions Participates in the work estimation process Performs business process analysis and process modeling and participates in the development of strategies for process enhancements Solicits and documents business and functional requirements and additional artifacts such as Use Cases to define client needs/wants Performs data mining and data analysis as needed for research and to support the development of required artifacts Manages business requirements documents throughout all project phases and ensures departmental compliance with audit-required processes Participates in architecting the logical design of system functional solutions with the developers and architects, including screen design and specifications, data modeling, and documentation of logical processing flows Responsible for facilitating/brokering communication between the business customers and the technical team Establishes and maintains traceability between business and functional requirements and artifacts in accordance with department guidelines Mocks up screens per agreed-upon functional design and transfers these designs to functional specifications Communicates with development and QA teams regularly to ensure accurate understanding and interpretation of requirements and other produced artifacts such as functional specifications Collaborates with QA teams in the execution of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) Assists in the preparation of user training materials based on approved functional specifications; assist or conduct training sessions as assigned Participates in Quality Assurance testing as necessary Provides post implementation production support including problem triage, analysis, and resolution Researches, reviews, and analyzes existing processes; develop improvement strategies Assists Delivery Lead in the creation and maintenance of project plans and project status reports Qualifications What you can bring to Meridian: Bachelor’s degree required Must pass the MHP Analyst Assessment Two to three (2 - 3) years’ Information Technology experience as a business/systems analyst, programmer, designer, or QA Analyst required At least two (2) years’ experience in large scale system implementation efforts using a standard software lifecycle methodology Proven experience with business requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping, and impact assessment; requirements management with Use Cases desired Proven experience in client requirements/needs analysis and ability to interpret those requirements as they pertain to existing company systems/processes is required Experience working with data structures such as relational databases, XML, fixed length, and delimited files Data mining, analysis, definition and data mapping experience Health care insurance experience preferred What Meridian can offer you: Our healthcare benefits include a variety of PPO plans that are effective on the first day of employment for our new full-time team members. Opportunity to work with the industry’s leading technologies and participate in unique projects, demonstrations, conferences, and exclusive learning opportunities. Meridian offers 401k matching that is above the national average. Full-time MHP employees are eligible for tuition reimbursement towards Bachelor’s or Master’s degrees. Meridian Health Plan was named Detroit's 1 Fastest Growing Company by Crain's Magazine, so it is a great time to get involved with Meridian. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER MSTR

Description: Who We Are: Twitter users generate many terabytes of data every single day; Twitter engineers run hundreds of experiments; Twitter data scientists craft increasingly sophisticated models of users and content. The Applied Research team at Twitter works to measure and understand the satisfaction and motivations of our users. Applied Research is part of the larger Analytics team at Twitter. From modeling individual user behavior to characterizing user populations, our work powers core systems at Twitter and helps inform product strategy. To develop a deep understanding of our users, we use machine learning, statistical modeling, data mining, time series modeling, and many other analytical techniques; we build prototypes; and we perform experiments — all applied at the scale of Twitter. What You’ll Do: You will be a key member of the Applied Research team working closely with our partners in engineering, product, design, and user research. Your work will directly influence the exciting new product areas that Twitter is building. As such, you will: Conduct analyses to learn from our vast amount of data, including exploratory data analysis, investigating A/B test results, observational and network data analysis, etc. Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to model user behavior, identify causal impact and attribution, and build and benchmark metrics Use tools for interacting with large datasets such as Hadoop, Spark, and Presto Use Python or R (or similar) to conduct complex data analyses Use data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau or Zeppelin) Communicate findings to executives and cross-functional product teams Who You Are: You communicate your findings clearly and empathetically to a wide audience of relevant partners and are capable of building meaningful presentations and analyses that tell a “story”. You’re capable of collaborating with our business, engineering, and research colleagues to discover new opportunities that benefit Twitter. You’re a pragmatic problem solver with a strong quantitative background and passion for deriving insights from data. You’re a self-starter who takes initiative and is capable of learning on the job. You have experience owning complex projects from start to finish. You’re excited to learn and apply new data analysis techniques and tools. Requirements: Masters or Ph.D dealing with quantitative analysis or commensurate work experience Strong proficiency with at least one programming language such as Python, R, Java, Scala Experience using quantitative data analysis to solve problems and answer questions We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status. San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
IT Skills: Machine Learning, Statistical Modeling, Data Mining, Time Series Modeling, Analytical Techniques, Hadoop, Spark, Presto, Python, R, Data Visualization Tools, Tableau, Zeppelin
Soft Skills: Communication, Presentation, Collaboration, Problem Solving, Quantitative Background, Initiative, Learning on the job, Project Management, Empathy

Description: Job Duties: We are looking for a highly motivated software engineer to work in the RET team in the Calibre business unit. You will be responsible for developing core functions in the OPC and related product line, which is a widely adopted software tool that is used for full chip simulation of the lithography process and qualification of the RET solution. You will be teaming up with a senior group of software engineers contributing to final production level quality of new components and algorithms. You will be responsible for the complete sequence of development steps, including conceptualization, specification, programming and testing of the solution. Previous experience in EDA will be a plus. Job Qualifications: The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience: BS degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Math or related field is required. MS or PhD is preferred. Must have at least 5 years of professional Software Engineering with C and C++ on UNIX and/or LINUX platforms. (MS degree with 3 years of professional experience or PhD degree with < 1 year will be considered). Some computational geometry experience is strongly preferred Machine Learning experience is strongly preferred. Experience with tensorflow/sklearn is preferred. Experience in OPC / RET areas are preferred. Individuals with strong ability to learn and explore new technologies and who are able to demonstrate good analysis and problem solving skills are preferred. Must have the ability to collaborate closely with other members of the team and develop critical components consistently and in a timely manner. Experience with Tcl/Tk and other scripting languages (perl, python) is preferred. _All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, color, religion, national origin, disability or protected veteran status._ Back Share Apply Now
IT Skills: Software Engineering, C, C++, UNIX/Linux, EDA, Computational Geometry, Machine Learning, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, OPC/RET, Tcl/Tk, Scripting languages (Perl, Python)
Soft Skills: Motivated, Teamwork, Problem-solving, Analysis, Quick learner, Collaboration

Description: About GoDaddy GoDaddy powers the world's largest cloud platform dedicated to small, independent ventures. With nearly 17 million customers worldwide and over 75 million domain names under management, GoDaddy is the place people come to name their idea, build a professional website, attract customers and manage their work. Our mission is to give our customers the tools, insights and the people to transform their ideas and personal initiative into success. To learn more about the company visit www.GoDaddy.com. This position will provide database administration and database engineering functionality for the Aftermarket supporting the infrastructure for Afternic, Auctions and Parking. This will include work for short term initiatives as well as long term infrastructure involvement. This may include the rewrite and maintenance of the Aftermarket Inventory Management System, the rewrite of the GoDaddy Parking and rewrite of the Afternic DLS network. As a Senior Database Admin in our Cambridge office, you will partner closely with several Scrum teams assisting with user stories for both a Java platform team and a full stack, customer-facing product team responsible for GoDaddy’s aftermarket domain services. We are seeking to scale out our services globally and make them as mobile-responsive as possible. The role will assist in developing and maintaining the long term infrastructure as we scale our marketplace around the globe. We value strong database engineers. They should be confident in delivering quality work with focus on performance and scale. They will be embedded in teams working full-stack and be part of decision making processes for delivering applications and services for our customers. They should have an eye on the future to ensure we are delivering for the growth of our market. Responsibilities: Works in a team to maintain all SQL Server and open-source (MySQL, MariaDB,) databases for various Aftermarket initiatives, including setup, configuration, administration, tuning, trouble-shooting, data manipulation and backups. Works closely with software developers performing platform selections, database design, database architecture, SQL programming, consultation and technical guidance. Performs requirements gathering, business design, technical design, development, testing, implementation. writing reliable and efficient code, queries, stored procedures, cursors, triggers and scripting in MySQL and other platforms Recommends hardware configurations as they pertain to database performance and high availability. Performs database performance monitoring and tuning, including advanced skills in the effective use of database tools. Creates and maintains backup and recovery plans and high availability planning. Responsible for the organization, security and protection of the databases and data. Provides daily operational activities such as backups/restores, application troubleshooting, log monitoring, adds, moves and changes. Works with other Technology Team members, Product Networking and Tech Support for any application development, network plans, trouble-shooting, implementations and changes on the database servers. Participates in the on-call production support rotation and may occasionally be required to do work at the office during non-business or late night hours. Participates in projects as needed. _GoDaddy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color,_ _creed, religion,_ _sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, medical condition, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status or civil partnership/union status, physical or mental_ _disability, pregnancy,_ _childbirth, genetic information, military and veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. GoDaddy will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with local and federal requirements._ If you need assistance completing an application for a position with us, please reach out to our Recruiting Team at Recruiting@godaddy.com To submit your application to this position, please click _Apply_ .
IT Skills: SQL Server, MySQL, MariaDB, Database design, Database architecture, SQL programming, Query optimization, Backup and recovery, Troubleshooting, Performance monitoring
Soft Skills: Collaboration, Decision-making, Problem-solving, Communication, Attention to detail, Teamwork
Education: Education-Related Skills:, Database design, SQL programming

Description: Job Description As a team, we value correctness, efficiency, and safety. We measure and monitor everything, and have a culture of continuous reflection and improvement. We aim to eliminate friction in production and believe that no project should be delayed due to lack of reliable infrastructure. We believe that a well designed production environment can be beautiful. We're looking for a network engineer who shares our values, particularly those who have experience building, monitoring, and maintaining a highly-available backbone interconnecting multiple datacenters. You will: Help architect, design, and implement improvements to our global network Interface with the security team to design and deliver security-related enhancements Perform network based security risk assessments Configure and administer network monitoring tools Configure and administer routers and switches in a multi-vendor environment Provision and deploy network hardware in PoPs and data centers Troubleshoot network failures and performance issues Participate in an on-call rotation covering all of the above Mentor and train other network engineers on the team Occasionally be required to travel domestically and internationally Qualifications You have: 5+ years hands-on experience with routing, switching, and load balancing in highly complex environments Bachelor’s degree or relevant technical experience Experience designing routing topologies using OSPF, BGP, MPLS, and QoS/CoS In-depth knowledge of network concepts, devices, and protocols Solid experience and skills with the Linux/Unix command line and tools Solid experience with scripting technologies (e.g. - any of ruby/erb, python, perl, bash, etc.) Strong communication skills Impressive organizational skills and the ability to multitask in an interrupt-driven, real-time environment A personal commitment to quality Even better: Experience with Juniper platforms and F5 load balancers Experience designing and implementing IPv6 networks Experience with wireless network technologies Additional Information At Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
IT Skills: Routing, Switching, Load balancing, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, QoS/CoS, Linux/Unix command line, Scripting (ruby/erb, python, perl, bash, etc.), Juniper platforms, F5 load balancers, IPv6 networks, Wireless network technologies
Soft Skills: Communication skills, Organizational skills, Multi-tasking, Quality commitment

Description: The International IT Analyst is a key contributor from a solutions and project perspective in the work between in-country IT and US IT teams in order to align with the strategic direction of Global Planning. This person will be responsible for consulting internally and with in-country teams to capture technology needs, help prioritize them in the global planning process, and facilitate the analysis, submittal, and approval of new initiatives. This person will lead efforts to define and manage technology solutions, project initiatives, business architectures, technology objectives and strategies, and represent these to business areas and IS leadership in the US as needed. In addition, the International IT Analyst will represent the international teams in project initiation and change management in the US through ensuring project scope and features accurately meet their needs. The International IT Analyst will become an expert in business procedures and processes and participate in business transformation and change management activities. This individual should demonstrate the highest levels of customer service, communication, productivity, and professionalism as well as understanding of different cultures and customs in countries where Costco does business around the world. In addition, the candidate will have the ability and/or aptitude for leadership and self-motivation, possessing analytical skills and Costco business expertise. The candidate should be comfortable with speaking in front of groups of people and leading meetings in person as well as on conference calls with all levels of IT and business teams. Tasks and responsibilities Focuses on technology and the development of solutions and strategies Responsible for development and maintenance of key team deliverables/dashboards/KPIs Conducts periodic audits for overall international solutions, planning and delivery functions Facilitates understanding between the International IT team and US Finance team regarding departmental financials International IT Alignment Develops and manages stakeholder relationships Fosters confidence as a trusted advisor to International IT and business areas Consults on industry technology / retail trends and capabilities Partners with International business leaders to define and align global technology needs Advocates for the technology needs of international business groups with US Operations Provides leadership, mentoring, and coaching for International IT team members Works with division in development and driving executable IT Programs in support of the company, divisional and team goals and objectives as they relate to assigned areas Successfully manages / handle multiple delivery project simultaneously Oversees, coordinates and assists in the management of all facets of international delivery efforts to ensure milestones and deliverables are met within schedule, budget and quality ensured Directs and supports global delivery teams in order to balance project priorities and trade-off decisions Develops and maintains appropriate planning documentation that establish Costco IT’s global direction Manages vendor relationships ensuring cost control and timely deliverables Develops and coordinates budgetary, legal/compliance, and operational controls and associated metrics to measure success Participates in business transformation and change management Captures and analyzes customer needs and priorities and initiate delivery efforts Captures needs and facilitate their prioritization Evaluates new technology opportunities and facilitate decision making Develops and present documentation for project approval decision making by senior management Documents and manages risks, issues, assumptions, and constraints impacting international delivery efforts Communicates international modernization status to stakeholders Prioritizes global requirements effectively based on appropriately identified factors Organizes and synthesize large amounts of information provided by stakeholders Fosters confidence as a trusted advisor in building strategy and vision Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved and obtain required information for capturing and validating requirements and other artifacts Interacts with technical team(s) to translate functional specifications into technology solutions Interacts with appropriate teams to help prioritize specific projects with global level initiatives Assists in other areas of the department and company as necessary Core Competencies Technical Acumen - Must be familiar with a broad set of technologies and solutions currently in use at Costco Values \- Adheres to and upholds Costco’s core values Directing Others \- Establishes clear directions; sets stretching objectives; distributes the workload appropriately; lays out work in a well-planned and organized manner; maintains two-way dialogue with others on work and results; brings out the best in people; is a clear communicator Managing and Measuring Work \- Clearly assigns responsibility for tasks and decisions; sets clear objectives and measures; monitors process, progress, and results; designs feedback loops into work Motivating Others \- Creates a climate in which people want to do their best; can motivate team and project members Empowerment \- Invites input from each person and shares ownership and visibility; makes each individual feel his/her work is important; is someone people like working for and with Decision Making \- Makes decisions in a timely manner, sometimes with incomplete information and under tight deadlines and pressure; able to make a quick decision Delivery \- Oversees and coordinates the development and maintenance of complete and accurate project plans to ensure timely and accurate implementation of all international efforts Continuous Improvement \- Actively seeks to identify more efficient processes and procedures that will improve workflow within the organization Required skills, abilities, and certifications 2-5 years of experience in technology solutions (some examples are: network, administration, security essentials, desktop & server administration, application configuration & administration, application development) Proven ability to develop and present a business case document and/or presentation to management Must possess a demonstrated ability to work independently and with limited supervision including: Strong work ethic, demonstrated attention to detail and excellent time-management skills Availability to work as needed to honor commitments, meet deadlines, and support assigned business area which could include nights and weekends Good understanding of Corporate IS policies, procedures and standards. Communication Skills: Must possess excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills, with the ability to negotiate and effectively engage individuals at all levels of the organization Must have the ability to work successfully with people at all management levels Must be able to define and execute program communication plan Must be available for evening, weekend, and Holiday work Up to 25% international travel may be required Recommended skills, abilities, and certifications 1+ years of experience creating or utilizing business process models 2-5 years of experience in development and administration of project and team level financial budgeting and tracking 3-5 years of experience and commitment to applying project management methodologies 1-3 years of experience gathering business requirements 2-5 years of experience in reporting and analytics Proven leadership skills, including: Leading a team in the execution of a successful project or initiative Leading a cross-functional team through a decision that resulted in a business benefit Demonstrated strong leadership and team-building skills Ability to lead the resolution of high impact Issues and Risks Manage program/project level budgeting and provide financial tracking Must be able to align both active and planned project work efforts with program vision Must be able to coordinate deliverables and interdependencies across program(s) Proven experience in evaluating a business need, and facilitating decision making to gain approval for the solution Works with US IT Operations to develop delivery efforts aligned with Global IT Modernization and Transformation Coordinate with customers and internal cross functional teams on pricing strategies, inventory, delivery, and overall geographic / account specific projects Must have proven history of meeting deadlines within budgets delivering successful quality product(s) Must have strong communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills Proven history of successful management of business critical programs and projects Must be able to manage program/project architectural and technical strategies as defined by Enterprise Architecture Must be able to manage program level activities by developing and executing against a strategic program charter Must possess process improvement skills and demonstrated ability to effectively troubleshoot and provide solutions Must have solid negotiation, delegation and team building skills Must be extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency Must possess and work with a positive attitude Familiar with Costco’s IS or similar project methodology, processes and procedures Must possess excellent analytical skills and demonstrated ability to effectively troubleshoot and provide solutions Multi-lingual (Korean, Japanese, Spanish, German, French, or Chinese) Bachelor’s Degree in International Business, CS, or MIS Apply: Use the link below to upload all required documents to https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm02/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=COSTCO &cws;=1&rid;=2597 Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business.

Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast. Job Summary: Join the Comcast Xfinity mobile team! We're a small team with a big mission to provide a value added wireless service to Xfinity customers. We're currently looking for a Defect Engineer. You'll be a part of the delivery team that owns critical quality control operations, working on technology initiatives that push the boundaries of customer experience and interaction.In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams (management, web, mobile and API developers, UX designers, test engineers, operations engineers, product and business managers) to test features related to Xfinity mobile applications. You must be a strong technical leader, an independent, critical and analytic thinker, have excellent communication skills and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands.Employees at all levels are expected to: Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job. Own the customer experience-think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services Know your stuff-be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences Win as a team-make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas Be an active part of the Net Promoter System-a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company-by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers Drive results and growth Respect and promote inclusion and diversity Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities. Core Responsibilities: Perform Gap Analysis: Review Business requirements and ensure they directly translate to technical requirements and solutions developed by the Engineering team. Create, review, execute, document and manage test strategies, test plans, re-usable test scenarios across both In-Sprint (DevOps) and End to End Integration Testing Coordinate defect management and triage functions, work cross-functionally to resolve issues and escalate to leadership as necessary. Responsible for the preparation of test environments and test data. Provide regular communication of project status and issues requiring escalation. Spear-head and manage Production releases and offer In-window testing support for both planned and unplanned releases (outages) Assist in providing guidance and mentorship for junior testers. Provide technical leadership and consultation with regards to quality practices, procedures and techniques. Write automated test scripts that allow for repeatable, reliable testing solutions. Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance. Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Education Level: Bachelor's Degree or EquivalentField of Study: Engineering, Computer ScienceYears of Experience: Generally requires 5-8 years related experience Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer
IT Skills: Gap Analysis, Test Strategies, Test Plans, Test Automation, Defect Management, Quality Control, Software Testing, Technical Leadership
Soft Skills: Communication Skills, Critical Thinking, Analytical Thinking, Adaptability, Teamwork, Leadership, Mentorship, Problem-Solving, Collaboration, Decision-Making, Time Management, Attention to Detail

Description: Office Administrator Global, Local, Total National Express Transit (NEXT) supporting Trinity Transportation is a rapidly growing provider of transit, paratransit, and shuttle services for transit authorities, municipalities and other clients across the country. NEXT is the US-based public transportation division of UK-based National Express Group, providers of nearly one billion safe journeys each year. We are currently seeking an Office Administrator for our Human Resources Department (HR) in Wyandotte, MI. Responsibilities: Administers various human resource plans and procedures for all organization personnel; assists in the development and implementation of personnel policies and procedures; ensures we follow the employee handbook and the policies and procedures manual. Participates in developing department goals, objectives and systems. Conducts recruitment effort for exempt and nonexempt personnel, students and temporary employees; conducts new-employee orientations; monitors career-pathing program; and writes and places advertisements. Handles employee relations counseling, outplacement counseling and exit interviewing. Participates in administrative staff meetings and attends other meetings and seminars. Assists in evaluation of reports, decisions and results of department in relation to established goals. Recommends new approaches, policies and procedures to continually improve efficiency of the department and services performed. Maintains human resource information system records and compiles reports from the database. Maintains compliance with federal, state and local employment and benefits laws and regulations. Performing various administrative tasks Build strong relationships with hiring managers and business partners to increase collaboration and drive process improvement. Create, track and manage requisitions from requisition to hire, including interview, background process and initial hire. Prepare new hire personnel files, ensuring all company- and DOT-required documentation is included, and managing the hand-off process to the General Manager or Safety Training Supervisor. Responsible for all new hire file audits and ensuring all recruiting documents have been collected during the hiring processes. Track Driver and Bus Assistant Applicants throughout entire recruiting and training cycle using Taleo, Excel, Google Docs and/or other programs. Communicates with Applicants, Trainees and Trainers to direct candidates to next steps within recruiting cycle. Assist with orders and reviews background reports (including motor vehicle reports (MVR), drug test, physicals, fingerprints, and criminal history) approving or denying candidates in accordance with state, federal, DOT and company guidelines and regulations. Coordinates the completion of accident history and drug/alcohol test results from previous employers for all Candidates holding Class A or B license. Conducts new driver orientations and behavioral-based interviews using Durham’s ADORE standards for selection of all Bus Assistant and Driver-candidates. Assists with other recruiting activities within department. Other tasks assigned by Management.ational Express Transit High School graduate or equivalent (2 year degree or more preferred) Previous HR experience preferred Excellent computer skills with knowledge of Word, Excel, and Outlook; and knowledge of basic office equipment Demonstrated ten-key and data entry skills; with ability to maintain accuracy and speed Basic clerical and math skills Excellent oral and written communication skills with excellent interpersonal skills Computer literacy, preferably in word processing and spreadsheets, Excellent oral communication skills to respond and present professionally to callers and visitors. Prioritization, organization, coordination and time management skills to develop and maintain manual and computerized filing systems, coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks to meet deadlines and apply protocols to coordinate flow of materials and correspondence in the Department. Demonstrated ability to effectively and diplomatically handle a wide range of demanding inquiries from a variety of internal and external sources. National Express LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. For more information please visit http://www.nationalexpresstransit.com or http://www.nellc.com. Company name is: Trinity Transportation Primary Location United States-Michigan-Wyandotte-Trinity Corporate, MI Work Locations Trinity Corporate, MI 4624 13th Street C/O Durham 4113 Wyandotte 48192 Job Operations Field Organization United States Bus Schedule Regular Employee Status Individual Contributor : Full-time Job Level Day Job Travel No Job Posting May 2, 2018, 10:28:17 AM
IT Skills: Human Resource Administration, Personnel Policies Development, Recruitment, New Employee Orientation, Employee Relations, HR Information System Management, Compliance with Employment Laws, Administrative Tasks, Documentation Management, Taleo, Excel, Google Docs
Soft Skills: Communication, Relationship Building, Collaboration, Process Improvement, Time Management, Organization, Prioritization, Problem Solving, Interpersonal Skills

Description: Level 1 Systems Administrator Diamond Game Enterprises Chatsworth, Los Angeles, CA Job Description SUMMARY _Overview of the position._ Manages and maintains at an advanced level all servers and related entities. Must be highly detail orientated. Extensive knowledge of Windows systems, networks and associated hardware and software. Extremely well versed in multiple areas including Windows Server 2008 R2 and higher, SQL Server 2008 R2 and higher, Active Directory Maintenance and Best Practices, Group Policy, Hyper-V Management & Replication, VMWare/vSAN Technologies, and the TCP/IP protocol suite. Experience supporting industry standard security policies, vulnerability scanning, and change configuration management. Experience with Sophos hardware and software (UTM Firewalls, RED devices, and Cloud AV products) a plus. Provides problem/resolution support and assists internal departments and field technicians with Diamond Game product upgrades and installs. Ability to work with support vendors and technology partners to ensure SLAs are adequately met. Monitors, manages, and maintains complex systems and network technology, bandwidth, performance, documentation, and metrics. The start time for this position is 6am with alternating after hours on-call support. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES _The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by an individual assigned to this job. Other duties may be assigned._ Supports the company's corporate and remotely implemented server/network environments. Assists with the maintenance of all technology related to both corporate and field Infrastructure systems. Provides on-call support for related systems. Follows technical direction per established policies and procedures. Maintains documentation related to design; utilizes formal change control processes. Provides recommendations to improve reliability and performance, reduce cost and anticipate company growth. Makes implementation decisions using best practices and a security-first mindset. Manages and maintains backup and recovery processes related to systems, networks, co-location site(s) and external sites. Manages users, computers, and group policies in addition to Active Directory itself, to support our IT operations. Collaborates with other departments for standards and practices Manages and maintains infrastructure components. Proactively monitors for performance, load balancing, bandwidth, and connectivity. Patches systems per internal requirements. Understanding of operating systems optimal configurations and best practices. Work with a mindset to ensure that company's policies and standards are followed. Ability to troubleshoot and resolve network issues reported by employees at corporate offices and field technicians across North America. Familiar with scripting languages including PowerShell. Knowledge of storage technology with the ability to provision storage according to best practices. Tracks work and time in ticket and project management systems. Creates and maintains documentation including diagrams, models, and procedures. Presents to all levels of the organization technical documents, presentations, and proposals. Understands and can communicate technical information effectively. INTERACTION Interacts with all levels of Diamond Game personnel, customers, and outside vendors. Must feel comfortable communicating in various media, such as written documentation, presentations, email, demonstrations, videos and training. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No direct supervisory responsibilities. EDUCATION/YEARS EXPERIENCE S./B.A. in Computer Science, Information Systems, Telecommunications OR equivalent experience 3+ years' experience working in a high-availability network environment Proficient knowledge in all areas of Windows system administration including enterprise backup solutions, anti-virus solutions, patch management and monitoring. Linux and VMWare Infrastructure experience a plus. 3+ years supporting corporate networks 3+ years supporting and evolving production and test environments. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES Familiarity with standard IT practices Strong desire to work in a team environment Excellent time management skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Experience working in a dynamic environment with strict project goal deadlines Intermediate level skills in Microsoft operating systems, office products, and email The candidate must be able to move and control up to 550 pounds with the aid of dollies and tools; able to lift and move 40 pounds short distances without mechanical aid and frequently lift and move 10 pounds. While performing duties onsite at customer locations, the employee may be exposed to noise levels ranging from quiet to loud. At times, working conditions may consist of moving and working around customers of gaming establishments. Has home Internet with reliable, high-speed Internet service with at least 20 Mbps Down and 5 Mbps Up. Ability to travel as needed, within Canada and the USA, on occasion for multiple days. Adheres to Company standards, core values and methodology Adheres to Company confidentiality and security requirements Must carry a company cell phone during business work hours and on-call hours Flexible hours as needed for projects Ability to perform duties under minimal to no supervision while exercising discretion and independent judgment while adhering to company policies.
IT Skills: Windows Server administration, Network administration, Hardware and software knowledge, Windows Server 2008 R2 and higher, SQL Server 2008 R2 and higher, Active Directory Maintenance, Group Policy management, Hyper-V Management & Replication, VMWare/vSAN Technologies, TCP/IP protocol suite, Industry standard security policies, Vulnerability scanning, Change configuration management, Sophos hardware and software, Backup and recovery processes, PowerShell scripting, Storage technology
Soft Skills: Detail-oriented, Problem-solving skills, Communication skills, Teamwork, Time management, Ability to work under minimal supervision, Adherence to company standards, Flexibility

Description: Your tasks and responsibilities About Bayer IT With our innovative products, we are contributing to finding solutions for some of the major challenges of our time. All the science we do and the resulting innovative products are designed to provide a better life for people across the world. To fulfill our mission, we embrace our LIFE values - Leadership, Integrity, Flexibility, and Efficiency. Our most important resource isn’t technical: it’s human. Our Information Technology(IT) Team collaborates across organizational boundaries and with external partners, focusing on innovative solutions to exceed our customers’ needs. We are currently seeking upcoming college graduates for our Entry-Level North America Information Technology College New Hire program. Identified candidates will start between January – June 2019 dependent upon graduation date. The primary responsibilities of this role, Assistant Analyst IT-Rotational Program, are to: Partner with experienced team members and other fellow college hires to learn how to be successful in your craft; Engage in software development, operational support, project management, or in new technologies like artificial intelligence, cloud computing, or other digital technology while delivering innovative solutions; Participate in various assignments; For your assignments you may travel to different Bayer U.S. facilities; with the goal of developing and challenging you for positions of greater responsibility and leadership; At the conclusion of the one-year program, you will continue on as a confident and productive IT practitioner in your team with a solid network established; Final assignments could be based in any one of our U.S. Bayer facilities. Who you are Your success will be driven by your demonstration of our LIFE values. More specifically related to this position, Bayer seeks an incumbent who possesses the following: Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree OR Master's Degree in Information Science, STEM(Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics) OR Business fields; OR High School DIploma OR GED and two or more years of equivalent work experience in IT; Degree must be confirmed within 6 months of your start date at Bayer; Willingness and flexibility to relocate or travel to other Bayer sites; Ability to travel domestically and/or internationally as required; US Citizen/US Permanent Resident. Preferred Qualifications: Overall GPA of 3.0 is preferred (GPA must be stated on the resume/unofficial transcripts upon initial application) to demonstrate applicable knowledge of educational degree; Previous IT related work experience a plus, including at least one internship experience. To all interested candidates An unofficial copy of your transcripts or a copy of your course schedule to date, including grades must be submitted with your application in order to be considered further. (Screen shot, etc. will be acceptable). Your application Bayer offers a wide variety of competitive compensation and benefits programs. If you meet the requirements of this unique opportunity, and you have the "Passion to Innovate" and the "Power to Change", we encourage you to apply now. Job postings will remain open for a minimum of ten business days and are subject to immediate closure thereafter without additional notice. Description: We’re looking for a mid to senior Full Stack developer to serve on a multidisciplinary project team with career civil servants, actively demonstrating the value of iterative development and user-centered design. Our team is working to improve a wide range of city services, which have included researching and redesigning our permitting processes ( http://permittingatx.com/ ) (Github) ( https://github.com/cityofaustin/Residential-Permitting ), prototyping ways to change behaviors around recycling and composting ( http://www.austintexas.gov/department/austin-resource-recovery ), building the next generation of CTXFloods ( http://floods.austintexas.io ) (Github) ( https://github.com/cityofaustin/ctxfloods ), dev and creating city-wide standards for interface design, web infrastructure, and automated testing with Austin.gov ( https://alpha.austin.gov/ ) (Github) ( https://github.com/cityofaustin/janis ). You’ll also serve as an expert and educator in your discipline, establishing new practices that can work across departments and providing guidance and training for other fellows and city staff. \-------------- What you'll do \-------------- Contribute to Open Source Software projects using Github for collaboration and code review. For a flavor of our current stack, we maintain projects that use: React.js (Javascript), Python (Django), Node.js, Jekyll (Ruby), Apollo & GraphQL, Docker, Heroku, AWS. Work with other developers on Office of Design & Delivery team to establish new standards for web development based on modern languages, frameworks, and best practices Serve as a core contributor on multi-disciplinary project teams to improve city services Assist in scoping and prototyping activities for future design and development projects Work with stakeholders to assess legacy systems and identify opportunities for improved performance and the sustainability of future systems Be visible to staff and stakeholders and regularly undertake activities to engage and build trust with people involved in area of work Engage with the wider web development community, identifying best practices we can adopt and sharing our experiences Assist in recruiting, screening, and interview processes for hiring. Commit to making what we build fully accessible to the people we serve Write blog posts that share what we make and how we make it \---------------------- What we're looking for \---------------------- 3-5+ years of professional experience developing large-scale applications and services Detailed understanding of and experience building server-side web applications and services using modern languages, MVC frameworks, performant database queries and open source software. Detailed understanding of and experience building client-side web interfaces and applications using modern JavaScript frameworks, web standards, and open source software Detailed understanding of and experience with continuous delivery, continuous integration testing, and cloud platforms Ability to engage with a wide range of digital specialists and stakeholders to define the best approaches to a problem Ability to quickly become familiar with emerging technologies and practices A passion for public service and a commitment to doing the hard work that’s necessary to improve our city services \--------------------------------------------- What your interview experience will look like \--------------------------------------------- Initial Application & Minimum Qualification Check FAQ Coffee or Google Hangout Technical Homework Challenge Onsite Interview (when possible), meet the team \---------------------------- More Information On Our Work \---------------------------- Office of Design and Delivery ( http://odd.austintexas.io/ ) - get more information on our projects, processes and people and how they are supported within the City Austin.gov Github Repositories - look into the code behind our current project to support content writing for city staff and service delivery to Austin residents via a new City site (Resident Site ( https://github.com/cityofaustin/janis ), Content Management System ( https://github.com/cityofaustin/joplin ), City Staff Interface) ( https://github.com/cityofaustin/pearl ) Recent Past Projects CTXFloods ( http://floods.austintexas.io )- Improving data archiving and delivery of road closures due to flooding (Github ( https://github.com/cityofaustin/ctxfloods )) PermittingATX ( http://permittingatx.com/ )- Simplifying navigating the residential permitting process (Github ( https://github.com/cityofaustin/Residential-Permitting )) Grackle ( https://grackle.austintexas.io/ ) - Improving visibility into City projects (Github ( https://github.com/cityofaustin/grackl )) \-------------------------------------- Office of Design & Delivery Values \-------------------------------------- Open by default. Hard problems are solved through collaboration and diverse community. We use and build open source code by default. And we evangelize our methods and practices across government. Everyone has positive intent. Communication is hard. By assuming our peers want what is best, we believe we can find the best in them. Strong opinions weakly held. It’s important to have confidence and passion in our arguments. And we believe It’s also important to consider that you may be wrong and that all disagreements should be honest and respectful. We work from an understanding that everyone has different, though complementary, problem solving styles. Balance short term wins and long term outcomes. We believe that every technical decision has alternative solutions and we must balance between shipping quickly and shipping cautiously. We think through long-term possibilities, opportunities, and consequences for our short term goals. Default to action. We believe in the cycle of Learning and Doing to move projects and ideas forward. Everybody has something to teach. We believe that teaching compassionately helps us learn. We all have room to grow along multiple axis of skills. We believe our team members aren’t expected to know everything, and we support them when they are stuck. Learning is ongoing. We believe that passionate curiosity drives exceptional work. There are no such thing as experts, only fast learners. Coding should be fun. The best work comes from a place of passion. When inspiration strikes we want to encourage each other to build cool things.
IT Skills: React.js, Python (Django), Node.js, Jekyll (Ruby), Apollo & GraphQL, Docker, Heroku, AWS, Modern languages, MVC frameworks, Performant database queries, Web standards, Continuous delivery, Continuous integration testing, Cloud platforms
Soft Skills: User-centered design, Collaboration, Communication, Problem-solving, Adaptability, Passion for public service, Teaching and mentoring, Continuous learning, Decision-making

Description: This position reports to the Manager of Quality Data and Analytics. The Supervisor, Quality Initiative Analytics will oversee activities in support of the client initiatives and will serve as the lead for the analytics, metrics and measurement of the initiatives run to support Star rating improvement. This position will supervise team members and act as a liaison between the initiative execution team and the analytics team, as well as participate and/or lead group discussions. RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS: Manages the oversight of analytics staff to ensure targeting criteria, metrics and measurement of client initiatives are completed and accurate Manages and monitors multiple projects simultaneously by developing initiative project plans. Establishes work priorities and assigns work to team members as defined by the project plan(s) to assure client initiative requirements and deadlines are met and are within budget. Responsible for developing targeting strategies to maximize outcomes and minimize cost Reviews, maintains and provides status on data and analytic efforts Provides guidance and recommendations on client initiatives Leads the development and implementation of all data aspects of client initiatives Assists with ensuring that appropriate cross-team coordination, communication, and design approaches are facilitated. Identifies and resolves challenges related to data and metrics to fulfill client expectations. Responsible for reporting client outcomes. Ensures that appropriate cross-team initiative training is occurring. Acts as a primary liaison to team leadership and cross teams for timely resolution of problems. Supervises and promotes the professional development of assigned staff. Participates in development of annual departmental budget, monitors budget, and identifies budget discrepancies. Researches cause and makes recommendations. Responsible for balancing workload to optimize the effectiveness of the department. DIRECTION EXERCISED: Directly supervises exempt and non-exempt staff in accordance with company policies and applicable Federal and State Laws. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, effectively interviewing, hiring, terminating, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and counseling employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems; supporting and encouraging the engagement process. _This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required._
IT Skills: Analytics, Metrics, Measurement, Data analysis, Project management, Targeting strategies, Data management, Reporting, Budget management, Cross-team coordination
Soft Skills: Leadership, Communication, Team management, Problem-solving, Decision-making, Project prioritization, Relationship management, Training and development, Budget analysis, Workload balancing

Description: Qualifications All required qualifications must be documented on application materials. Required: BA/BS in the biological sciences or a combination of related education and work experience to equal four years Candidates must be comfortable working with mice and be willing to learn new techniques Flexibility and enthusiasm for learning Position will require both independent work and the ability to work within and support a team of graduate students and post-doctoral fellows Must be detail oriented and have good communication skills Preferred: Previous hands-on laboratory experience, particularly involving infectious agents and mouse handling Classroom or other experience in immunology and/or molecular biology About the Job Job description: The successful candidate will be joining a team of scientists continuing a newly established research direction examining the impact of infectious history on the immune system (Nature 532:512). This is a unique opportunity to participate in cutting-edge research projects and learn a broad range of current immunological techniques in mouse models. Close training and mentoring will be provided, with the expectation that over time self-sufficiency will grow and scientific data will be generated independently for publication and co-authorship. This position requires working within a BSL-3 level facility which mandates both security and health clearances. Responsibilities Mouse colony maintenance and organization (50%) Experimental procedures such as: blood and tissue collection, infection of mice, in vitro cell culture (25%) Assist other staff in their ongoing experimental studies (10%) Manage laboratory equipment operation and maintenance (5%) Communicate with veterinary staff and BSL-3 management as needed (5%) Other duties as assigned (5%) The University of Minnesota offers a comprehensive benefits package including: Competitive wages, paid holidays, vacation and sick leave Low cost medical, dental, and pharmacy plans Health care and dependent daycare flexible spending accounts Excellent retirement plans with employer match Disability and employer paid life insurance Wellbeing program with reduced insurance premiums Tuition reimbursement opportunities covering 75%-100% of eligible tuition Student loan forgiveness opportunity Opportunities for growth and promotion Employee Assistance Program For more information regarding benefits: https://humanresources.umn.edu/sites/humanresources.umn.edu/files/2018_tcd- cslr-75100-ben-0105-7.pdf How To Apply Applications must be submitted online. To be considered for this position, please click the Apply button and follow the instructions. You will be given the opportunity to complete an online application for the position and attach a cover letter and resume. Additional documents may be attached after application by accessing your "My Activities" page and uploading documents there. To request an accommodation during the application process, please e-mail employ@umn.edu or call (612) 624-UOHR (8647). Diversity The University recognizes and values the importance of diversity and inclusion in enriching the employment experience of its employees and in supporting the academic mission. The University is committed to attracting and retaining employees with varying identities and backgrounds. The University of Minnesota provides equal access to and opportunity in its programs, facilities, and employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, gender, age, marital status, disability, public assistance status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. To learn more about diversity at the U: http://diversity.umn.edu. Background Check Information Any offer of employment is contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. Our presumption is that prospective employees are eligible to work here. Criminal convictions do not automatically disqualify finalists from employment. About the U of M The University of Minnesota, Twin Cities (UMTC) The University of Minnesota, Twin Cities (UMTC), is among the largest public research universities in the country, offering undergraduate, graduate, and professional students a multitude of opportunities for study and research. Located at the heart of one of the nation's most vibrant, diverse metropolitan communities, students on the campuses in Minneapolis and St. Paul benefit from extensive partnerships with world-renowned health centers, international corporations, government agencies, and arts, nonprofit, and public service organizations.
IT Skills: BA/BS in the biological sciences, Comfort with working with mice, Previous laboratory experience with infectious agents and mouse handling, Classroom experience in immunology and/or molecular biology, Experience with blood and tissue collection, mouse infection, and in vitro cell culture
Soft Skills: Flexibility and enthusiasm for learning, Detail-oriented, Good communication skills
Education: Skills related to education:, BA/BS in the biological sciences, Classroom experience in immunology and/or molecular biology

Description: Director, Analytics & Data Operations 18WD29541 Americas-United States of America-California-San Francisco Director, Analytics & Data Operations Location: San Francisco, CA- United States Job ID: 18WD29541 Position Overview Our Global Sales Operations team defines Autodesk’s go-to-market strategy and designs the systems that make it run efficiently. We work on exciting and meaningful projects that impact all functions of our business. As a leader on our team you will be constantly learning. You will tackle complex projects and questions and partner closely with our Marketing, Sales, Customer Success teams to build powerful analytical tools. As we grow and scale our business, we are seeking a leader who can define, scale, and deliver on the analytics and insights necessary to drive the business. The role will span high-level strategy to aspects of everyday sales tactics; you will work closely with senior executives to achieve consensus on key issues and have the opportunity to hire and manage a team of analysts, while simultaneously figuring out how to string together a complicated dataset to provide predictive learning capabilities. Responsibilities Create an advocate for a true vision around analytics and how it will fuel our sales growth Grow, expand, and govern the use of Salesforce Einstein Analytics Construct and automate dashboards for key performance metrics around pipeline, account management, and forecasting Create executive presentations for Autodesk sales leadership Build sales tools and integrate others, such as buyer readiness and early warning signals Be on point for Salesforce customer data quality (Account and Opportunity assignments) and data operations Perform ad hoc analysis across multiple data sets, including Salesforce, Marketo, product databases and more Be a primary liaison and collaborator with other Autodesk data teams, including our Enterprise Data Management and Finance organizations Develop and lead a growing team of talented analytical people! Minimum Qualifications 7-10 years of experience in an analytical role within a technology business. Preference for Sales Strategy, Business Intelligence/Analytics, Management Consulting Bachelor's degree; MBA a plus Preferred Qualifications Superb analytical skills, technical aptitude and attention to detail Exposure to, and proficiency in, Salesforce.com Experience with SQL, Tableau, Looker, Qlik and/(or similar analytical packages) Excellent and diverse communication and project management abilities Extensive track record of building high-quality and complex spreadsheets, models and presentations Interest in the SaaS/CRM/Collaboration industry and an appreciation for Quip's approach to the market About Autodesk With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world. LI-POST At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world.
IT Skills: Salesforce Einstein Analytics, SQL, Tableau, Looker, Qlik, Business Intelligence/Analytics
Soft Skills: Leadership, Project Management, Communication, Analytical Skills, Attention to Detail

Description: Occidental Petroleum Corporation (NYSE: OXY) is an international oil and gas exploration and production company, and its OxyChem subsidiary is a major North American chemical manufacturer. We are one of the largest U.S. oil and gas companies, based on equity market capitalization, with more than 40,000 employees and contractors worldwide. Our greatest asset has been and will continue to be our people. We are looking for an experienced and motivated individual to fill the position of Full-stack Developer within our IT Information Systems Software Development group based in Houston, Texas. Looking for an experienced full stack developer. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing software solutions to address complex business issues. The ideal applicant will able to thrive in a highly collaborative workplace and actively engage in the development process. This is an excellent career opportunity for a professional with an impressive development background and excellent interpersonal skills. Below is list of the main responsibilities for this position. Contribute to the entire SDLC Develop functional and fast-responsive web applications, using markup languages Maintain websites Elaborate mobile-based and web-based features Troubleshoot apps for bugs Fix bugs if necessary and improve usability Improve apps for maximum speed Troubleshoot UI and improve its performance accordingly Employ the latest technology in order to re-built legacy apps Integrate UI elements with server-side ones Detect and fulfill front-end and back-end requirements Perform training and support activities Develop reusable code Collaborate with developers, server administrators, cyber security and customers. Tailor web solutions to their needs and requirements Perform code reviews Qualifications BS in computer science, engineering or equivalent degree 2+ years of proven experience as software developer using C, Angular, JavaScript, CSS Understanding of software quality assurance principles and continuous integration Time management and analytical skills Ability to perform several tasks at the same time Ability to translate requirements into a finished project Communication skills to collaborate with customers, developments, BA, QA, CSM Problem-solving ability Desired Qualifications Involved on mobile application projects that utilized Ionic or Xamarin Involved on project that utilized Microsoft Azure or AWS. Worked in Scrum Agile environment Familiar with Jira and Confluence Occidental is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Individual with Disability/Veteran Status
IT Skills: Full-stack development, Software development life cycle (SDLC), Web application development, Mobile application development, Troubleshooting, Bug fixing, Usability improvement, Speed optimization, UI performance optimization, Integration of UI elements with server-side, Front-end and back-end requirements, Code review, Reusable code development, Collaboration with developers and other stakeholders
