Description: Gathers and drives stakeholder requirements and product vision through the planning analysis, development, and testing phases. Responsible for working closely within IT and the end user community and assists to define, plan and monitor business and technical projects impacting Noble’s information strategy. Must be able to work at a detailed level while maintaining a broader view of overall business goals and objectives. Responsible for the timely delivery and quality of information systems projects that meet the business goals and objectives established within area of responsibility. Detailed Description Translates stakeholder requirements into various documentation deliverables such as functional specifications, use cases, workflow/process diagrams, and data flow/data model diagrams. Assists in the design of Business Intelligence dashboards, scorecards, charts/graphs, drill-downs, and dynamic reports to meet the new information needs. Assists in the development of logical and physical data models to create and maintain database schemas in support of BI/DW requirements. Assists the BI Solution Reporting lead for the installation, configuration and administration of Business Intelligence applications Assists in establishing, maintaining and ensuring compliance with standards and procedures for design, development, testing, and documentation, contributing to high quality, reliable and serviceable systems that meet or exceed business needs. Job Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or Engineering Typically requires 3 years of experience in relevant application design and development methods, business requirements analysis, software integration, operational readiness, service level agreements and system support of a continuous operating environment. Two years of experience in assisting in designing, building, deploying and sustaining enterprise Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse reporting solutions. Two years of experience working within an established project management framework. Design and development experience with Business Intelligence and/or reporting systems. Experience designing and building dashboards and analytics solutions using tools like Oracle OBIEE, Tibco Spotfire, and/or PowerBI. Experience developing ETL processes using tools like Informatica or Oracle Data Integrator. Additional Details Normal office environment Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship.

Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started. Facebook is seeking a Hardware Engineer to join our Data Center Connectivity team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly growing infrastructure efficiently operates and our innovative services delivered. The successful candidate is responsible for new product introductions in our data center connectivity installations, including new builds and retrofits. The Hardware Engineer will work with design, development, and sourcing teams; subject matter experts; vendors; and DCC field teams to assure successful product introductions. Responsibilities include proactively identifying pain points and opportunities, and advocating effectively for new or modified hardware as needed. Full lifecycle engagement is required, with lessons learned from field deployments rolled into future product introductions. The design engineer needs to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders, assuring DCC requirements are represented prior to product down-selection. This position is full-time and is based in our main office in Menlo Park, CA. RESPONSIBILITIES Work closely with structured cable design team and field installation team to identify pain points and business needs for new or modified connectivity hardware, and create optimized product solution with high quality and low cost Execute prototype product validation test plan, analyze test data with statistical model, draft test report, and present intermediate and final reports to cross-functional teams Create and complete new product part number requests (PNR) and manage product life cycle changes with Engineering Change Order (ECO) Review pre-production verification test plans, assuring key risks are addressed in the product pilot phase Able to travel up to 15% of the time MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or Physical Science 3+ years track record of developing or specifying fiber optic cables and connector related products Knowledge of fiber optic component, cabling, and interconnect products, technologies, and standards Experience in statistical data analysis Experience with product life cycle management (PLM) process Experience providing solutions to problems and meeting deadlines Experience engaging stakeholders PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Advanced degree Experience using a software tool for statistical data analysis such as JMP Experience using Agile as product life-cycle management tool Data center or other mission critical development experience
IT Skills: Hardware Engineering, Product Development, Fiber Optic Cables, Product Life Cycle Management, Statistical Data Analysis, Engineering Change Order (ECO), Mechanical Engineering
Soft Skills: Problem Solving, Collaboration, Communication, Project Management, Flexibility
Education: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or Physical Science

Description: About InterDigital InterDigital develops fundamental wireless technologies that are at the core of mobile devices, networks, and services worldwide. We solve many of the industry's most critical and complex technical challenges, inventing solutions for more efficient broadband networks and a richer multimedia experience years ahead of market deployment. InterDigital has licenses and strategic relationships with many of the world's leading wireless companies. Founded in 1972, InterDigital is listed on NASDAQ and is included in the S&P; MidCap 400® index. Summary InterDigital is looking for a Director of Facilities to lead the facilities and real estate functions of the company. This will involve oversight and direction of day to day operations as well as strategic real estate planning and project management of real estate initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a well-balanced approach between hands-on contribution, management of procured services and be experienced in project management and departmental leadership. Essential Responsibilities Real Estate Develop and implement a comprehensive and pro-active real estate strategy for the global real estate portfolio, partnering closely with senior leadership and stakeholders to align the real estate strategy with the business strategy. Manage and maintain the portfolio of leases as well as tracking and managing lease and expense costs Lead real estate projects for new office establishment as well as office moves Working with stakeholders and real estate brokers to identify requirements and shortlist suitable locations Project Management of contractors, architects and other vendors to ensure construction and build out are delivered on time and in budget Co-ordinate move of employees to new office and close out of old office Define and monitor real estate benchmarks for offices, costs, occupancy Develop and maintain relationship with building landlords; resolve issues and concerns between the parties Facilities Operations Provide day to day management and oversight of facilities staff, vendors/contractors and office management services across InterDigital Offices. Shipping/Receiving Office/Cubicle assignment/floorplans Security systems, badges, alarms and security camera Housekeeping/carpet cleaning Landscaping/snow removal Coffee and vending services Maintains cost effectiveness of supplies and services of the department, recommends improvements in services, personnel, and resources Define hybrid personnel support model of internal dedicated, internal shared and external resources Ensure compliance with health and safety standards, industry, government and building codes Oversee and direct ongoing building maintenance including management of personnel and vendors engaged in equipment installation, repair and preventative maintenance such as HVAC systems, lighting, plumbing. Safety and security systems Conduct RFP (Request for Proposals) or RFI (Request for Information) on services and products to support office services and find ways to reduce spend Functions as the liaison between the Company and Building management, public utility, environmental and energy agencies Development, analysis and accurate reporting and forecasting of budgets Employee may occasional be required to life items up to 50 pounds Up to 25% local travel and 10% regional and international travel may be required Required Education and Experience Bachelor’s Degree and 10 years’ experience including 7 years of leadership experience with at least 5 years of direct supervisory and management experience Prior enterprise responsibility for corporate office facilities/real estate function Experience with corporate office design, construction, and/or maintenance and a track record of managing successful capital improvement projects Experience leading real estate projects (site selection, new build outs, office moves) Strong Project Management Skills Global experience desired Demonstrated ability to work with flexibility, efficiency and diplomacy both individually and as part of a team effort Ability to develop, analyze, and interpret project and operational budgets and requests for funding proposals Location: Wilmington, DE or Conshohocken, PA _InterDigital is federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances._ ___This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, Description: At Abbott, we're committed to helping people live their best possible life through the power of health. For more than 125 years, we've brought new products and technologies to the world - in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals - that create more possibilities for more people at all stages of life. Today, 99,000 of us are working to help people live not just longer, but better, in the more than 150 countries we serve. As a Business Analyst, you will provide high quality support for Abbott Workday Human Resource environment. You will interact with our customers to help resolve customer issues with Corporate HR systems and processes. You're a great match if you enjoy delivering excellence, possess fantastic trouble- shooting skills and enjoy a challenge. Key Responsibilities : Collect and analyze business requirements and design, implement and customize business system and standard operating procedures accordingly. Design, develop and implement business intelligence solutions and computer systems to meet business requirements within time and cost constraints. Configure and validate HRIS applications in SaaS Workday Cloud solution using functional system configurations, business process configurations and Enterprise Interface Builder web service tool. Facilitate review sessions with functional owners, subject matter experts and end users. Configure and perform performance tuning, optimization and testing of business processes and building reports. Develop plans for system operations and technical procedures for cost-effectiveness and clarify program objectives using optimization analysis. Work on complex service oriented architecture design and implementation for various business operations Assist with global HR system projects. Conduct gap/root cause analysis to find gaps & recommend alternatives to streamline process flows. Document issue resolution in Incident tracking system (Remedy and Salesforce) Work closely with the project team to track issues through to resolution and resolve queries. Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures. Experience, Skills desired: Solid understanding of business processes in ERP System support experience in Workday Human Capital Management, HR portal including employee and manager self-service is preferred, and\or support experience with web-based and client/server applications. Solid understanding to assess and design ERP internal controls. Strong analytical and technical skills Must have excellent verbal/written communication, user interaction & interpersonal skills and work well in a team environment. Position Accountability / Scope: Analyst Business Systems will report to HRIT Cross Functional Support Lead. This position has no budget responsibility Minimum Education: The minimum education requirement to perform these job duties is a Bachelor’s/Master’s degree or equivalent in Commerce, Business Administration, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or 1-3 years of application development and support experience.

Description: Emser Tile, LLC, the nationwide supplier of high-quality floor covering products servicing world-leading retailers, builders and contractors seeks an experienced DC WAREHOUSE ASSOCIATE 2- HOUSTON,TX. Job Summary Emser Tile and Natural Stone, a nationwide supplier of high-quality floor covering products servicing world-leading retailers, builders and contractors seeks an experienced Warehouse Associate for our Central Distribution Center in Houston, TX This position supports our Distribution Center in the receipt and shipment of flooring products to our customers. Key Responsibilities Inspecting, identifying, handling, consolidating labeling, stocking, picking, packing and shipping inventory per the company’s standard operating procedures. Comply with all company policies, procedures and instructions given by all managers, supervisors and leads. Perform all job duties and procedures in a safe manner. Deal promptly with inventory discrepancies. Ensure efficient and professional handling of will-call customers. Required Experience: Qualifications 1 year plus of distribution/wholesale experience. 1 year plus of forklift experience. Must be forklift certified. Must have some knowledge of basic inventory control practices. Ability to accurately count/track product that is being received or shipped. Ability to work in a high volume/production working environment. Ability to follow all company policies, procedures and instructions. Ability to work the required schedule and demonstrate punctuality. Ability to work overtime as needed. Work diligently and in a safe manner. Excellent Customer service skills. Must be team oriented. Must have basic computer skills. Work Environment Exposure to moving mechanical parts; loud noise levels. Occasional exposure to fumes or airborne particles. Exposure to all weather conditions, including hot, cold, wet/dry weather and wide range of temperatures (Indoors and Outdoors). Moving over and/or around obstacles on the ground and working in the vicinity of operating forklifts. Physical Requirements Standing/walking for long periods. Bend, stoop and kneel Reach with hands and arms; grabbing and grasping. Lift, carry, push, pull and/or move up to 65 pounds. Ability to judge distances. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. About Emser: The Emser Tradition of Excellence Comes From its People... Since its establishment in 1968, Emser Tile has become the leading supplier of the world's finest tile and natural stone. Through our international production network and product development expertise, we offer myriad of possibilities that help retailers, contractors, homebuilders, commercial builders, architects & designers bring their ideas to life. Although Emser has grown rapidly, our on-going dedication to outstanding quality and service remains the hallmark of our success. Emser is always seeking knowledgeable, career-minded professionals to become a part of our team and help drive our growth and expansion into new and existing markets. When it comes to challenging and rewarding career opportunities, Emser is the place to be! As an Emser employee, you will enjoy healthcare coverage including medical, prescription drug, vision and dental care. Your financial well-being will be supported through our 401(k) plan. Moreover, we offer a challenging & rewarding professional work environment. Emser's employee benefits package also includes: Paid Vacation Time Paid Holidays Life Insurance AD&D Insurance Voluntary Long Term Disability Career Development: Emser provides ongoing opportunities for professional training, and encourages internal advancement and mobility.
IT Skills: Forklift operation, Inventory control, Shipping and receiving procedures, Basic computer skills
Soft Skills: Attention to detail, Time management, Communication skills, Customer service skills, Teamwork, Adaptability

Description: Description The Department of Children, Youth, and Families is a new cabinet agency in Washington State that has been established for the purpose of delivering existing services in a way that produces better outcomes for children, youth, and families served by the State of Washington. We're looking for professionals to join our team to help build DCYF, working toward the common goal of eliminating child and youth outcome disparities based on race and ethnicity. The vision from the legislature is that "All Washington's children and youth grow up safe and healthy-thriving physically, emotionally, and educationally, nurtured by family and community." Find out more at www.dcyf.wa.gov. The Opportunity: As the Business Data and Integration Architect (ITS5) you will be working on complex, time sensitive projects which can require coordination across multiple systems, agencies, and programs and typically have statewide impact, and are legislatively mandated. The Data and Integration Architect is the highest technical resource responsible for analyzing and recommending efficiencies at the enterprise level for data collections, integrations, linkages warehousing, and incorporating complex cross functional analytics and reporting. Key Responsibilities Responsible for analyzing and recommending efficiencies at the enterprise level for data collections, integrations, linkages, warehousing, and incorporating complex cross functional analytics and reporting Leads Requirements meetings for new data requests and functionality with internal and external stakeholders. Manage Product Owner and Stakeholder expectations. Provides data as required to assist legislative requests, DEL programs, and external agencies. Assist DEL Legislative Liaison and fiscal team during legislative sessions. This full-time, permanent position is located in Olympia, Washington. We are a mobile workforce that offers telework options, flexible work schedules, sit/stand stations, free DASH shuttle service to shops and restaurants downtown, and we have an infants at work program. We are looking for an applicant with the following required qualifications: Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, data management, information systems or related field from an accredited college or university whose accreditation is recognized by the U.S. Department of Education or the Council for Higher Education (CHEA). Four (4) years of information technology experience such as consulting, analyzing, designing, programming, configuring, installing and/or maintaining computer software applications, hardware, telecommunications, or network infrastructure equipment, directing projects, providing customer or technical support in information technology; or administering or supervising staff that performed work in any of these information technology disciplines.Demonstrates the following abilities: Ability to conduct business process reviews and document requirements Listening skills in order to understand what people say and to detect what they might be hesitant to say, and interpret the requests into actual business needs Interviewing and questioning skills, to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information Thinking on your feet, to go beyond planned questions and respond to whatever input you hear from the people you are interviewing. Analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements Systems thinking skills, to be able to see the interactions and relationships between the people, processes, and technology involved in an environment Facilitation skills to lead requirements gathering meetings, decision making, and present the business case Leadership skills to create a collaborative environment and influence people to move toward a common goal Communication skills to communicate information effectively and in appropriate format and detail to customers, managers, and technical staff Organizational skills, to work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information, often while managing requests across multiple projects. Business analysis techniques such as workflows, user stories, prototypes to illustrate the requirements. Excellent working knowledge of MS office suite, current versions of internet browsers and graphic capture software. Desirable Qualifications: Know principles of enterprise information architecture and modeling. Understanding of Microsoft SQL databases and Business Intelligence (BI) Business Analyst Body of Knowledge (BABOK) certification or training Agile certification (CSM) Experience with Agile software development Lean Certification or training Strong presentation and client facing skills. Excellent interpersonal, leadership, and teamwork skills. Self-direction, confidence, effective communication and presentation skills. Capability to get results in a fast paced, complex, often ambiguous environment. Ability to analyze data, spot trends, and address barriers. Regular and reliable attendance. Willingness to travel as required. How do I apply? In addition to completing the online application, applicants must attach the following documents to their profile in order to be considered for this position: Letter of interest describing how you meet the specific qualifications for this position Supplemental Questions Supplemental Information: This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement. This means employees are required to pay regular union dues or non-association fees within 30 calendar days of their start date. DCYF is an equal opportunity employer and supports equity, diversity, inclusion and respect. Need accommodation throughout the application/interview process? Unable to apply on-line? Contact the Recruitment team at dcyf.jobs@dcyf.wa.gov or (360) 628-0114 or the Telecommunications Device for the Deaf at 800-833-6388. Experiencing technical difficulties creating, accessing or completing your application? Call NEOGOV toll-free at (855)524-5627 or email support@neogov.com. To take advantage of Veteran's preference please attach your DD-214, member 4 long form, or your NGB-22.Please black out your social security number prior to attaching. General suggestions for creating a good application packet: Read the job posting very carefully. Find out as much as you can about the position. Make sure you are very diligent in following all the application instructions. Include all requested documentation. Make sure your application and supplemental question responses address how you meet each of the required and desired qualifications. Carefully read each of the supplemental questions and respond completely to each one. Pay careful attention to each component of the question, providing examples, and thoroughly describing when and where you achieved the proficiency level, and detail the types of work you performed, the work products, etc., to demonstrate 'how'. Specifically include all of your work experiences doing the same or similar work, especially if you reference work in these jobs in describing when/where you gained proficiency level skills. Make sure your application reflects your best writing. The initial screening will be based on the content and completeness of your application and the materials submitted. All information may be verified and documentation may be required. Applications with comments such as "see attachments" or "N/A" in the supplemental question responses will be considered incomplete.
IT Skills: Data collection, Data integration, Data warehousing, Analytics, Reporting, Business process reviews, Requirement documentation, Listening skills, Interviewing skills, Analytical skills, Systems thinking, Facilitation skills, Leadership skills, Communication skills, Organizational skills, Business analysis techniques, MS Office proficiency, Internet browsers, Graphic capture software, Enterprise information architecture, Microsoft SQL databases, Business Intelligence (BI), Agile methodology, Lean principles, Presentation skills
Soft Skills: Leadership, Communication, Interpersonal skills, Teamwork, Self-direction, Confidence, Analytical thinking, Adaptability, Results-oriented, Time management, Attention to detail, Conflict resolution, Decision-making

Description: Salary Range $55,789-$72,526/annually, DOE Grade 117 Work Calendar 12 Months Job Summary The Business Systems Analyst will provide analysis, design, development, testing, and implementation of processes used in Information Technology. Business Systems Analyst will act as a liaison between functional user and technical systems groups; between internal and external stakeholders in the development or modification of typically complex information systems. Essential Functions 25% - Collects, analyzes and interprets business process information to identify the scope and impact of business problems; documents process workflow 20% - Facilitates implementation of business and/or technology solutions including acceptance testing processes 20% - Researches industry standards, trends, best practices and emerging technologies and makes recommendations for implementation 15% - Provides professional level staff support to committees, advisory groups and others that may include performing research, authoring documents and making presentations; facilitates team meetings 10% - Writes project documents that include defining strategy, resources and timeframes 10% - Performs other duties as assigned Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in information technology or related field and two years of business systems analysis experience including business process design, business requirements definition, workflow documentation, project coordination and acceptance testing. OR An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job such as those listed above, unless otherwise subject to any other requirements set forth in law or regulation Desired Qualifications At least 4 years of experience in a business process analysis role working directly with an Information Technology department Experience facilitating institution-wide IT systems or processes Knowledge or Skills Possessed: (higher Education Experience preferred) Principles and techniques of facilitating process analysis Methods and techniques of collecting, analyzing, and re-engineering business processes Diagnosing problems, determining business issues and developing and implementing solutions Compiling information or data and authoring reports and preparing presentations for internal and external stakeholders. Special Working Conditions May be required to sit for a prolonged period of time; viewing a computer monitor How to Apply Applicants must submit a cover letter that details how the applicant meets minimum and desired qualifications. Applications without a cover letter will be incomplete and will not be considered. Please ensure your resume and cover letter provide the following items: Clearly illustrate how prior experience, knowledge and education meet the minimum and desired qualifications for this position. Provide employment history in a month/year format (e.g., 09/07 to 10/11) including job title, job duties, and name of employer for each position. Three professional references, preferably current and/or former supervisors. If references are not provided in resume upon application, they will be requested at time of interview. EEO Information Maricopa County Community College District (MCCCD) will not discriminate, nor tolerate discrimination in employment or education, against any applicant, employee, or student because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status (including document abuse), age, disability, veteran status or genetic information.
IT Skills: Business Systems Analysis, Business Process Design, Workflow Documentation, Project Coordination, Acceptance Testing, Researching Industry Standards and Technologies, Writing Project Documents
Soft Skills: Communication, Problem-Solving, Critical Thinking, Facilitation, Presentation Skills
Education: Related to Education:, Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology or related field

Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started. In this role, your primary responsibility will be to partner with key stakeholders and lead the development of an analytics program to support and enable the continued growth critical to Facebook’s Data Center organization. You will be responsible for creating end to end analytics programs, from data sourcing to surfacing insights and driving action, for various aspects of Facebook’s global data center operations. You will also help translate data and identify efficiency opportunities. You will be expected to use data to provide meaningful recommendations and actionable strategies to key stakeholders, and develop best practices, including streamlining of data sources and related programmatic initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a passion for working in white space and creating impact from the ground up in a fast-paced environment. Additionally, you will have a proven track record of thought leadership and impact in developing similar analytics and metrics based programs. This position is part of the Infrastructure Data Center team and located in our Menlo Park office. RESPONSIBILITIES Leverage data and business principles to create and drive large scale FB Data Center programs. Define and develop the program for metrics creation, data collection, modeling, and reporting the operational performance of Facebook’s data centers. Work cross-functionally to define problem statements, collect data, build analytical models and make recommendations. Be a self-starter, motivated by a passion for developing the best possible solutions to problems. Identify and implement streamlined processes for data reporting and communication. Use analytical models to identify insights that are used to drive key decisions across the organization. Routinely communicate metrics, trends and other key indicators to senior leadership. Provide leadership and mentorship to other members of the team. Lead and support various ad hoc projects, as needed, in support of Facebook’s Data Center strategy. Build and maintain data driven optimization models, experiments, forecasting algorithms and capacity constraint models. Leverage tools like R, Tableau, PHP, Python, Hadoop & SQL to drive efficient analytics. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Management Science). 5+ years of prior experience in a role with heavy emphasis on data analysis and metrics development. 3+ years of hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across diverse stakeholders. 3+ years of SQL development skills writing queries. 3+ years of hands-on project management experience. 3+ years of experience with data visualization tools. 3+ years of experience with packages such as R, Tableau, SPSS, SAS, STATA, etc. 2+ years of experience with scripting in Python or PHP. Experience leveraging data driven models to drive business decisions. Experience using data access tools and building visualizations using large datasets and multiple data sources. Ability to think analytically. Ability to distill and communicate data to all organizational levels. Experienced with packages such as NumPy, SciPy, pandas, scikit-learn, dplyr, ggplot2. Understanding of statistics and optimization techniques. Hands-on experience with medium to large datasets (i.e. data extraction, cleaning, analysis and presentation). PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Technical knowledge of data center operations.
IT Skills: Data analysis, Metrics development, SQL, Data visualization, R, Tableau, PHP, Python, Hadoop
Soft Skills: Problem-solving, Communication, Leadership, Project Management, Analytical thinking, Mentorship
Education: Skills Related to Education:, Degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Management Science)

Description: We believe that the future of business documents is knowing who will respond to anything you write before you even publish it. Textio’s augmented writing platform has already transformed the way that thousands of companies write and hire, and we’re looking for a creative, experienced, and passionate full stack engineer to join our Seattle team. In this role, you will design and build meaningful product features across our entire stack. You will partner closely with our product team to understand our customers, and then collaborate across teams with frontend, backend, ML, and NLP engineers to build what they need. The Textio platform combines machine learning and natural language processing to serve insights gathered from hundreds of millions of documents to customers in real time. We need someone who can think deeply about complex problems and lead teams to develop simple and effective solutions. Textio is a great place to build, learn, and experiment. Some of the technologies you will have a chance to work with include AWS, Docker, Python, JavaScript, and React. Come join us! We’d love to hear from you if: You love building across the stack: frontend, services, data or infrastructure. What gets you most excited is learning, creating something end-to-end and solving whatever problem needs to be solved You are flexible and able to work with teammates across the company to drive complex features from start to finish You take pride in the things you build from visual polish of the user experience to reliability of backend services You can lead technical architecture discussions from early exploration of ideas to deciding on a concrete path forward You love to mentor other teammates and teach them what you’ve learned about crafting amazing user experiences and shipping them to production You thrive in an environment that believes that prototypes speak louder than specs You have a track record of trying and learning new things You have a point of view but are low ego We want awesome and dependable engineers to build groundbreaking experiences for our customers. Textio embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. If there is anything we can do to create a more comfortable interview experience for you, please let us know. Working at Textio is outstanding. Learn more about our philosophy, benefits, and team at https://textio.com/careers/. Reach out and share your story with us!
IT Skills: AWS, Docker, Python, JavaScript, React
Soft Skills: Creativity, Experience, Passion, Collaboration, Problem-solving, Leadership, Mentoring, Adaptability, Pride in work, Experimentation, Open to learning, Communication skills, Teamwork

Description: HFM Administrator About Visteon Visteon is a global technology company that designs, engineers and manufactures innovative cockpit electronics products and connected car solutions for most of the world’s major vehicle manufacturers. Visteon is a leading provider of instrument clusters, head-up displays, information displays, infotainment, audio systems, telematics and SmartCore™ cockpit domain controllers. Visteon also supplies embedded multimedia and smartphone connectivity software solutions to the global automotive industry. Headquartered in Van Buren Township, Michigan, Visteon has approximately 10,000 employees at more than 40 facilities in 18 countries. Visteon had sales of $3.16 billion in 2016. Learn more at www.visteon.com. Visteon is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. Our Vision A top-three cockpit electronics player delivering a rich, connected cockpit experience for every car from luxury to entry Hyperion Financial Manager (HFM) - Systems Administrator Typical Duties Support several Hyperion applications. HFM, FDMEE, Planning, Essbase (System 11.1.2.3.XXX) Build strong working relationships with Finance business partners at many levels of the organization. Propose, test and implement improvements to Reporting, System Design and Performance per requirements of Senior Executives. Provide on-going support for month-end closes, forecasts, and budget development. • Work with Hyperion vendor (Oracle) to pursue vendor support when necessary • Serve as backup support for planning system functional updates in planning and build planning expertise. Requirements Requirements Years of Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience in functional knowledge of financial processes and monthly, quarterly and yearly close cycles. Minimum of 3 years of experience in implementing and supporting Oracle Hyperion technologies – HFM, FDMEE, Planning and Essbase. Degree Strongly Preferred: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Finance, Management Information Systems Desired Competencies/Experience Strong track record in administering and implementing Hyperion related technology projects in large and complex environments Strong collaborative skills and ability to work in a dynamic fast paced environment. Experience in System Requirements Analysis, including documenting current and future state business processes, and analyzing their interaction and interdependencies to support process design. Complete understanding/working knowledge of HFM, specifically a. EPMA experience for managing metadata b. Rule enhancement and development experience c. Edit and/or write Forms/Grids d. Ability to analyze & diagnose data issues and fix e. Build/ Enhance / Troubleshoot Smartviews as needed FDMEE - Solid knowledge/understanding a. Set up processes (Locations, Batches, etc.) b. Knowledge of and ability to make changes (mappings, scheduled processes) c. Knowledge of and ability to create / enhance Reports d. Diagnose issues/fix Financial report working experience a. Build/ Enhance / Troubleshoot Financial Reports as needed Shared services a. Security model experience b. LCM understanding and experience Planning / Essbase a. Working knowledge and experience with Planning & Essbase b. Essbase ASO experience a plus c. BAT scripting experience d. Experience writing calc scripts and business rules e. Experience creating reports and queries as required Analytical skills, ability to diagnose, find and fix problems across HFM/FDMEE/Planning Excel knowledge: Formulas (expert) / VBA (working knowledge) Jython script knowledge/understanding. Hands-on Experience a big plus. Special Requirements Flexibility in working hours to work with a global team may be required. Some flexibility for global travel is important.
IT Skills: Hyperion Financial Manager (HFM), FDMEE, Planning, Essbase, Oracle Hyperion technologies, EPMA, Smartviews, Financial report development, Shared services, Planning & Essbase, BAT scripting, Calc scripts, Excel formulas, VBA, Jython scripting
Soft Skills: Strong collaborative skills, Ability to work in a dynamic fast-paced environment, Analytical skills, Strong track record in administering and implementing technology projects in complex environments, Flexibility, Communication skills, Problem-solving skills

Description: Responsibilities Under the general supervision of the Director of Pharmaceutical Services, provides administrative support and secretarial assistance by screening calls; greeting and screening visitors; taking minutes at committee meetings; composing, typing and editing correspondence; preparing office staffing schedules; preparing and distributing P &T; agenda documents; maintaining journal subscriptions, and other duties as assigned. Qualifications Provides administrative and clerical support for department¡¦s assistant director, coordinators, managers and supervisors Schedules and coordinates meetings and appointments for the Director and other department managers and staff Composes, prepares correspondence, reports, policies and procedures using Microsoft Office or other similar available application; editing all material for correct meaning, grammar, punctuation and spelling; including preparation of graphs, spreadsheets and slides. Prepares workload statistic reports, file medical event reports, quality control records, controlled substance documentation, accounts payable records, financial reports and other data, including collection, compiling and reporting as filing is appropriate Supports personnel management functions such as filing and maintaining records, tracking evaluations, competency testing and other reports Answers and screens phone calls Prepares agendas, takes notes and prepares minutes for meetings Sorts and distributes mail Performs general errands, duplication, and other related duties as requested

An intelligent platform where you showcase, validate, and share your skills with hiring managers in real-time. There is no need for a resume, cover letter, phone screen, or technical interview when you build a Code Pilot portfolio. Description: Senior Data and Business Analyst Santa Clara, CA This position reports to: Director, Operational Analytics ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better. We are looking for an experienced Data and Business Analyst to join our Operational Analytics team. The Analyst is mainly responsible for analyzing KPIs, reviewing business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational risks, identify opportunities for improved data quality and efficiency, and become the company’s data expert – understanding relationships between tables and systems. They should have strong communication skills and an ability to understand and present complex analysis to all levels. Responsibilities will include activities from leading small to mid-size projects as well as working cross functionally assisting other project managers on larger, more complex projects. We have a tight team environment where support, loyalty, and honest feedback are the currency. ServiceNow employees are expected to be self-starting, proactive, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment. Role: We are looking for talented individuals with a strategic viewpoint who are able to grow and adapt along with our fast-paced business. You have to be passionate about working with data, be energized by business leaders gaining insight from your reporting and analysis, and be detail-oriented. Our Business and Data Analysts are responsible for applying a breadth of data extraction, data cleansing, and analytic techniques to answer a wide range of business questions and drive operational improvements. They are effective communicators capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to a range of audiences. Responsibilities will include supporting ServiceNow internal operational groups such as Product Development, Engineering and Customer Support. What you get to do in this role: Develop actionable insights from analysis to make recommendations on key business strategies Build advanced analytical models to support Operations and Engineering initiatives Work with Product Owners and Developers to drive appropriate system enhancements for reporting purposes within the ServiceNow Platform Create and Analyze KPIs and metrics Create or Improve and Implement business processes and operational policies to support our Cloud business Learn and become and SME using our internal analytics tool (Performance Analytics) In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who is/has: 7+ years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, with a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the following software/tools: Ability ServiceNow data architecture and navigate through tables and fields for reporting purposes IT or Computer Science background and an understanding of relational databases is a must Advanced Excel skills with visual basic scripting Complex modeling and data visualization skills (e.g., Tableau) Proficient in Tableau and SQL is a must Knowledgeable in SAP HANA is a plus Experienced in HTML and JavaScript Strong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into models and operational requirements Thrives on responsibility and lives for the next big challenge Keen attention to detail and the ability to multi task in a self-managed environment Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) A team player and collaborative worker with a positive attitude We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.
IT Skills: Data analysis, Statistical modeling, Data manipulation, Data visualization, SQL, Tableau, Excel, HTML, JavaScript, SAP HANA, Understanding of relational databases
Soft Skills: Communication skills, Attention to detail, Analytical skills, Problem-solving skills, Collaboration, Adaptability, Self-starting/proactive attitude

Description: IT Business Consultant-1803572 Description Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations. Business Systems Analyst will play a key role on technical projects acting as a liaison between Business and Information Systems organization. A person in this role will have responsibility for analyzing business processes, data and workflows and providing viable solutions as it pertains to Fund Administration and Investment operations of Mutual Fund industry. The BSA will be responsible for conducting analysis of business process and data requirements, writing functional specifications, and collaborating with business and technical leads, QA and operations team to deliver optimal solutions that meet business needs. Responsibilities Provide support for large business/systems projects, including negotiation and coordination with other departments regarding issues, meeting time and quality targets. Formulate strategies supporting one or more key business functions. Liaise between business and systems areas to investigate and/or develop solutions to complex business/systems issues. Consult with management on business needs, opportunities and operational effectiveness. Conduct feasibility studies, cost/benefit analysis, data and work flow analysis for complex and high risk projects. Provide recommendations and implement mechanisms for improvements. Document data analysis summaries and functional solutions and specifications. Work with development and QA teams on Agile deliveries. Support and conduct acceptance testing. Act as project lead for directing and co-coordinating staff and activities. Assume the role of mentor, teacher and advisor to more junior staff. Identify and resolve complex production problems. Influence and negotiate with others to meet project objectives. Manage and work with vendor on specific activities. Prepare, develop and/or support training materials and user specification requirements. Other duties as assigned. Knowledge & Skills: Thorough knowledge of the clients’ business operations and issues, along with a good understanding of the company’s various businesses. Solid knowledge of a variety of applications within the division. Strong analytical skills with the ability to define, document and resolve complex issues. Thorough knowledge and understanding of a variety of analytical tools. Expert knowledge of the various stages of the analysis process (initial requirements, data mapping, screen design, data flow, etc.). Ability to generate new and unique ideas, approaches and solutions to complex problems and opportunities. Openly question traditional assumptions. Demonstrated strength at evaluating feasibility or practicality of ideas and options, assess risks and trade-offs and, make informed and timely decisions. Demonstrated strength in test case design, prediction of results, and test execution. Solid project management skills with the ability to act as test lead or project lead in larger project teams. Demonstrated use and support of Project Management methodologies, tools, project templates, standards and practices. Strong communication, presentation, negotiation and influencing skills. Strong planning and organization skills. Ability to handle multiple competing tasks with prioritization that may change due to business-driven or project deadlines. Able to keep the big picture in focus while being detailed oriented. Demonstrated initiative and ability to commit to a course of action in the face of risks and uncertainty. Proficient in writing complex MS-SQL queries to quickly analyze and compare data. Ability to use Excel effectively for data analysis. Familiarity with reporting tools like QlikSense is a plus. Experience with Visio is a plus. Good communication skills – both verbal and written are a must. Experience with Agile delivery process is highly desired. Experience Minimum 8+ years of progressive business analysis experience supporting large size projects, preferably in area of Asset Management operations. About John Hancock Financial and Manulife John Hancock is a division of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers’ needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were over $1.04 trillion (US$829.4 billion) as of December 31, 2017. We also offer advice through Signator, a network of independent financial advisors. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com. As a manager of managers, we search the world to find proven portfolio teams with specialized expertise for every fund we offer, then apply vigorous investment oversight to ensure they continue to meet our uncompromising standards. Our unique approach to asset management has led to a diverse set of investments deeply rooted in investor needs, along with strong risk-adjusted returns across asset classes. Description: At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies. Job summary Be the catalyst who creates possibilities, solves problems, and establishes working relationships with our customers. The Red Hat Sales team is looking for an experienced sales engineer or architect to join us as a Solutions Architect in the New York metropolitan area. In this role, you will discover and analyze our customers' business and technical needs and collaborate with the sales and technical delivery teams to help the customers invest wisely in a portfolio of solutions spanning both traditional infrastructure and software-defined, cloud, and systems management, automation, application development, mobile, and storage technologies to best meet their business requirements. You'll need to have excellent communication and people skills, as you'll be a key part of the first major experience our customers have with Red Hat. As a Solutions Architect, you will also need to have a balance of technical expertise, passion for open source, and a thorough understanding of business processes. Successful applicants must reside in a state where Red Hat is registered to do business. Successful applicants must reside in a state where Red Hat is registered to do business. Primary job responsibilities Collaborate with the sales and technical delivery teams to bring our customers the best solutions from across the Red Hat's cloud infrastructure solutions portfolio Discover and analyze customer business and technical problems and suggest the appropriate Red Hat's solutions that meet their needs Provide presales technical support for the development and implementation of complex offerings and solutions Use your deep knowledge of our offerings to provide technical expertise to sales associates and customers through sales presentations and demonstrations of our offerings and prepare detailed specifications for our offerings Follow standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data Required skills 5+ years of experience in sales engineering, consulting, IT architecture, or equivalent supporting enterprise accounts 5+ years of integration or development experience with Unix and Linux system administration Excellent communication and presentation skills with a record of developing relationships at engineering, commercial, and executive levels Ability to interpret customer business problems and technical issues and effectively explain how a solution will align to customer needs or requirements Knowledge of enterprise solutions and architectures, e.g., cloud, big data, containers, virtualization, automation, storage, RDBMS and enterprise resource planning (ERP) software like Oracle or SAP, clustering, and high availability Willingness to travel up to 50% Experience with emerging technologies like Linux containers, container orchestration and management, automation and configuration management, DevOps, continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD), and modern application frameworks is a big plus Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA), Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE), VMware Certified Professional (VCP), The Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF), or Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) certifications are a plus Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

Description: The IT Operations team at Audible Magic is responsible for building and maintaining a SaaS platform which processes billions of transactions a month, servicing customers around the globe. Our company and our services are growing. To support that growth, we are looking to add an experienced Systems Administrator to our team. You will be a key contributor within the Operations organization, responsible for ensuring that our infrastructure, both on-premises and in public cloud, is highly available, reliable, and efficient. Our System Administrators work closely with Engineering and DevOps to deploy and support our services. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Monitoring systems and services, utilizing a variety of tools, to identify and proactively address issues within our infrastructure. Working closely with Engineering and DevOps to recommend, design, and implement infrastructure, tools, and processes to improve and scale our services. Assisting with day-to-day troubleshooting and deployment tasks involving servers, networking, storage, operating systems and applications. Produce, analyze, and report on metrics and KPIs for capacity planning and to evaluate system/service performance. Contributing to internal documentation on systems and processes. Participating in on-call pager rotation and occasional local and remote travel to datacenter locations. Who We Are Looking For Ideally, you have several years of experience with a strong background in Linux system administration while also possessing a breadth of knowledge throughout the technology stack – networking, databases, storage, etc. Throw in some Windows knowledge for good measure. You are exceptional at troubleshooting and root cause analysis, and then implementing and documenting solutions. Experience supporting a SaaS platform where uptime is critical is also a big plus. Some of the technological skills we are looking for are: Advanced Linux configuration and administration. Including performance tuning, security hardening, and complex troubleshooting Networking concepts, device configuration and optimization (firewalls, switches, routers, load balancers) – experience with Palo Alto firewalls and Citrix NetScaler desired AWS Infrastructure – VPC, EC2, ALB/ELB, IAM, ECS/Fargate, S3, Security Group Management Experience using and configuring Enterprise SaaS-based monitoring tools such as LogicMonitor, Splunk, New Relic System build and configuration management tools – Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Dell OME Scripting experience with two or more of the following – bash, python, Perl, Ruby, JavaScript, Groovy, PowerShell Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work well within a small team environment but are also able to work autonomously, with little managerial oversight. Additional technical skills that would set you apart: Virtualization and Containerization – VMWare and Docker, specifically Windows System Administration – basic troubleshooting, performance optimization, security – Experience with services such as Active Directory, DNS, SMTP helpful. Enterprise storage management, iSCSI – Pure or Nimble preferred Enterprise backup and replication technologies and methodologies Message Queueing technologies such as ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ, Kafka System support and optimization for SQL and NoSQL databases, (not DBA) Experience with caching services such as Redis or Memcached _A Bachelor’s Degree in a technical disciple is desired. Relevant industry certifications help. We will consider a combination of education and experience for the right candidate._ Music Industry Innovation mu·sic - in·dus·try - in·no·va·tion /ˈmyo͞ozik/ /ˈindəstrē/ /inəˈvāSH(ə)n/ noun the action or process of innovating relating to the industry of music. synonyms: change, alteration, revolution, upheaval, transformation, metamorphosis, breakthrough a new method, idea, product, etc. plural noun: innovations "technological innovations designed to revolutionize the music industry"
IT Skills: Related to Experience:, Most technical skills, Soft skills
Soft Skills: Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, Ability to work well within a small team environment, Autonomy in work tasks

Description: LOCAL CHILDCARE CONSULTANT — CULTURAL CARE AU PAIR Multiple Openings - North Bend, Renton, Lake Tapps, Mount Baker, Bainbridge Island, Columbia City, Ranier Valley Make a positive impact in your community! Cultural Care Au Pair helps families across the country secure childcare that provides flexibility, trust and cultural exchange. Joining our team of Local Childcare Consultants (LCCs) is a fantastic and flexible role for someone who enjoys taking a proactive and collaborative approach to their work, connects quickly with others, can think on their feet, and has a true passion for cultural exchange. You’ll join a team of charismatic and dedicated childcare professionals, and benefit from all the resources and support you need to make each match between a family and their au pair into a success story. “I see being an LCC as a way of opening yourself to the world and constantly redefining what we call ‘normal’. Cultural exchange expands lives, communities and families in so many ways—emotionally, physically and mentally.” —MICHELLE GRAY, LCC IN MASSACHUSETTS “I’ve been an LCC for a long time—it continues to be enjoyable because of the infinite variety of interesting personalities and relationships that the program brings together. It will always be inspiring to help facilitate these relationships.” —DIANE STUART, LCC IN MARYLAND Your day-to-day as an LCC: Providing support for both the host families and au pairs during their hosting experience Conducting host families interviews and verification of references to be a part of the program Hosting monthly au pair meetings and host family day conferences Connecting with au pairs upon their arrival to the U.S. Communicating with host families monthly Ensuring we are recruiting quality families with reasonable program expectations Enforcing U.S. Department of State regulations Initiating grassroots marketing efforts to grow the au pair program This role is a W-9 independent contractor opportunity. In this flexible and rewarding role, you have the ability to earn monthly stipends, commissions, and domestic or international travel. LEARN MORE Let us know you’re interested and share a bit about yourself!

Description: The Manager, Products is responsible for collaborating with operations stakeholders and external clients to define and prioritize the Tessellate machine learning models and infrastructure vision and roadmap. Additionally, this position focuses on applying the machine learning models to risk adjustment concepts and solutions while applying agile principles to deliver innovative product solutions. Establishes and maintains product portfolio and representation of the portfolio for sales, segment leadership, and the Product Community. Uses market research and user input to identify product gaps and opportunities to improve and optimize. Engages with sales, account management, internal operations, and key market stakeholders to define product needs and innovation opportunities. Develops pricing for each product; tracks and reports profitability margins at the product and customer level. Develops clear documentation, user manuals, training materials and business process flows that explain how our technical solutions and business processes are executed. Trains internal operations teams and external customers on solutions and business processes. Participates in development of annual departmental budget, monitors budget, and identifies budget discrepancies. Researches cause and makes recommendations. Responsible for balancing workload to optimize the effectiveness of the department. DIRECTION EXERCISED: Directly supervises exempt and non-exempt staff in accordance with company policies and applicable Federal and State Laws. Responsibilities include but are not limited to effectively interviewing, hiring, terminating, and training employees; planning, assigning and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and counseling employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems; supporting and encouraging the engagement process. SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES (SKA) REQUIRED: Strong mathematical, statistics and probability background Strong knowledge of machine learning models and how and where they are applicable. Strong knowledge of data analysis and data mining techniques. Knowledge of software engineering and programming skills (i.e. Python, Java etc.). Knowledge of risk adjustment processes and policies (i.e. Medicare, ACA and Medicaid risk adjustment) Ability to create business cases, taking into consideration market demand, competitive pricing, cost to build, and cost to operate. Ability to prioritize and organize effectively. Excellent story writing and story splitting skills. Critical thinking and analytical skills. Excellent communications skills. Working knowledge of Lean and Agile values, principles, and practices. Must have collaborative attitude and innovative mindset. Must demonstrate leadership ability and team building skills to effectively supervise professional and non-professional staff and interact with all levels of management. Ability to work with and empower others on a collaborative basis to ensure success of unit team. Ability to effectively exchange information, in verbal or written form, by sharing ideas, reporting facts and other information, responding to questions and employing active listening techniques. Ability to effectively present budgetary and/or cost information, and respond to questions as appropriate. Ability to establish workflows, manages multiple projects, and meets necessary deadlines.
