You can be an architect, scientist, threat researcher, or a coder as long as you design things that matters. _Job Description:_ The purpose of this role is to provide subject matter expertise in information security and governance with McAfee clients. Integral to this role is the ability to represent McAfee as a trusted advisor on information security. The role requires the ability to design solution architecture and evangelize both the solution and the underlying information security principles. Program and project management of the implementation of solutions and technologies is an important part of this role. The third part of this role is problem management, remediation and root cause analysis to enable process and technology improvement. _As an Endpoint Consultant a typical day might include following:_ Develops and delivers detailed IT solutions through consulting project activities. Responsibilities include client identification through final invoicing for engagements requiring varied interpersonal and technical skills. Technical responsibilities include problem identification, system architecture definition, hardware/software specification and/or design, implementation, testing, client training, and solution deployment. Performance is typically evaluated based on utilization, (i.e., billable hours). Project management activities include interaction with company and client managers and cost/schedule monitoring. May have some financial responsibilities including project cost estimating, proposal generation, and invoicing. May participate in sales and proposal presentations in addition to completing ongoing team account activities. Identifies additional product/services opportunities in customer organization. Performance is typically measured by the capture of the consulting engagement and/or delivery of agreed solutions within budgeted hours. _Responsibilities:_ Analyze and document client requirements and solution design for how McAfee solutions can meet these requirements now and in the future Maintain a good knowledge of other information security vendor's products and the competitive relationship to McAfee's products Requirements analysis and solution architecture for integrated network, data and personal computer solutions. Maintain and expand client contact at high levels and build credible relationships with key client personnel. Program and project management of schedules, budgets and personnel to ensure that projects are completed with a high level of technical expertise and professionalism. Identification and development of professional services opportunities for McAfee and business partners. To provide professional services as a subject matter expert in information governance and data protection for McAfee customers and business partners. To provide subject matter expertise on information governance and data protection within McAfee and provide assistance to other McAfee personnel. _Desired Skills / Education:_ 6-8 years of proven technical support experience Knowledgeable in Windows, Unix/Linux and Mac OS X operating systems and Directory management. Knowledgeable in network communication protocols (TPC/IP, RADIUS, Tacacs, SMTP, BGP, SNMP, HTTP/HTTPS, LDAP, Netflow). Knowledgeable of OSI/TCP-IP models Knowledge of security and information gathering tools (Snort, nmap, nessus, nslookup / dig, traceroute, hping, wireshark, tcpdump, netcat, netstat, nbtstat, Netscout). Knowledge of McAfee products Required: VirusScan Enterprise, Host Intrusion Prevention, SiteAdvisor, Application Control, MOVE-AV, VSE for Storage, ePolicy Orchestrator. Desired: TIE, ATD, Active Response. Optional: SIEM, or similar products from other vendors. Certifications in operating systems, networks or security would be preferred. Must be able to travel and work extensive hours. University degree in System Engineering/Networks/Programming/Cyber Security/Computer Science.Must have completed degree. Excellent communication and presentation skills as well as the ability to write complete reports An appreciation and knowledge of security technologies Ability to translate technical information into commercial terms for non-technical contacts Strong public presentation skills and a high standard of documentation. Understanding of Security products and where they fit within an organization to meet the client business requirements Understands market issues and trends affecting business and use of IT within various sectors Program and project management of geographically distributed projects. _Our Mission:_ To relentlessly protect all that matters through leading edge cyber security, from your workplace to your home and everywhere in between. _Our Vision:_ To enable a world where cyber security is so consistent, reliable and effective that it becomes a trusted foundation in our lives – like clean air and water. Our technology enables the world to fully realize the transformative power of the digital age, by protecting all that matters. By doing our job well, we drive limitless innovation, securely. _Join our Talent Community:_ http://careers.mcafee.com/ McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status. LI-EB1 DICE17 Job type: Experienced Hire Shift: Shift 1 (United States of America) Primary Location: US, New York, New York Additional Locations: Posting Statement: McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.
IT Skills: Windows, Unix/Linux, and Mac OS X operating systems, Directory management, Network communication protocols, OSI/TCP-IP models, Security and information gathering tools (Snort, nmap, nessus, nslookup / dig, traceroute, hping, wireshark, tcpdump, netcat, netstat, nbtstat, Netscout), McAfee products: VirusScan Enterprise, Host Intrusion Prevention, SiteAdvisor, Application Control, MOVE-AV, VSE for Storage, ePolicy Orchestrator, TIE, ATD, Active Response, SIEM or similar products, Certifications in operating systems, networks, or security
Soft Skills: Communication and presentation skills, Report writing, Translation of technical information into commercial terms, Public presentation skills, Attention to documentation detail, Market understanding, Program and project management skills

Description: The Data Entry Manager carries out the mission and goals of the Data Entry team and develops and maintains a culture that emphasizes quality, continuous improvement and high performance. They foster a spirit of teamwork and unity among department members that allows the team to effectively work together to enable each employee and the department to succeed. The Data Entry Manager ensures timely turnaround of tasks, accuracy of data entry and communication to management that meet service levels and quality standards. The Data Entry Manager is also tasked with collecting feedback from team members and implementing process improvements where applicable. Job Description Manage team to ensure data entry tasks meet or exceed service levels and quality standards Conduct quality reviews to ensure accuracy and thoroughness of cases entered Prioritize assignments, distribute case work to the data entry team and work with clients to review data entry output Manage deadlines, work estimates, contract signatures, invoices and collections Develop, implement and enforce policies and procedures pertinent to the effective and efficient operation of the Data Entry team that reflect industry best practices Empower employees to take responsibility for their jobs and goals; delegate responsibility and expect accountability Develop, coach and educate team members to ensure data accuracy and adherence to all privacy procedures and requirements (secure upload to document repository, etc.) Provide support to Relationship Management and Sales regarding Data Entry services available to existing clients and prospects. Provide feedback to management regarding service failures or customer concerns Acts as a resource in providing long term resolution to customer issues and manage elevated issues from clients that require interaction with a manager, acting as point of contact with internal departments to resolve issues Maintain knowledge of eMoney’s product and enhancements to support clients and staff Remediate customer complaints and field credit requests acting in compliance with department guidelines Support the development of staff’s growth in the organization by establishing plans, creating objectives, communicating standards, monitoring performance and providing coaching and training Oversee fair and reasonable distribution of tasks and duties based on team member specialty and experience level Provide effective performance feedback through employee recognition, rewards and disciplinary action, with the assistance of Human Resources when necessary Appropriately communicate information through department meetings, one-on-one meetings and appropriate email and interpersonal communication Conduct interviews, gather feedback from the interview team and select hires to fill open positions on the Data Entry team Project work as assigned Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required 3+ years of managerial experience in a Data Entry or Clients Services organization or relevant experience in the Financial or Insurance industry Strong understanding of financial terms and concepts Ability to read and interpret financial documents (pay statements, tax forms, quarterly investment statements, financial reports, bank statements, 401k & retirement plan statements, insurance documents, etc.) Familiar with web applications Skills Ability to lead and motivate employees of varying experience, tenure, professional and educational background Working knowledge of financial planning concepts Strong aptitude for data entry / client services staff development Working knowledge of financial services operations Advanced knowledge of eMoney Advisor’s products and services is a plus Strong interpersonal and written/verbal communication skills Strong independent judgement and decision-making skills Ability to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously Ability to successfully solve problems and resolve conflicts independently Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Outstanding organizational, time management and leadership skills Proven success leading a team to achieve team goals, KPIs and individual productivity measures Detail-oriented and takes pride in accomplishing a wide variety of tasks in a fast-paced environment Ability to deliver constructive criticism in a motivating fashion
IT Skills: Data entry management, Quality review, Prioritization, Policy and procedure development, Process improvement, Financial document interpretation, Web applications, Financial services operations, eMoney Advisor's products
Soft Skills: Leadership, Teamwork, Communication, Coaching, Relationship management, Problem-solving, Conflict resolution, Time management, Decision-making, Motivation, Organization, Detail-oriented, Feedback delivery

Description: Global consulting firm is seeking talent to join a growing Analytics team. Will work with a wide range of insurance experts to identify opportunities for innovation throughout the insurance value chain. Current work is underway along two key streams: advanced analytics applications and commercial data product development. You will develop and deliver innovative advanced analytics consulting assignments for clients across the US, and you will build commercial data products that will help our clients improve their ability to make informed decisions. Additionally, you will support the US data analytics manager and our insurance division leadership to continuously refine our consulting framework, research new methodologies, support business development opportunities and provide input to our technology roadmap. Seeking 2+ years of experience. Multiple locations available. Salary DOE.
IT Skills: Technical skills:, Advanced analytics, Data product development, Consulting, Research methodologies, Technology roadmap
Soft Skills: Soft skills:, Innovation, Communication, Collaboration, Business development, Problem-solving

Description: SOFTWARE ENGINEER II – BIG DATA _Who we are:_ Choice Hotels International is a cutting edge software development company that develops software to manage, reserve and book hotel rooms in its portfolio of 11 branded hotels. Choice provides innovative enterprise SOA solutions based on Open Source and AWS technologies. Choice is a tightknit team where you can enhance your skills in an environment that emphasizes creativity, sharing, teamwork, professionalism, and outstanding quality software. You will work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic professionals as they work to provide exceptional solutions to the many challenges our business and franchises face. If you are bright, driven, enjoy working with the latest technologies and have the right blend of business acumen, technically savvy and customer-facing skills then this opportunity is for you. If you are willing to work hard, looking for a place to learn and grow, and have the skills we would like to hear from you. _The cool stuff you do:_ Go-to expert in one area of the codebase; understands the broad software architecture of the entire system. Thinks at the enterprise level for reliability, scalability, maintainability, extensibility, portability, and security. Provides technical advice and weighs in on technical decisions that impact other teams or the company at large. Researches and proposes new technologies. Starts initiatives for SDP review. Scopes and stages work into well-defined milestones to avoid a monolithic deliverable. Regularly delivers software on-time and is constantly working to make accurate estimates and deliver on those estimates. Known for drama-free launches. Owns the technical testing and performance plan for their projects. Takes initiative to identify and solve important problems, coordinating with others on cross-cutting technical issues. Sets direction at the project/service level and consistently influences decision-making at the top level of team. Identifies and proactively tackles technical debt before it grows into debt that requires significant up-front work to resolve. Able to provide feedback on projects outside of their core area. Identifies and proposes strategies around technical problems affecting their team, communicates standards and gets buy-in on solutions. Makes others better through code pull reviews, thorough documentation, technical guidance, and mentoring or serving as a Tech Lead on a project. Understands the tradeoffs between technical, analytical and product needs and leads to solutions that take all of these needs into account. _Your education and experience:_ Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or related field, from a four-year college or university, or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Relevant industry certification, such as Oracle Java Developer, is preferred. A minimum of 3 years relevant experience in software development, information systems, or equivalent technical environment, including previous experience in the development of highly transactional, mission critical applications in heterogeneous environments/architectures for multi-user systems. Experience in all aspects of the software development lifecycle: design, functional and technical requirements, coding, debugging, testing, release, and operational support. Knowledge of agile software development methodologies, Service Oriented Architecture and object-oriented programming methodologies. Proficient in software development best practices, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations. Expert level knowledge of relational and non-relational database management system technologies and tools. Good experience in reviewing code and providing critical feedback for building secure, stable and scalable applications _You are awesome at:_ Expert level proficiency with the following technologies: Java (3+ years). Versions 1.6 and beyond are a good start! Spring or similar MVC framework. Unix/Linux and one of the many shells Service oriented designs and technologies. Web service technologies such as SOAP and REST SQL and NoSQL Version control such as Git and code review type tools such as Stash. Continuous Integration/Delivery toolkits such as Jenkins/Puppet. Queuing technologies, JMS, ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ. Spark, Cloudera, HDFS, Kafka, Hive, Impala. (Not necessarily Hadoop- MapR) AWS (S3, SQS, SNS, EC2) Cassandra and/or MongoDB Experienced in identifying opportunities to add monitoring and alerting where necessary Troubleshoot and provide solutions to issues arising in production Exceptional analytical skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interface with internal/external people at all levels. Exceptional interpersonal skills and demeanor. Proficient in the use of MS Office applications, such as Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel _You are good at:_ Added value proficiencies in the following technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript (jQuery), AngularJS a plus. Familiar with continuous integration tools such as Jenkins, Sonar, Stash. NoSQL AppDynamics, ELK, Grafana Must be able to uphold Choice's Values & Performance Principles of accountability, collaboration, performance excellence, sense of urgency, innovation, inclusion & diversity, integrity & trust, customer focus, and respect.
IT Skills: Java, Spring (or similar MVC framework), Unix/Linux, Service oriented designs and technologies, Web service technologies (SOAP and REST), SQL and NoSQL, Version control (Git), Continuous Integration/Delivery toolkits (Jenkins/Puppet), Queuing technologies (JMS, ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ), Big Data technologies (Spark, Cloudera, HDFS, Kafka, Hive, Impala), AWS (S3, SQS, SNS, EC2), Database management system technologies and tools (Cassandra and/or MongoDB), Monitoring and alerting, Troubleshooting production issues, Analytical skills
Soft Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, Interpersonal skills, Professional demeanor, Collaboration, Performance excellence, Sense of urgency, Innovation, Inclusion & diversity, Integrity & trust, Customer focus, Respect

Description: Our purpose is to serve the nation with the single most trusted and capable health information network, built to increase patient safety, lower costs and ensure quality care. What You’re Like You like to innovate on a proactive versus reactive basis. You can play at the intersection of technology and business because your brain works both ways. You appreciate the healthcare industry’s need to innovate for safe, effective and connected healthcare. You can understand and deliver value in terms that customers use and care about, i.e. saving money, making their jobs easier, reducing manual work and, of course, improving patient care. You are ready to step into a key role as part of the solution—not just for your customers’ benefit, but for the entire nation. What We’re Like Surescripts Product Innovation is a diverse team of leaders who execute Surescripts’ business strategy. We have a knack for surrounding ourselves with the right “brain trust” (read: select collaborators who are experts on a wide variety of topics) to inform our work. On the team, there are business gurus who understand the healthcare IT market and how a product will be positioned. There are experts who can translate an exciting concept into a set of requirements to actually go and build it. And there are pros who know what it takes to get new products to market and manage the more mature ones. And most importantly, this team has a deep technical understanding and can articulate Surescripts’ value in terms that will resonate with customers. OK, But Here’s What It’s Really Like Working at Surescripts Product Innovation, you’ll be called upon to coax the right information out of our customers to get at their unmet needs. You’ll maximize our deep relationships with our customers and the industry by monetizing our assets. You’ll leverage these assets—our nationwide network and the actionable intelligence it delivers—to create real value for customers. You’ll work to help put the right players—from payers to physicians to pharmacies—onto a common network so that they can more effectively communicate and coordinate high-quality and well-informed healthcare. Job Summary The Product Manager I is responsible for product planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle for products sold by Surescripts and its vendor partners: secure messaging and e-prescribing products, content management systems, business information systems and tools supporting product integration, administration and troubleshooting. This role serves as a subject matter expert (SME) in product capabilities and works with stakeholders from all business units, all products, and related third parties to define product strategy and vision and to analyze and prioritize requirements. This role will provide high level and detailed analysis, defining solutions and dashboards that balance technical, legal, security, and UX requirements. Additionally, s/he will prepare product documentation highlighting system functions and capabilities. Also, the Product Manager I ensures that the product supports the overall company strategy and objectives and that customer satisfaction and revenue goals are met. The Product Manager I works closely with customers, analysts, engineering, marketing and support teams to develop and maintain products under their responsibility. Responsibilities Lead and oversee market analysis, including financial aspects of the product (revenue, costs, 3-year forecasting, P&L; statements) Serve as product leader within the company and in the industry acting as the SME in capabilities, competition, industry landscape, value proposition, revenue drivers and industry standards. Define product strategy and roadmap and disseminate to stakeholders throughout lifecycle. Responsible for building a 3 year product strategy and 1 year detailed execution game plan and roadmap. Responsible for product innovation (e.g., new products to be developed for general availability, product line extensions). Oversee pilot programs for enhancements to products. Develop a strong understanding of business requirements, working with business users/ business analysts to define technical and process requirements Define the scope, goals, and deliverables and timelines of product programs. Manage and communicate product status, risks and opportunities, including product debriefs with improvement recommendations Identify inter/intra product program dependencies, ensure product launch checklist is completed and take action to reduce risk and ensure predictable delivery Oversee and perform as needed development activities from gathering requirements and designing solutions to release / deployment. Prioritize product fixes and enhancements Leverage advanced functionality to create analytical dashboards. Lead the launch of the product by aligning with market needs, customer interests and internal goals, developing product business plans, providing SME support Create product positioning, personas and key value proposition to support the marketing team in creating marketing artifacts and sales enablement tools, including webinars and marketing materials. Provide product training to product teams and Customer Group. Support sales and account managers by attending customer meetings and calls as needed. Own P&L.; Define and manage key levers to influence P&L; outcomes; communicate with internal business partners. Work with finance to determine product pricing and analyze revenue, where applicable, and manage financial plans Work with third parties to assess partnerships and licensing opportunities Develop customer relationships with key stakeholders and represent Surescripts at industry standards workgroup meetings Qualifications Basic Requirements: Bachelor degree or equivalent experience 8 years of experience in related, progressive roles 5 years of experience in healthcare or a field related to the business – data networks, transaction processing systems or information products 5 years of development background in automated measurement and monitoring capabilities 3 years of experience assessing market and customer needs for information products and servers 2 years of experience in product definition, product management and product launch Prior experience creating business plans and/or financial projections Preferred Qualifications: Master degree in a related business or healthcare field 5 years of experience as a product manager 3 years of experience in physician vendor applications, pharmacy or PBM services Technical product development background in business/product analysis and / or QA
IT Skills: Product planning and execution, Market analysis, Financial analysis, Product strategy and roadmap development, Product innovation, Requirements analysis, Business requirements understanding, Development activities oversight, Product launch management, Analytical dashboards creation, P&L management, Pricing analysis, Partnership and licensing assessment, Relationship management, Product training
Soft Skills: Innovation, Business acumen, Customer-centricity, Communication, Collaboration, Leadership, Problem-solving, Strategic thinking, Stakeholder management, Decision-making, Analytical skills, Presentation skills, Financial planning
Education: Education-related Skills:, Bachelor degree or equivalent experience, Master degree in a related business or healthcare field

Description: Manager I Reports to, and advises the Field Services & Communications Manager III of the Communication Program activities. Manages the Communications Programs daily activities. Manager I provides direction and guidance in the operation of the TER Help Desk and Call Center. Oversees and prepares productivity reports and studies related to the Communications Program area on a timely manner. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by tracking emerging trends in call center operations management; reviewing professional publications to make improvements in call center operations; and collaborating with other divisions to improve program operations. Routinely meets with assigned staff on program issues and problems to identify and implement solutions. Work involves assisting in establishing program goals and objectives, and ensuring these are achieved. Plans, assigns, and supervises the work of staff in the Communications Program area. Work includes development of training, policies, and other duties assigned. This is a fast paced, Call Center environment, which requires the ability to work under pressure. Works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgement. Essential Job Functions: Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned. 35% Manages activities of the Communications Program staff, and oversees the preparation of productivity and management reports and studies. This position requires taking calls from the general public to ensure call hold times are reduced. Assists in research studies, and internal audits. Assists in establishing goals and objectives, schedules, and evaluation activities for the VSU Communication Program area of VSU. Assists in developing and reviewing legislative items. 30% Directly supervises a multi-disciplinary staff in Communication Program activities. Supervision includes assigning work, interviewing, hiring and training of staff, assisting in development of performance standards, discussion of performance with assigned staff, and recommending personnel or disciplinary actions. Assists in managing staff development to ensure and encourage high standard of work output. Works on continuous process improvement in assigned work area. Prepares training and operational manuals for review and implementation in assigned work area. 25% Advises and consults with the Field Services & Communications Manager III on Communications Program-related matters. Advises the Field Services & Communications Manager III on status and program development of Communications Program activities from a productivity standpoint and recommends procedures for more effective utilization or corrective actions. Develops and recommends program guidelines and procedures for Field Services & Communications Manager's review. Implements approved guidelines and procedures, and collects feedback from staff for further development consideration. 10% Performs other related duties, as assigned. Performs duties in the absence of the Field Services & Communications Manager III. DSHS employees are expected to support this mission either by actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency's obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or COOP activation. Knowledge Skills Abilities: Knowledge of local, state, and federal laws and regulations relevant to government work. Skill in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems; and in operating computers and applicable computer software such as Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to supervise business function, division, or department activities; to establish goals and objectives; to devise solutions to administrative problems; to develop and evaluate administrative policies and procedures; to prepare reports; to communicate effectively; and to plan, assign, and supervise the work of others. Registration or Licensure Requirements: Must pass background and fingerprint check. Experience and Education: Experience in the management of a business function, division, or department relevant to Vital Statistics, or government work. Graduation from an accredited four year college or university with major course work in a field relevant to the assignment is generally preferred. Experience and education may be substituted for one another. Initial Selection Criteria: Experience in working in a government setting. Experience in working in a call center environment. Experience in training, project management, and providing technical assistance to stakeholders. Additional Information: Requisition 385871 MOS Code: 86MO HHS agencies use E-Verify. You must bring your I-9 documentation with you on your first day of work. I-9 Form - Click here to download the I-9 form. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), HHS agencies will provide reasonable accommodation during the hiring and selection process for qualified individuals with a disability. If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS Employee Service Center at 1-888-894-4747. If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodation to participate in the interview process, please notify the person scheduling the interview.
IT Skills: Management, Call center operations, Data analysis, Program development, Policy development, Process improvement, Microsoft Office Suite
Soft Skills: Leadership, Communication, Problem-solving, Decision-making, Team management, Training and development, Customer service
Education: Education-Related:, Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university

Job Title: Technical Coordinator, Client Services Investment Operations
Description: For more than a century, Northern Trust has worked hard building our legacy of outstanding service, expertise and integrity. From a Chicago-based bank founded in 1889, we now have more than 20 international locations and 16,500 employees globally. We serve the world’s most-sophisticated clients – from sovereign wealth funds and the wealthiest individuals and families, to the most-successful hedge funds and corporate brands. We burnished our reputation as a global leader delivering innovative investment management, asset and fund administration, fiduciary and banking solutions enabled by sophisticated, leading technology. And through it all, we continually laid a solid, forward-looking foundation on which future generations can continue growing and achieving greater. As of June 30, 2018, Northern Trust Corporation had: $135 billion in banking assets $8.1 trillion in assets under custody $10.7 trillion in assets under custody/administration $1.1 trillion in assets under management Under general supervision (but works independently most of the time) focuses on resolution of complex transactions, where expertise is required to interpret policies, guidelines and/or processes. Full ownership for one or more processes, reports and/or procedures. Analytically and procedurally competent, representing the team on cross-function process or project deliverables. Emerging as an expert in a specific skill set but remains focused primarily on daily execution. May manage daily operational activities and supervise day-to-day work of junior level employees (but not a formal management role). May be in final stages of studying for relevant professional qualification or accreditation. May manage daily operational activities and supervise day-to-day work of junior level employees (but not a formal management role). Provides input into performance management and career development processes, and staffing and disciplinary actions 1.Focuses on resolution of complex transactions, where expertise is required to interpret policies, guidelines and/or processes 2.Serves as the main reporting contact for the client; full ownership for one or more processes, reports and/or procedures 3.Analytically and procedurally competent, representing the team on cross- function process or project deliverables; emerging as an expert in a specific skill set but remains focused primarily on daily execution 4.Carries out complex activities with significant financial, client, and/or internal business impact 5.May have direct interaction with committees and/or Senior Management 6.Able to serve as a key subject matter expert and mentor to other more junior level employees 7.May manage daily operational activities and supervise day-to-day work of junior level employees (but not a formal management role) A College or University degree and/or some relevant work experience is preferred May be in final stages of studying for relevant professional qualification or accreditation Excellent oral and written communication skills are required Analytical and problem solving skills are required Ability to facilitate discussions and reach decisions Technically sound in area of expertise with broader knowledge of other business areas The strongest applicants will: Ø Have a knowledge and understanding of the full lifecycle of an equity trade. Ø Have experience with global market settlements and an understanding of the relationship between a Custodian and a Sub-Custodian. Ø Have intermediate level accounting experience to reconcile out of balance situations between banking systems and client accounts.
IT Skills: Knowledge of equity trade lifecycle, Experience with global market settlements, Understanding of Custodian and Sub-Custodian relationship, Accounting experience, Reconciliation skills
Soft Skills: Excellent oral and written communication, Analytical and problem-solving skills, Ability to facilitate discussions and reach decisions, Mentoring skills, Technical expertise, Knowledge sharing skills

Description: The Ayla Platform™ is the industry’s only complete _end-to-end_ __ solution for transforming everyday products into cloud-connected devices quickly, easily and economically. Ayla combines it's innovative and highly efficient technology with best-in-class hardware, applications, cloud-based services and digital information services to allow manufacturers to reinvent their products for the smartphone era. We are an exciting start-up delivering a PaaS platform for the Internet of Things. We are seeking a Sr. Full Stack Developer to design and develop the back-end software and UX/UI browser based applications. You will be responsible for the first version of a support framework design with a focus on enabling our application partners to rapidly build applications on Ayla's IoT platform. What You Will Be Doing Design of the overall architecture of the web framework for IoT application development Strong experience managing interchange of data between the server/users, translating the UI/UX design wireframes into code for visual elements of the application. Implementation of a robust set of services and APIs to power web based applications Building reusable code and libraries for future use Optimization of the framework for speed, scalability, and flexibility Implementation using standard security and data privacy protection methods Translation of UI/UX wireframes to visual elements Integration of the front-end and back-end aspects of the framework Management of hosting environments, including database administration and scaling an application to support load changes. Understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable applications Creating database schemas that represent and support common business processes Data migration, transformation, and scripting Desired Skills and Experience 8+ years of experience in Full Stack development Proficient knowledge of back-end programming languages, and in particular: PHP, Python, Ruby, Java, Node.js, .NET, JavaScript etc. Understanding differences between multiple delivery platforms (such as mobile vs, desktop), and optimizing output to match the specific platform Good understanding of JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS, DurandalJS etc. Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery or other frameworks such as Zepto, MooTools, etc. depending on project requirements Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, ability to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus Proficient understanding of code versioning tools e.g. Git Ability to work in high pace, high pressure environment Ability to manage multiple assignments at once with good level of independence and decision-making aptitude Keywords: hybrid, developer, integration, Amazon AWS, Bluemix, PaaS, apps, Javascript, HTML5, CSS, web services, Docker BS/MS in CS or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in SW development or engineering Exceptional ability and capability to learn new skills and tools. Ability to apply oneself in new problems in a dynamic lean start-up environment. Experience with PAAS business application framework development is preferable This position will be part of a new, exciting and high growth industry. If you are a driven Engineer with the applicable knowledge and experience, please apply today! Ayla Networks provides full benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision and 401(k) including Equity and PTO). EOE/AAM/F/D/V Employer _No Recruiting Agencies!_ _No phone calls, please._
IT Skills: Full Stack Development, Back-end Programming, PHP, Python, Ruby, Java, Node.js, NET, JavaScript, AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS, DurandalJS, jQuery, Git, Amazon AWS, Bluemix, HTML5, CSS, Web Services, Docker, App Development, Database Administration
Soft Skills: Ability to work in a high-paced environment, Ability to manage multiple assignments independently, Decision-making aptitude, Learning agility

Description: Description The City of Hayward is excited to announce its recruitment for the position of Administrative Intern. DEFINITION Under direct supervision, the Administrative Intern performs a wide variety of duties that may be administrative, paraprofessional, or technical in scope. The exact nature of the work is dependent upon the specific department to which a position is assigned. Interns can expect to work roughly 20 to 30 hours per week for the duration of the assignment which may last between 3 – 6 months. Flexible work hours are available to accommodate an intern's class schedule. Administrative Interns may work for no more than 1,000 hours per fiscal year and may not serve for more than one-year in this classification. DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS This is a specialized classification for student interns planning to enter the public sector but need more experience and training in order to qualify for entry level professional classes. The exact nature of work is dependent upon the specific department to which a position is assigned, but may include professional level staff assistance in research and analysis, procedural studies, and technical planning for a variety of general administrative or specialized projects. The Administrative Intern differs from the Administrative Clerk in that the former performs a lesser range of duties and is provided more instruction and assistance in completing assignments. Essential Duties Duties may include but are not limited to the following: Assists in the preparation of routine organizational, legislative, and statistical analysis. Conducts studies and surveys; assembles data and summarizes findings. Participates in the research, development, and presentation of various programs. Performs general records management, maintains accounting records, and compiles data for departmental and city-wide operations. Responds to requests for information and provides necessary customer service to members of the community, business organizations, and other City employees. Related duties as assigned. JOB RELATED AND ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS Knowledge of: Proper English usage, spelling, grammar, and punctuation in completing reports and correspondence. Basic principles and methods of public administration. Basic statistics and research methodology. Modern office practices, equipment, and software including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel, Powerpoint, etc.). Ability to: Apply and analyze policies, procedures, and regulations. Perform research; compile and evaluate data. Prepare clear and comprehensive, computer-generated reports and documents. Establish and maintain positive working relationships with other City employees and members of the public. Read, understand, interpret and apply policies and procedures. Communicate effectively with all members of the community, both verbally and in writing. Minimum Qualifications EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION Any combination of experience and education that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the knowledge and abilities would be: Education: Coursework in public administration, business administration, political science, social sciences, law, accounting, planning, or a related field. Must be currently enrolled in a four-year accredited college or university, or have graduated within the last year. Those enrolled must have and maintain a cumulative grade point average of 2.5 or higher. License: Possession and maintenance of a valid Class C California Driver's License. Supplemental Information SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS Essential duties require the mental and/or physical ability to: work in a standard office environment and use standard office equipment and current software; to grasp, perform repetitive hand movements and fine coordination to prepare documents and data using a computer keyboard and mouse/trackball; sit for prolonged periods of time; walk, stand, crouch, reach, twist, turn, kneel, bend, squat, stoop and safely lift and move equipment and materials weighing up to 35 pounds; converse by telephone, by email, in person, and to small or large groups and be clearly understood; read and comprehend legal, technical and complex documents; interact with the public and all different levels of City staff in an effective and professional manner; and safely drive to various locations throughout the City and County to travel to fulfill assigned duties. Essential functions must be performed with our without reasonable accommodations. Administrative Interns may work for no more than 1,000 hours per fiscal year, and may not serve for more than one-year in this classification. SELECTION PROCEDURE Candidates must submit a completed City of Hayward job application and responses to the Supplemental Questionnaire, which fully describe the nature of their professional experience and qualifications. An official academic transcript must be submitted prior to the first day of employment. _Applications submitted without all required materials will not be considered._ Based on the information provided, those best qualified may be invited to the next phase of the process, which may include an oral, practical, and/or written examination. The examination process will result in a ranked eligible register of candidates for hiring consideration by the department. Actual hire depends on success in the departmental selection process. Candidates under final consideration for employment with the City should expect to undergo an employment background/reference check that may include, but is not limited to: employment history, confirmation of educational credentials and degrees, licenses including driver's license, registrations, certificates, and other credentials as part of the appointment process. Some positions, depending on the nature of the work, also require a credit check and a review of Summary Criminal History obtained from the State Department of Justice through Live Scan Fingerprinting. _Applicants will be notified electronically via Government Jobs as to their status in the selection process. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure they can receive email notice from Neogov/Government Jobs and the City of Hayward._ APPLICATIONS Candidates are encouraged to apply online at www.hayward-ca.gov under the Current Vacancies tab or at www.NeoGov.com. Paper applications can be obtained by visiting the Human Resources Department at Hayward City Hall located at 777 B Street, Hayward, CA 94541. Office hours are Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Apply prior to the closing time of the job announcement and allow at least one (1) hour to submit your application if you are a new user to the system. Our on-line application system is provided by Government Jobs. If you have problems while applying online, please contact the Government Jobs Help Desk at (877) 204-4442. _The City of Hayward is an Equal Opportunity Employer_
IT Skills: Proper English usage, spelling, grammar, and punctuation, Basic statistics and research methodology, Modern office practices and software, including Microsoft Office Suite
Soft Skills: Effective communication, Ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships, Ability to read, understand, interpret, and apply policies and procedures, Customer service skills
Education: Coursework in public administration, business administration, political science, social sciences, law, accounting, planning, or related field

Description: Avenue5 Residential is growing! We are in search of a Leasing Consultant to join our amazing and dynamic team! Who are we? Avenue5 is a multi-family property management firm that reaches 13 states. Established in 2014, we are 1,000 associates strong! We are proud of our vibrant, inclusive, make-it-happen culture, where we: Listen to our associates, recognize them, and give them room to grow Invest in our associates to help them become the best version of themselves Approach every important decision with our associates in mind Celebrate our associates’ successes and encourage them to raise the bar even higher Who are you? An energetic people magnet that can lease apartments in a competitive, highly sought after market, while providing five-star service to current and potential residents. Leasing is your passion and you have a minimum of one year of sales/customer service experience. You are professional and eloquent in delivery of communication. You work well under pressure and in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. You have a high school diploma or equivalent. You are proficient at the Microsoft Office Suite and can quickly learn other software applications. You can work a regular schedule that may require working weekends and holidays. What we need We need a superstar that can lease units in a competitive market and in a high-profile location. The Leasing Consultant will be tasked with the following: Greet and welcome all visitors to the community using exceptional customer service and prospect qualifying/sales techniques to ensure leasing and retention goals are met. Help to create and promote a friendly and professional office environment by displaying exemplary customer service in all aspects of the position. Regularly inspect tour path, amenities, model and vacant apartment homes for quality assurance. Conduct community orientation and move in inspection with new residents. Address resident concerns courteously, professionally and in a timely manner. Contribute to and promote resident retention programs. Foster positive, active and collaborative relationships with residents, other communities and associated agencies. Accept rental payments with the parameters specified in company policy and procedure. Maintain current resident files in accordance with company policy. Complete weekly, monthly and annual reports, as directed. Complete all required training courses. Help create and maintain a positive company culture. Other tasks as required. Physical and Mental Requirements Employee must be able to lift and or move, up to 25 pounds. Stand/walk/sit for long periods of time. Climb stairs. Ability to work well under high-pressure situations. Ability to work autonomously and in a team environment. Ability to work successfully with a variety of personality types. _If this describes you, let's talk! Please reply to this ad with your resume. We look forward to talking to you!_
IT Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Ability to quickly learn other software applications
Soft Skills: Exceptional customer service, Sales techniques, Professional communication, Ability to work well under pressure, High school diploma or equivalent
Education: Related to Education:, High school diploma or equivalent

Description: At Abbott, we're committed to helping people live their best possible life through the power of health. For more than 125 years, we've brought new products and technologies to the world - in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals - that create more possibilities for more people at all stages of life. Today, 99,000 of us are working to help people live not just longer, but better, in the more than 150 countries we serve. Our IT Business Relationship Manager will be responsible for one of the IT Commercial application portfolios of Abbott’s Cardiac Arrhythmia and Heart Failure (CAHF) business unit. Makes sure the portfolio enhances organizational strategy through successful, consistent and predictable delivery of programs, projects and applications. Achieves this where needed with project staff which partners with the business, has excellent understanding of the business processes, is aware of the evolution of technologies. Proactively identifies areas of opportunity to apply IT for new business opportunities, process improvement, and cost efficiencies. Provides insight to the business unit on how to best develop and leverage IT capabilities for the organization(s). Primary point of contact for overall Operations/Supply Chain needs for the CAHF business unit. Responsible for prioritizing demand. Main Responsibilities Understands and contributes to the business unit (BU) strategy and translates business strategy in an aligned IT strategy and portfolio of programs, projects and applications. Influence and partner with business leaders (Director, Sr. Director level) to manage and align the BU IT portfolio. Facilitates agreement between BU management, on the portfolio of programs, projects, and applications, and ensures that unit long range plan and budgets are aligned. Understand the business of the unit, and ensure that IT solutions meet the needs of the business. Negotiates for and secures resources to meet the long-range needs of the BU. Recommend solutions assuring fit with business unit direction, strategy and priorities. Where needed involve IT business consultants and external technology experts. Consulting toward business process owners and business unit management on IT tools and solutions. Close collaboration with other parts of BU IT, adjacent business departments, and external partners to ensure adequate and timely delivery of agreed services, in line with agreed service levels. Partner and collaborate with key IT staff of other Abbott divisions in order to support cross divisional business initiatives, and explore IT synergies and efficiencies. Manage IT projects across business unit, and division wide when and where applicable. Participate in business projects based on IT expertise. Constant awareness of evolving regulatory requirements to the specific business unit, and influence the IT stakeholders and vendors in addressing these evolutions in the most efficient way. Acts as an escalation resource for BU management when IT related issues arise Works to proactively resolve IT issues, IT resource constraints and prevent chronic IT difficulties where possible. Understand the specific challenges and opportunities linked to the regulatory, legal, and economic situation of the business unit. Responsible for all aspects of people leadership for the Business IT Expert team; setting expectations, coaching, counseling, developing, evaluating, feedback, hiring, discipline and separation. Determine necessary skills set. Confronts and deals with people issues in a constructive and timely manner. Responsible for overall morale of team and promotes cohesive attitude. Establishes staffing/resources plans to determine appropriate mix of sourcing opportunities. Responsible for overall organizational effectiveness. Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional policies and procedures. Operates with goals set by the sector BRM. Has direct impact on capital budget, expenses and major project completion. Make strategic decisions that impact the business unit. Shared decision authority for business unit IT budget and project activities. Manage initiatives that span virtual teams across the world and cross cultures. Champion change and innovation. Stimulates creativity and innovation in others. Open to new ideas. Supports those who initiate change and take risks. Promotes a Global Perspective. Qualifications: Bachelor degree in computer science, business administration, engineering or another discipline relevant for the healthcare industry or equivalent experience. 12+ years of IT experience or business experience in large or midsized multinational health care organization. Pharma/Medical Device commercial, development, and manufacturing business process knowledge, as related to IT. Experience with GxP validation. Broad IT or business expertise in various disciplines. Additional experience in setting IT or business strategy and business IT alignment. Good organizational skills, including program/project management governance. Strong interdisciplinary, intercultural, influence, and networking skills. Experience with vendor management. Qualification in project management. Business unit relevant business process knowledge, as related to IT. Strong influence and negotiating skills. Experience leading teams - both with direct staff and indirect project teams. Ability to travel 10-20%.
IT Skills: IT Business Relationship Management, Project Management, IT Strategy Development, Business Process Knowledge, GxP Validation, Vendor Management, Program Management, Networking, Project Leadership, Risk Management
Soft Skills: Communication, Leadership, Negotiation, Coaching, Problem-solving, Team Management, Innovation, Global Perspective, Decision-making, Adaptability, Cultural Awareness

Description: Are you looking for an opportunity to be part of a fast growing and dynamic team? Do you want to broaden and deepen your understanding of key business drivers, challenges, risks and opportunities? Are you passionate about business intelligence and the impact it can have within a large business? If so, this role may be right for you. The Agile BI team (also known as Starlight) is responsible for growing and supporting an end-to-end BI platform at scale. Through this platform, we enable various audiences (from senior executives to field leaders) across many organizations to monitor and manage their business’ performance. We are looking for an experienced reporting and analysis manager who focuses on front-end experience delivery to join us in our evolution and take a leading role creating a roadmap for our Cloud + Enterprise audience. Responsibilities Develop and implement reporting solutions that provide accurate, timely and effective insight through a performant solution. Help our user base maximize the value of our BI solutions through readiness and hands-on support. Financial Insights: Continuously improve and evolve GM insights garnered through financial results and KPIs with goal of influencing/impacting business in positive manner and crisp story telling. Implement a regular cadence for continuous improvement and development of new features through the use of agile or scrum methodologies. Establish and operate data quality assurance processes. Manage regular updates and communications with all business stakeholders on program status, priorities, roadmap and risks/issues. Strategic thinking and planning around how we address and support business needs through the use of our latest and greatest BI technology. Qualifications BA/BS in computer science, mathematics, statistics, finance, or other technical/quantitative discipline 3+ years of experience working in BI projects including analytics, data warehousing and reporting development within a business function such as marketing, finance, sales, operations, etc. 3+ years of experience working with or managing technical BI/database development resources Experience supporting internal finance customers and familiarity with financial reporting Ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams Ability to manage multiple and competing projects/priorities Strong familiarity with Microsoft reporting tools including Excel, PowerPivot, and Power BI Knowledge of Microsoft financial systems such as MS Sales preferred Strong presentation, written and verbal communication skills Passion for using data and analytics to drive business value Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
IT Skills: Business Intelligence, Reporting Solutions, Financial Insights, Agile/Scrum Methodologies, Data Quality Assurance, Microsoft Reporting Tools, Financial Systems
Soft Skills: Strategic Thinking, Communication Skills, Collaboration, Project Management, Problem-Solving, Analytical Thinking, Adaptability

Description: Director of Data & Analytics At WeWork Global Technology, New York WeWork is the platform for creators, providing hundreds of thousands of members across the globe space, community, and services that enable them to do what they love and craft their life's work. Our mission is to build a world where people work to make a life, not just a living, and our own team members are central to that goal. We are building software for physical space that uses data and technology at each point in the building process, such that it can make better sourcing decisions, improve its designs, build faster and smarter, and ultimately improve the lives of the people working within its buildings. Our state of the art technologies and dedication to technological innovation are key reasons why WeWork has been able to scale from operating one workspace location to more than 210 in just over eight years. We are seeking a Director of Data & Analytics to lead the Data & Analytics organization and develop the strategic direction of the team. The group performs a wide breadth of work; from analyzing space utilization via sensor data and member engagement via sentiment analysis, to optimizing our construction pipelines and developing recommendation systems. This role will work closely with leaders in product and engineering. The ideal person for this role is inquisitive, authentic, optimistic, and transparent. They’re passionate about growing and developing the team, and excited to promote an insights-driven data culture. The role is based in our New York headquarters. Responsibilities: Define the data and analytics strategy in partnership with functional leadership. Build and manage a team of Analysts, Data Scientists, BI Developers, and Data Engineers that performs analyses and builds data products. Mentor and develop growth plans for those on the team. Build rapport and manage relationships with engineering, product, design, and other business stakeholders throughout the company. Weigh the priorities of our Product leaders to inform the Data & Analytics roadmap. Promote visibility into the work of the data team to demonstrate the value of data-driven decision-making. Collaborate with product teams and business units to identify and prioritize value creation opportunities. Requirements: 5+ years experience leading data teams, with experience managing managers 4+ years experience performing advanced analytics using structured and unstructured data. Solid conceptual understanding of methods in analytics and data science. Understanding of common roadblocks and technical challenges. Experience with SQL and Python/R. Proficiency in math, statistics, economics, engineering (or sociology/psychology with strong quantitative background) or a related field. Experience identifying, prioritizing, and getting buy-in for data opportunities within a large, rapidly growing organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
IT Skills: Analytics Strategy Development, Team Management, Data Analysis, Building Data Products, Relationship Management, Data-driven Decision-making, SQL, Python/R, Math and Statistics
Soft Skills: Leadership, Mentorship, Communication and Collaboration, Strategic Thinking, Team Development, Problem-solving, Prioritization

Description: What you’ll be doing... In this highly visible technical lead position, you will be responsible for providing Data Engineering leadership and support for the Enterprise Data Science portfolio. You'll be focused on expanding the model building, deployment, innovation and research capabilities across the teams. You'll work closely with a team of very talented data scientists and data engineers in driving the requirements, development, design and implementation of advanced platforms, tools, and systems in support of data science and machine learning initiatives to ensure proper alignment with enterprise initiatives and Verizon’s strategic objectives. To be successful in this position, you must… Possess a firm understanding of data management infrastructure and IT system hardware; Maintain knowledge in Data Science, Big Data and new technologies required to consistently deliver a competitive advantage to Verizon; Be Hands-on and appropriately transition, structure, clean, scrub, store and transform data to make it consumable and usable by data scientists; Automate data extraction and processing of data for modeling purposes where applicable; Recommend and implement process improvements; Identify areas for improvement, incorporating best-in-class and cutting-edge techniques, and designing new approaches and methodologies; and Assist with proof-of-concept implementations to test and assess off-the-shelf and home-grown technologies. Responsibilities: Evaluate and manage incoming requests for data science and analytics projects. Collaborate with the business to understand requirements and communicate back results; Drive Big Data Architecture and development / Advanced Tech Development. Research, design and implement new technologies for delivering leading edge solutions; Perform Data Science Support. Partner with the Data Science Community to develop tools, methodologies used to interpret large volumes of transactional or other forms of data used for mining and analytics to increase profitability, reduce churn and support new goods and services. Partner with the EDW team to plan and implement data science solutions; Keep abreast of data science and machine learning tools and methodology and technology, industry trends and competitive landscape to identify new tools, training, and development opportunities. Prepare and communicate executive level presentations focusing on Data Science, roadmaps, business value, project status and project benefits; The position will accelerates delivery team data science innovation efforts via technical guidance, solution design and hands on participation in experiments; Review data science requests for development; Work and collaborate with various teams to meet the challenge of the full integration of advanced data science and big data with established (or new) structured and clean data sources for improved business insights and actions; Exercise considerable judgement in developing methods, techniques and evaluation criteria in identifying advanced data science solutions, and collaborate with the business to gain competitive advantage in the marketplace; Implementation and support of data science data management and tools that enable advanced data science; and Enable and support the Data Science community in their efforts to create models and analytics that promote the initiatives of the business stakeholder community to expand and grow business opportunities and revenue. What we’re looking for... You'll need to have: Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Even better if you have: Master’s Degree in quantitative discipline. Experience in data modeling, programming, data mining, large scale data acquisition, transformation and cleaning of structured and unsecured data. Subject matter expertise/knowledge in data integration, data quality, and database architecture and data governance. Demonstrated proficiency in most of the following technical areas: SQL, Java, Hive, Python, Linux KSH. Deep understanding of Hadoop Eco System and Data Science Life Cycle. Experience in Open systems and Cloud based applications with AWS. Strong understanding of database concepts (Oracle, MS SQL, generic SQL). Strong understanding of data warehouse and data lake technology (Teradata, Aster, Hadoop). Some business knowledge in Marketing, Finance, and Customer Service. High level of curiosity and investigative mind-set with an attention to detail. Flexibility to adapt to new challenges to overcome short-term hurdles by staying focused on the team’s deliverables. Capacity for quickly learning and using widely available tools and methodologies. When you join Verizon... You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon. Equal Employment Opportunity We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or Veteran status. Different makes us better.
IT Skills: Data Engineering, Model Building, Data Management, IT System Hardware, Data Science, Big Data, Data Transformation, Automation, Process Improvement, Advanced Technologies, Big Data Architecture, Data Mining, Data Integration, Data Quality, Database Architecture, SQL, Java, Hive, Python, Linux KSH, Hadoop Ecosystem, Data Science Life Cycle, Open Systems, Cloud-Based Applications, AWS, Database Concepts, Data Warehouse, Data Lake Technology, Marketing Knowledge, Finance Knowledge, Customer Service Knowledge
Soft Skills: Leadership, Collaboration, Communication, Problem-Solving, Strategic Thinking, Innovation, Analytical Thinking, Curiosity, Attention to Detail, Adaptability, Quick Learner, Teamwork, Creativity, Flexibility

Description: Data Engineer, Analytics Are you looking for an opportunity to be part of a fast growing and dynamic team? Do you want to broaden and deepen your understanding of key business drivers, challenges, risks and opportunities? Are you passionate about business intelligence and the impact it can have within a large business? If so, this role may be right for you. The Agile BI team (also known as Starlight) is responsible for growing and supporting an end-to-end BI platform at scale that enables various audiences (from senior executives to field leaders) across many groups and businesses to monitor and manage key indicators. We are looking for a BI Engineer who has a proven record of successfully building and supporting analytics solutions and platforms to join us in our evolution, taking a leading role in designing, implementing and evolving innovative capabilities tailored to solving complex scenarios. In this role, you will also leverage Microsoft’s latest BI and cloud technologies for practical applications and directly provide feedback and recommendations to the product engineering teams. Responsibilities The role’s core responsibilities include: Design and development of key analytics capabilities using SSAS tabular modeling and DAX Evolving our process and architecture by implementing new technologies (Azure PaaS, TOM) Analyzing and solving complex business problems, breaking down the work into actionable tasks, and working with our PMs to plan and communicate delivery commitments Consistently improving and optimizing tabular models to achieve peak performance across the entire analytics platform Thought leadership, creation, and execution of new platform capabilities Qualifications The ideal candidate will have the following qualifications: BA/BS in operations, computer science, mathematics, statistics, or other technical/quantitative discipline 4+ years of BI development experience using MS based technologies 2+ years of experience developing SSAS tabular models with large and complex datasets Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, Excel, Power BI Excellent problem solving, critical thinking skills, and communication skills Azure and COSMOS experience highly valued Machine Learning, Data Science, and statistical modeling preferred Knowledge of Microsoft data assets/systems preferred Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
IT Skills: SSAS tabular modeling, DAX, Azure PaaS, TOM, SQL, Excel, Power BI, Machine Learning, Data Science, Statistical modeling, Microsoft data assets/systems
Soft Skills: Problem-solving, Critical thinking, Communication
Education: Education-related Skills:, BA/BS in operations, computer science, mathematics, statistics, or other technical/quantitative discipline

Description: Microsoft Cloud Infrastructure and Operations is the team behind the cloud. MCIO is responsible for delivering over 200 Microsoft web portals, Live and Online Services around the world including infrastructure, security and compliance, operations, globalization, and manageability. Our focus is on smart growth, high efficiency, and delivering a trusted experience to customers and partners worldwide. We are looking for a passionate, high energy individual to help build the network that powers the world’s largest online services. Cloud Infrastructure Strategy and Architecture is seeking a skilled Executive Business Administrator to provide support to multiple General Managers and their teams, working alongside the team EA to support a team of 130 and growing. This position will support the Energy, Site Selections, and Global Networking teams. This role will take on a variety of tasks while working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational and communication skills, be able to proactively anticipate needs and shift priorities quickly, be self-motivated, self-aware, and have the ability to balance a sense of humor with a sense of responsibility. Candidates should appreciate an energetic work environment, and have a sense of urgency for key deliverables, deliberate and forward-thinking in how he/she approaches challenges, and operate administratively at scale. Responsibilities Proven track record in supporting executive fully Proven excellence in administrative skills and functions Ability to interface at the exec-level with customers and partners both internal and external Professionalism to represent the exec office effectively Strong planning and organizational skills to effectively prioritize Demonstrated customer service focus Strong written and verbal communication skills Comfortable operating within ambiguity and changing direction rapidly to accommodate a fluctuating work environment Ability to maintain cool and focused under pressure Provide positive interactions with others Proficiency with Microsoft software and internal tools including iCIMS, HeadTrax, MyOrder, and MSS Ability to lift 25 pounds Ability to be in the office during core business hours 3-5 years of work experience supporting a senior-level manager Qualifications Duties may include but are not limited to: Complex calendar management Travel logistics and expense reporting Team SharePoint and OneNote creation and/or maintenance Procurement and management of supplies, hardware and assets Office set ups/tear downs Equipment management Headcount management Facility requests Create and maintain org charts Maintain DLs and SGs as needed Ensure compliance of operational policies and procedures Coordinate other projects as assigned Serve as backup support to the EA as needed Morale event planning and organization Ability to lift 25 pounds Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
IT Skills: Microsoft software proficiency, Experience with iCIMS, Experience with HeadTrax, Experience with MyOrder, Experience with MSS
Soft Skills: Strong organizational skills, Strong communication skills, Ability to prioritize effectively, Excellent customer service skills, Ability to work under pressure, Strong written and verbal communication skills, Ability to maintain professionalism, Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, Strong planning skills, Ability to anticipate needs and shift priorities quickly, Self-motivated, Sense of humor, Sense of responsibility

Description: The Systems Administrator (Corporate Network) will perform a wide variety of technical application, networking, and infrastructure functions within the company. This role is responsible for maintaining our current systems\infrastructure of our existing multi-site topology, and involved in our expansion to new locations and cloud providers. The ideal candidate for this position is certified with Cisco networking equipment, and is well-versed in Windows-based cloud computing solutions. Key responsibilities : Design, recommend and implement secure networking designs in a multi-site topology Implement and maintain new SD-WAN technologies at all corporate locations and cloud providers Build and maintain infrastructure and systems for corporate business needs Design and maintain network LAN/WAN infrastructure and monitoring performance Design and support wireless network in a variety of environments Design, maintain, and troubleshoot firewall and associated connectivity Maintain AD environment in our network at all corporate locations Perform day-to-day support activities to maintain employee systems: telephony, desktop, and network access Windows server and migrations 2008/R2, 2012/R2, 2016 Stays current on emerging technology and be able to provide recommendations for future technology investments.
