Description: Senior Network Services Manager - Horsham, PA req6354 Employment Type : Regular Location : HORSHAM,PA _Have you ever enjoyed Arnold®, Brownberry® or Oroweat® bread? A Thomas’® English muffin or bagel? Or perhaps snacked on a Sara Lee®, Entenmann’s® or Marinela® cake or donut? If the answer is yes, then you know Bimbo Bakeries USA!_ _Bimbo Bakeries USA is part of Grupo Bimbo, the world’s largest baking company with operations in 32 countries. Bimbo Bakeries USA (“BBUSA”) includes BBUSA and its subsidiaries and affiliated entities, including, but not limited to, Wholesome Harvest Baking, East Balt, and Acelerada. BBUSA employs 20,000 associates across the U.S. in bakeries, sales centers, corporate offices and on sales routes to ensure our consumers have the freshest products to feed their families at every meal. But our associates come to work for much more – the chance to feed their own lives through exciting work that offers the opportunity to make a real difference in their professional and personal lives every day._ Description : This Senior Manager Network Services will be responsible for the development of the future network technology structure and defining the long term strategic direction and architectural design of BBU’s Enterprise Network Infrastructure, working in a 7X24X365 environment with over 1,000 locations with 8,000+ personal computers, 1,000+ Tablets, 4,500+ mobile devices, 800+ servers and large distributed network environment where service availability and end user productivity is key. Responsible for building a strong and prioritized plan utilizing emerging technologies in order to deliver against the Infrastructure and Operations strategy and ensure strategic, design, architecture, and engineering standards are created, updated, and applied throughout the Network Services organization. Manage the Network Services team and projects, and lead various transformative Network initiatives (Network redesign, infrastructure upgrades, new build outs), both strategic and tactical in nature, that will address most important challenges including scalability, reliability, security, and the performance requirements for the digital business applications and an improved end-user experience for the user community at BBU. This role will report into the Director-Infrastructure and Operations. Key Job Responsibilities Manage the functional group’s personnel development and technical training plans to ensure continued growth and opportunities for personnel, and maintain an organizational culture that attracts and retains top technical and managerial talent. Lead the day to day operations for a team of network professionals, set team goals, perform reviews and challenge team members, remove obstacles, determine technical direction, and lead initiatives. Ensure network availability and performance to the business and business applications, 7 x 24 x 365. Interpret business strategy and develop organizational objectives to align with network strategy. Oversee the administration, health, lifecycle management, risk mitigation and process compliance during delivery of projects. Ensure infrastructure is delivered and supported cost effectively and that total cost is defined for specific initiatives. Maintains and manages technical relationships with vendors. Develop and manage relationships with network/telecom suppliers and managed service partners, including negotiation of equipment and service costs/terms. Work with vendors to implement product feature improvements for reliability, availability, and serviceability. Build and maintain relationships with major technology suppliers to continuously explore opportunities to increase the business value of products and services received. Provide technical expertise as an escalation point for the Network Services Team. Oversee architecture and engineering effort and ensure that solutions are being developed in accordance to business requirements. Coordinate integration and operationalization of all acquisitions and divestitures. Ensure voice of customer and customer centric thinking is built into all processes and support. Oversee all core network change management activities (peering, transport, hardware, etc ) including the development of change and test plans. Develop, manage, and contribute to short - term planning and long - term strategy to deliver infrastructure initiatives that meet business needs, including innovation where appropriate and while maintaining a flat or declining service cost. Identify new and emerging methodologies (e.g. Agile, Lean, Six Sigma) to ensure best in class DevOps Data Network Services solutions. Delivering and reporting on metrics to assess capacity of Operations services and adherence to service levels. Maintain operational budget accuracy and project future capital expenditure. Troubleshooting network hardware and software applications, security systems to resolve operational issues and restore services. Perform capacity planning exercises to ensure optimal user experience. Position Requirements : Education and Work History Bachelors of Arts / Science required. Masters preferred. 10-15 years of experience in IT Key IT Experience Managed and lead highly skilled technical (architects, engineers) matrix teams (internal and external) for large scale, enterprise-wide full lifecycle projects, architecture, design, build, deploy and run. Experienced in managing large, distributed environments, including MPLS and Broadband. Experienced working with telecom carriers on circuit provisioning, lifecycle activities, outages and outage escalations. Experience maintaining an accurate inventory of network devices, circuits, configurations, and costs. Ability to produce management reports on inventory, performance, capacity, and costs. Superior knowledge in enterprise LANs, WANs, WLANs including routers, switches, network load balancers, SIP, SDWAN, wireless access points, video systems, VoIP, mobility, etc. Knowledge of information security risks and counter measures for networking equipment. Knowledge of firewalls, data encryption, intrusion detection systems, antivirus software, and other industry standard techniques and practices. Knowledgeable in internetworking technologies likes VLAN, STP, and Routing Protocol like EIGRP, BGP, OSPF, Static Routing, route-redistribution, summarization, Policy-Routing, MPLS-based technologies, Broadband, IP Telephony. Working knowledge and understanding of network security, such as IPSEC tunnels, VPNs and firewalls. Strong network design and architecture for large scale enterprises with knowledge of all advanced protocols and solutions. Understanding of switching technologies; trunking, spanning-tree, dot1q, VLANs, VTP, Ethernet switching, Multi-layer switching. Expertise of network management; SNMP, Netflow, IPSLA, etc. Specific experience with and/or management of the following: Routing and Switching – Cisco Switches and Routers; Wireless – Cisco Wireless Controllers; Firewalls – Checkpoint Firewalls; Proxy – Bluecoat Proxy in Cloud; Voice – Cisco Unified Communications Manager; Video – Cisco Telepresence and Expressways; Network Monitoring – SolarWinds NPM Key Behavioral Competencies Strong Leadership and organizational skills. Large Scale Project Management skills. Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment both as an individual contributor and member of a cross-functional team. Highly self-motivated and directed. Keen attention to detail. Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. Description: The Lead Cloud Architect is responsible for analyzing existing applications and developing new technology solutions, consolidating applications or replacing applications related directly to Cloud-oriented Penn Medicine environments, particularly those for the Perelman School. He or she ensures convergence between current and future business needs and technologies by establishing architectural guidelines, enterprise conceptual data models, service-oriented environments, and service interfaces. In addition, the Lead Cloud Architect is responsible for developing the Architecture Roadmap for the research enterprise Cloud usage, for defining Patterns & Best Practices for system implementations, and for providing Governance over development and implementation activities. Main Accountabilities: Analyze, define and maintain Cloud application and data technical architectures. Develop cloud/hybrid cloud technology road maps for the application architecture and development groups. Determine the appropriate architecture strategy for business specific vs. standard technologies. Participate in defining future state research application architectures through the evaluation, selection and integration of necessary technical components to create solution designs that support the defined functional and non-functional requirements. Provide “technical” leadership to development staff, as required. Ensure that designed or reviewed solutions conform to architectural requirements such as scalability, maintainability, reliability, extensibility, usability and security. Define Cloud data and technology synergies with upstream and/or downstream applications to maximize usage and value of systems and data. Collaborate with Penn Medicine information security and compliance teams to deliver the appropriate security and compliance profiles for a diverse Cloud user base. Performs duties in accordance with Penn Medicine and entity values, policies, and procedures Other duties as assigned to support the unit, department, entity, and health system organization Minimum Requirements : Education/Experience: Bachelor's Degree required in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar field. 7+ years’ experience leading complex technical cloud applications projects. Master's Degree preferred in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar field; and 7+ years’ experience leading complex technical cloud applications projects and integrations. Required Skills and Abilities: Understanding of complexities of the Cloud and analytical computing domains, data structures and standards, controlled vocabularies, and secure multitenant application requirements. Ability to manage projects from inception to successful implementation. Ability to work in ambiguous and dynamic environments, meeting obscure and changing client and organizational application and data requirements. Ability to work within deadlines and with multiple priorities; ability to adapt to changing priorities. Must have advanced experience working with Microsoft AZURE cloud technologies. Preferred Skills and Abilities: Familiarity with the scientific/research process. Working knowledge of AWS cloud technologies. Additional Information : We believe that the best care for our patients starts with the best care for our employees. Our employee benefits programs help our employees get healthy and stay healthy. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits program that includes one of the finest prepaid tuition assistance programs in the region. Penn Medicine employees are actively engaged and committed to our mission. Together we will continue to make medical advances that help people live longer, healthier lives. Penn Medicine http://www.pennmedicine.org/careers/ Live Your Life's Work EOE/AA, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Job Title: Material Handler II - Forklift - B36 3rd Shift

Description: ALS provides a broad range of testing and analytical services to a wide variety of end markets and industries around the globe. We continue to remain at the forefront of the testing services industry, building an enviable reputation. Perpetuation of the ALS Core Values and in developing a performance culture through staff engagement . Manage the global job posting (LinkedIn account) and provide assistance with ALS website job posting. Downloading due diligence documents for new acquisitions. Reviewing documents and putting into a draft HR DD Review report. Operational Human Resources Provision of support to HR team members as required. Assist with contract of employments and employment packs for Corporate roles and executive roles globally Management of onboarding and off boarding for the Corporate office. Assist in investigations in relation to formal complaints (e.g. discrimination, unfair dismissal, harassment etc) as required. Provide support during the annual STI and salary review processes. Provide internal and external (Paynet) remuneration benchmarking data as requested by managers. Recruitment support, ie. Drafting PDs, posting ads, short-listing. Occupational Health & Safety Repsonsibilities: Be familiar with the safety requirements as set out in the safety manual. Have a knowledge of the company safety policy. Notify and/or rectify any unsafe practice acknowledged by any ALS staff member. Qualifications Position Requirements: Tertiary Qualifications – preferably HR or Psychology related. May be working part time through a degree but be substantially through this. Minimum of 1 years’ HR and administration experience. Analytical skills. Advanced Microsoft Office skills, especially in Excel SharePoint administration experience or interest.. Social Media experience or interest. Core Competencies: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with strong grammatical ability. Exceptional communication skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate with staff and Managers at all levels. The ability to work under pressure, juggling multiple projects and deadlines. Strong attention to detail and accuracy. Strong organisational and time management skills. Professional presentation. Good with numbers, Excel analysis highly regarded or to have an interest in this area. Job Title: S. Cal presaes - Solutions Architect Qubole
Description: This is a pre-IPO expanding VERY rapidly with both a product that is exceptional as well as the right people driving it forward. Growing over 200% annually for the last few years they need top people with both small company and large company experience who can and will hit the ground running. Great VC's backing, great people on board. They work closely with our sales team as their technical partners in all the phases of the sales process from evangelizing and demonstrating the technology to prospects, to defining and executing proof of concepts and answering any technical questions aroundour service and how it solves the clients big data problems. Description: General Mills is reshaping the future of food. We believe food makes us better. It nourishes our bodies, brings us joy and connects us to each other. As one of the world’s leading food companies, General Mills operates in more than 100 countries and markets more than 100 consumer brands, including Cheerios, Nature Valley, Betty Crocker, Yoplait, Annie’s Homegrown, Old El Paso, Epic Provisions, Blue Buffalo and more. Are you passionate about the future of food? You’ve come to the right table. We want the very best talent to help lead something big. POSITION OVERVIEW The Product Safety team ensures recall and organic certification readiness of our production and warehousing sites. The Product Safety Manager role is key member of the Inventory Controls and Safety leadership team – supporting product safety excellence across roughly 250+ North American sites that produce, warehouse, or distribute General Mills finished products. This position interacts with Quality, Logistics, Sales, Manufacturing, and external leadership teams and reports to the Inventory Control and Safety Manager for North American Warehousing. RESPONSIBILITIES Champion a belief in zero food safety incidents and drive improvements in the Product Safety process and results across the North American Supply Chain. Direct and lead the Product Safety team in the development, prioritization, and implementation of key initiatives in support of the North American Warehousing priorities and Roadmap. Manage the organic audit, warehouse audit, and reconciliation process to support regulatory response times. Lead the debrief process of these events and partner with sites to drive to institutional fixes. Act as a single point of contact for Food Safety & Quality (FSQ) to ensure timely and accurate data supporting potential market action. Provide 24/7 support during potential recall situations. Oversee weekly shipment accuracy reporting to all producing and warehousing sites. Oversee weekly hazardous and non-hazardous hold reporting and drive action against those sites with inventory variances. Oversee reporting to accurate inventory and code date visibility. Drive a continuous improvement and problem-solving culture across Logistics and Manufacturing in support of Product Safety. Provide timely and actionable feedback to the Product Safety team and exemplify Servant Leadership to remove barriers and enable differential results. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree in any major 5+ years of related experience, plant or warehouse management experience supporting inventory control and/or hold management preferred Thorough knowledge of inventory management systems (SAP, RedPrairie) and Supply Chain flow Strong leadership skills and the ability to drive change Strong conceptual, analytical and decision-making skills Excellent interpersonal, communication and listening skills Ability to engage, motivate, and develop others Ability to provide 24/7 support during crisis situations Demonstrated capabilities at managing and developing people Demonstrated process improvement experience with compelling results CB1
IT Skills: Food Safety, Inventory Management, SAP, RedPrairie, Supply Chain Management
Soft Skills: Leadership, Change Management, Communication, Problem-Solving, Interpersonal Skills, Decision-Making, Continuous Improvement, Coaching and Development, Crisis Management

Description: Our Company Veeva (NYSE: VEEV) is building the industry cloud for life sciences. We develop cloud software that helps our customers develop and bring medicines to the patients that need them. Veeva started in 2007 and has grown quickly to over 2,000 employees. We’re on our way to 10,000 over time and were named among the fastest growing public technology companies on Forbes’ Fast Tech 25 list. Our Culture & People We are focused on staying “Still Veeva” as we grow. Our core values are Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our team brings passion, intensity and teamwork to their roles. We have low employee turnover and are known as a great place to work. Veeva is genuine, straightforward, and no drama. The Role Veeva OpenData is looking for a highly technical Associate Data Engineer to help develop and maintain our growing integration platform. The incumbent is a strong developer who has experience working in an agile environment. You will closely collaborate with OpenData engineers who have passion for producing quality code and dedicated to best practices such as automated testing, code reviews, continuous integration, and continuous deployment. Responsibilities Your primary responsibility is to design, develop, and implement programs and services that take in data from multiple sources/formats, and load them into persisting data stores, all are part of the Veeva OpenData integration planform Design and develop ETL and master data management processes Troubleshoot various software issues using debugging process and coding techniques Provide high-level customer support to Veeva internal clients You will build indices for Elasticsearch Install, configure and deploy software Requirements Excellent team player who enjoys a collaborative team environment BS in Computer Science or Engineering or closely related discipline Experience programming using Python Experience with one or more JVM-based programming languages (Scala, Java, Groovy etc.) Experience using Scala on Spark, including building ETL and complex queries Experience using and configuring Elasticsearch and Kibana Experience using NOSql databases, Mongodb is a plus 2+ years of hands-on experience with SQL, data modeling, and relational databases such as Oracle, DB2, and Postgres Proficient with Linux Outstanding problem solving and troubleshooting skills Nice to Have Participated in AGILE SCRUM meetings Experience using git Experience using Talend Experience with JIRA for support tickets and Confluence for our knowledge base Experience with NiFi Experience with Google TensorFlow Experience working with eastern European languages Exposure and basic understanding of ML or NLP or Text Mining techniques Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Veeva Systems does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B or TN status) for this employment position. About Veeva Veeva Systems is a leader in cloud-based software for the global life sciences industry. Committed to innovation, product excellence, and customer success, Veeva has more than 550+ customers, ranging from the world's largest pharmaceutical companies to emerging biotechs. Veeva is headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area, with offices in Europe, Asia, and Latin America. Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.
IT Skills: Python, JVM-based programming languages (Scala, Java, Groovy, etc.), Scala on Spark, Elasticsearch, Kibana, NoSQL databases (MongoDB), SQL, Data modeling, Relational databases (Oracle, DB2, Postgres), Linux, Git, Talend, JIRA, Confluence, NiFi, Google TensorFlow, Machine Learning (ML) or Natural Language Processing (NLP), Text Mining
Soft Skills: Team player, Problem solving, Troubleshooting

Description: About JDA Software Group, Inc. _JDA Software is the leading supply chain provider powering today’s digital transformation. We help companies optimize delivery to customers by enabling them to predict and shape demand, fulfill faster and more intelligently, and improve customer experiences and loyalty. More than 4,000 global customers use our unmatched end-to-end solutions portfolio to unify and shorten their supply chains, increase speed of execution and profitably deliver to their customers. Our world-class client roster includes 73 of the top 100 retailers, 71 of the top 100 consumer goods companies, and 13 of the top 16 3PLs. Running JDA, you can_ _plan to deliver._ __ www.jda.com Position Title VP, Retail Industry Strategy, North America Location Virtual, United States Overview The Vice President of Industry Strategy is responsible for the creation of the North America Retail strategy and its Go-To-Market execution plan. The retail vertical within JDA is a fast paced, high growth segment, with an extensive portfolio of solutions that cover many of the end to end Retail processes in Grocery, Hardlines, Drug and Softlines. It is a pivotal role within the North America management team, operating in a highly collaborative manner, within a matrix organizational structure. Responsibilities Within a corporate framework, lead and collaborate with all functional heads in creating and executing the Retail strategy across North America. Map the portfolio of JDA solutions to the Retail sub verticals based on their market characteristics and opportunities for JDA. Shape the Marketing strategy and work with Partners and Alliances to support the successful execution of the plan. Actively engage with Press & PR and Industry Analysts, in support of our Retail business. Represent JDA at key external events and professional bodies. Develop Retail messaging and collateral that is localized and promotes our strategy Engage with senior Retail Executives, providing a perspective of industry trends, from both a business and technology perspective. Commercially evaluate Sales budgets and supporting pipeline, and advise on remedial action to achieve plans. Business expertise in Buying & Merchandising or Supply Chain Technology and Digital experience, with an understanding of AI, Machine Learning, Data Science and IOT. Ours unite us. They are what drive our success – and the success of our customers. Does your heart beat like ours? Find out_ _here._ Let’s Socialize _Join the conversation online by connecting and following us on Twitter @JDASoftware @JDACareers and Facebook (_ http://bit.ly/9s2DVE _), and LinkedIn (_ http://bit.ly/2rV4Kue _) Also, check out JDA's blog - Supply Chain Nation - the platform for supply chain trends and innovations at_ http://blog.jda.com _._ LI-CR1 Required Experience

Understands that collaboration leads to better, faster results Collaborates with others to ensure the customer has appropriate resources and support Collaborates with the customer providing solution based proposals in order to drive the partnership and future growth opportunities Shares best practices with the team, and coaches and mentors other team members Intense drive, go getter, fire in the Description: PYCO Group is a global team of passionate consultants and developers who accelerate digital transformation and deliver result driven solutions. With more than 500 people on 4 continents, we help business leaders re- imagine, design, build and operate a smooth digital business transition, thanks to the knowledge of our onshore and offshore dedicated teams. We do so by attracting, empowering and retaining exceptional talents while unlocking opportunities for our clients and employees simultaneously. Global-scale clients making use of the PYCO Group’s products and services include Microsoft, Samsung, Volkswagen, Axa, Richemont, BNP Paribas, Wal-Mart, Adobe, La Poste, Accor Hotels, LVMH, Mitsubishi, Calvin Klein, L’Oréal amongst many others. In other words, we build digital teams & solutions. What will be your role? Context: We will be part of the development team of apps and services that use machine learning to inform and assist clients for both in the insurance industry. This is mainly achieved through: 1\. Incubation of disruptive innovation (through scientists, engineers and designers working together) 2\. Machine learning R&D (and publication in top AI/ML conferences and journals) 3\. Machine-learning advisory / consultancy The resulting solutions and innovations aim to reinvent internal processes, improve the offerings to the clients and ultimately disrupt the wider industry. We are looking for Fullstack Developers to join us and contribute to the development of disruptive apps / products – part of a series of exciting new projects, solving complex business problems. This is an exciting opportunity for those who want to enjoy state-of-the-art R&D and be challenged and grow in the field of “AI-first” software / product development; along the way this role will contribute to game-changing products for the multi-trillion-dollar insurance industry and use the world’s largest insurer by many metrics global network to deliver impact and change. Who are we looking for? Self-motivated and creative. We’re building from ground up, not tweaking legacy In depth knowledge of backend infrastructure (e.g., Flask, Falcon, Redis, Varnish) Strong Python coding skills plus experience of a typed language (e.g. C++, Java, etc) Exposure to modern JavaScript technologies (e.g. ES6, React.js, Redux etc) Familiarity with build automation and continuous integration (e.g., Gulp, Grunt, Jenkins, CodePipeline) Good communicator and team player Solid understanding of algorithms and data structures
IT Skills: Backend infrastructure, Python coding, Typed language (e.g. C++, Java), Modern JavaScript technologies, Build automation and continuous integration, Algorithms, Data structures
Soft Skills: Self-motivated, Creative, Good communicator, Team player
Education: Skills Related to Education:, Algorithms, Data structures

Description: Purpose Provide research and analysis support on the commercial real estate office market. Future markets may be added as we expand our services. The role will encompass tasks around the collection and analysis of core data, as well as a range of activities that contribute to and support the team's production and delivery of research material. Reviews and evaluates data results collected by themselves and others within the research group to ensure accuracy and comprehensiveness of research data and analysis. Provides research support for pitches, presentations, internal and client meetings. Performs regular maintenance and updates to property databases by conducting telephone surveys, on-site surveys, research forums, broker meetings, extracting data from brochures and other marketing materials, contacting civic organizations, outside agents, internet, and other sources. May be responsible for writing regular quarterly reports and other written outputs with direction from research manager. Responsibilities Work with the Operations Director (OD) to collect and organize all required data needed to begin providing research services. Work on data clean up and de-duplicating any data acquired Work with OD in salesforce.com to set up reports, tables, and market report templates. Compile contact data for all targeted buildings Work with the OD to create Cost-Benefit Models and Templates for future use. Work with OD to establish point of contact and set expectations with available listings information requirements Begin to set up Market Research methodology and standards Work with Marketing Specialist on designing market report templates Work with OD to set up Agent requests for market research Begin to test and establish frequency of data updates Analyze market trends and incorporate findings into presentations, reports and white papers. Responds to ad hoc internal and external client requests for data, graphs, commentary, etc. Other duties may be assigned. No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to co-workers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project. Provide Cost-Benefit Analyses for Office Lease Deals Qualifications Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university, preferably in Real Estate, Economics, Finance, Geography, and a minimum of one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents and summarize graphically and in writing. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills. Ability to handle and manipulate large amounts of data. Intermediate experience with Microsoft Office. Possess a positive work attitude and ability to work in a team environment. Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines.
IT Skills: Data collection, Data analysis, Research support, Market trends analysis, Financial analysis, Database management, Writing reports, Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Soft Skills: Communication skills, Organizational skills, Analytical skills, Problem-solving skills, Ability to work in a team environment

Description: Guided by a visionary new strategic plan, Woodland Park Zoo (WPZ) is embarking on a period of great change and innovation. A key focus area is using actionable and predictive information to facilitate business decisions and make strategic recommendations for process improvements. In concert with key internal business units, the Business Intelligence Analyst/Developer is responsible for driving insights for Woodland Park Zoo’s Advancement division (Development, Content and Creative Strategy, Membership, Marketing, Advocacy and Public Affairs) through reporting and analysis to maximize constituent engagement, identify trends and ensure the long-term financial performance and impact of the organization. Reporting to the Associate Director, Relationship Data Services, this position will primarily focus on the reporting and analysis needs of the Development department and Content and Creative Strategy department, while working collaboratively with other WPZ departments. This position requires excellent skills in gathering, analyzing, and reporting data, often originating from multiple sources. Position requires an innovative, proactive, creative, highly motivated, team-oriented individual who has a high degree of initiative and independent judgment. Requires a positive and customer focused business approach focused on meeting current and future needs where data and knowledge derived from data will play a critical role in organizational decision making. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Create, develop, test, document and interpret consistent, relevant data insights to help guide the organization via accurate reporting, dashboards, analysis, and custom-built tools to deliver accurate and timely results. Coordinate, deploy and ensure the accuracy of standardized periodic reports, automating the process as appropriate Establish and maintain partnerships and synergies with other information and analytics teams, including but not limited to IT, Admissions, Finance, Conservation and Education departments. Oversee the day-to-day management and operation of the ODS for The Raiser’s Edge database. Use a variety of tools including Google Analytics and product dashboards as well as internal and external research resources to aggregate and synthesize data trends and insights across platforms. Monitor industry trends and implement best practices for continuous improvement of in-house capabilities and customer support. Advise collaborators on best practices in forming research questions and analysis strategies. Create user documentation. Initiate processing and record management procedural changes as needed. Keep all policies and procedural documents updated. Safeguard the confidentiality of donor information at all times. Maintain and adhere to policies around information gathering and sharing in accordance with professional ethics standards. Perform other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE Required: Bachelor's degree (B.S. or B.A.) from an accredited four-year college or university, as well as two (2) years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Passion for data. Great analytical skills. Able to define problems, establish facts, draw valid conclusions and provide actionable recommendations that support short term goals and considers long term process. Proven ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks/requests simultaneously under time constraints, and meet deadlines in a professional manner. Full data lifecycle perspective (requirements gathering through production deployment and support) in aspects of SQL Server, Microsoft Business Intelligence solutions, Tableau, SSRS and Crystal Reports. Proficiency of MS SQL Server Relational Database Management software including T-SQL. Established experience with SSIS package Design, Development, Testing and Troubleshooting for data migration. Knowledge of entity-relationship models and data normalization. Working experience with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics. Strong listening, written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate technical ideas verbally and in writing to non-technical staff. Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and maintain the professional and ethical standards set forth for the field by the Association of Professional Researchers for Advancement (APRA), Association of Advancement Services Professionals (AASP) and Association of Fundraising Professionals (AFP). Commitment to the mission of the zoo and the institution’s Core Values. Desired: Experience with The Raiser’s Edge, Omatic Software products and point of sale systems. Knowledge of fundraising operations and data management. Working knowledge of e-commerce, SEO, SEM, email and other online marketing optimization activities. Advanced Excel skills, including complex spreadsheets, pivot tables, and data manipulation. Experience using statistical analysis techniques and building regression and/or predictive models. Experience with automation tools. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This job has no supervisory responsibilities. LANGUAGE ABILITY Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. MATHEMATICAL ABILITY Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs. REASONING ABILITY Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Ability to recall, recognize and communicate interrelated information pertaining to Zoo benefactors and members. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This job is performed in a typical office environment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. APPLICATION DIRECTIONS Applications are only accepted online through our Jobs page at www.zoo.org; no other forms of application will be accepted. Cover letter and resume are REQUIRED when applying for this position. NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE. APPLICATION DEADLINE: This position will remain posted until filled; priority will be given to applications received prior to August 26th, 2018. _Woodland Park Zoo is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, disability, veteran’s status, sexual orientation, or gender identity/expression._
IT Skills: Data analysis, Reporting, Dashboards, Business intelligence, SQL, Microsoft Business Intelligence solutions, Tableau, SSRS, Crystal Reports, SSIS, Entity-relationship models, Data normalization, Google Analytics, T-SQL, Excel, Statistical analysis, Regression models, Data migration, Automation tools
Soft Skills: Analytical skills, Problem-solving skills, Time management, Communication skills, Confidentiality, Ethics, Prioritization, Teamwork

Description: Under minimal supervision and following established policies and procedures, performs scientific investigative research and participates in carrying out research objectives. Researches literature in the field. Conducts experiments and collects and analyzes data using various degrees of statistical methodology. Performs duties of a Research Assistant as described in the job description for that position. _PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:_ Plans and sets-up research protocols and conducts experiments following established protocols and research methodology; gathers data for analysis and interpretation of test results. Recruits and obtains informed consent from patients and healthy volunteers and ensures research participants meet all inclusion and exclusion criteria and maintains participant confidentiality according to HIPPA laws. Conducts critical analyses and evaluation of sleep laboratory and psychological data generated on patients and healthy volunteers and maintains and oversees the quality of data collected. Evaluates and scores sleep recordings, interprets, groups data (i.e., patients of different pathological conditions), and maintains study data base. Maintains study library of official documents (i.e., protocol, Institutional Review Board communications, protocol changes, drug dispensing logs). Processes and records samples, orders materials as required per protocol, determines schedule for laboratory assessments as planned per protocol. Orders drugs and maintains drug dispensing logs per study protocol. Makes written progress reports and prepares summaries of data.  Prepares protocol submissions and approval renewals to the Institutional Review Board, informs Institutional Review Board of protocol changes, and makes written progress reports.  Keeps abreast of new techniques and reviews literature in the field pertinent to the area of research. May assist in writing papers for publication and scientific presentations based on research performed. Performs various degrees of statistical analysis related to the experiment. Develops research methodologies within the parameters of experimental protocols and research objectives to allow quantitative and qualitative evaluations and interpretation of data obtained. May assist in the preparation of annual reports and in writing research proposals. Proposes new ideas, discusses and/or advises the feasibility of proposed research.  Performs other related duties as required. _EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE_ : A professional level of knowledge or psychological and/or biological research and familiarity with scientific terminology, Bachelor degree program at an accredited college or university required. Masters degree in Science could be utilized in this position. Requires a working knowledge of statistics, computer applications and research methodologies. _Preferred Skills_ Comfortable reading scientific literature Strong computer skills, especially in Microsoft Excel. Experience with SPSS is a plus. High personal motivation and attention to detail; ability to independently manage tasks and meet deadlines without direct supervision Pay grade G17 Minimum$14.38 “This rate is the minimum pay for the position. Actual compensation will be based on education, years of experience, and other factors at the time of offer.” Overview Henry Ford Health System, one of the largest and most comprehensive integrated U.S. health care systems, is a national leader in clinical care, research and education. The system includes the 1,200-member Henry Ford Medical Group, five hospitals, Health Alliance Plan (a health insurance and wellness company), Henry Ford Physician Network, a 150-site ambulatory network and many other health-related entities throughout southeast Michigan, providing a full continuum of care. In 2015, Henry Ford provided $299 million in uncompensated care. The health system also is a major economic driver in Michigan and employs more than 24,600 employees. Henry Ford is a 2011Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Award recipient. The health system is led by President and CEO Wright Lassiter III. To learn more, visit HenryFord.com. Benefits Whether it's offering a new medical option, helping you make healthier lifestyle choices or making the employee enrollment selection experience easier, it's all about choice. Henry Ford Health System has a new approach for its employee benefits program - My Choice Rewards. My Choice Rewards is a program as diverse as the people it serves. There are dozens of options for all of our employees including compensation, benefits, work/life balance and learning - options that enhance your career and add value to your personal life. As an employee you are provided access to Retirement Programs, an Employee Assistance Program (Henry Ford Enhanced), Tuition Reimbursement, Paid Time Off, Employee Health and Wellness and access to day care services at Bright Horizons Midtown Detroit, and a whole host of other benefits and services. Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer Henry Ford Health System is committed to the hiring, advancement and fair treatment of all individuals without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, size, height, weight, marital status, family status, gender identity, sexual orientation, and genetic information, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal and state laws.
IT Skills: **** Research methodologies, statistical analysis, computer applications, Microsoft Excel, SPSS, scientific literature review.
Soft Skills: **** Attention to detail, time management, critical thinking, independence.
Education: **Education-Related Skills:** Professional knowledge of psychological and/or biological research, familiarity with scientific terminology, Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Science.

Description: Overview The Data Architect III is responsible for designing and documenting logical and physical Enterprise Application (OLTP) and Data Warehouse (OLAP) databases and creating the related ETL Design Specifications and supporting documentation. This team member actively leads and participates in Data Governance Initiatives to support the GM Financial Enterprise Data Strategy across operational and analytical database environments. The Data Architect III leads and coordinates cross functional teams on a project basis to effectively communicate database design related activities with a wide range of technical, non-technical, and third party team members. This team member is also responsible for the publication and distribution of Enterprise and Data Warehouse data models and related documentation throughout the company. The Data Architect III searches for, identifies, and exploits opportunities to enhance Enterprise analytical databases using knowledge gained from experience and from an understanding of emerging methodologies. Responsibilities JOB DUTIES: Create and document logical data integration (ETL) strategies for data flows between disparate source/target systems and the Enterprise Data Warehouse. Perform a variety of in-depth data analysis, data modeling, and data administration tasks on complicated datasets with potentially complex data integration scenarios with limited supervision. Provide senior level guidance in the interaction with business users to plan, develop, improve, and maintain complex components of the logical/physical Enterprise Data Warehouse and related models. Establish, maintain, adhere to, and enforce Enterprise Data Modeling and Data Integration standards. Communicate with and/or interview users to plan, develop, improve, and maintain moderately complex components of the logical/physical corporate model. Work closely with BSA, business, and IT team members to clarify and refine functional data requirement specifications. Develop and present training materials such as data flow diagrams, conceptual diagrams, UML diagrams, ER flow diagrams as needed in order to clarify data model meaning and usage effectively to a wide range of technical and non-technical consumers. Work closely with Database Administrators and Data Integration (ETL) developers resulting in effective data driven solutions. Participate in the implementation of strategic Enterprise Data Strategies. Must drive innovations by keeping current on emerging technology and Data Trends which may fit with GMF needs. Must be able to research, present, and accurately articulate benefits and goals of these technologies, such as Big Data, Hadoop, NoSQL, Data Virtualization, Data Services. Participate in the proliferation of our Corporate Meta-Data Repository. Maintain and administer the Corporate Data Model Repository. Create Reporting as required on Corporate Data Model Repository. Provide functional advice or training and serve as a mentor to less experienced Data Warehouse Analysts. OTHER IMPORTANT DUTIES Act as liaison for vendor and company communication. Perform special projects as assigned/required. REPORTING RELATIONSHIP: Reports to: Assistant Vice President Data Architecture Direct Reports: None Qualifications Knowledge Thorough understanding and working knowledge of data modeling and extensive experience in modeling and fact-finding techniques. Must have strong knowledge of Relational Database Design, Dimensional Database Design, and Hub and Spoke Database Design. Data Vault Modeling preferred. Must have strong working knowledge of ERwin Data Modeling Software. Must have strong working knowledge of ETL and Data integration techniques. Informatica Power Center Preferred. Thorough knowledge of SQL. Hands-on experience in creation and usage of 3rd Normal Form OLTP Databases/ Models. Hands-on experience in creation and usage of ETL Design Specifications. Hands-on experience in creation and usage of Dimensional Models (Star Schema, Kimball, Inmon) Advanced understanding of Busing Intelligence Tools and both their functional and technical requirements. Cognos preferred. Must have working knowledge of at least one of the following Data Management disciplines: Data Vault, Master Data Management, Data Virtualization, SOA, XML, Web Services, or Hadoop or similar Big Data methodology. Must be highly intelligent, conceptual, display excellent judgment, and be capable of analyzing business and management problems. Must possess the ability to arrive at sound and effective business solutions Position requires proficient business knowledge in the subject areas being modeled. Skills Excellent Oral and Written Communication Skills. Advanced Analytical Skills. Must be able to recognize and identify Patterns in Data Relationships from Disparate Systems. Must have the ability to independently identify opportunities for improvement in Enterprise Analytical Databases. Must possess strong organizational, facilitation and critical thinking abilities, to assess complex problems, analyze options, navigate diverse perspectives and objectives and develop acceptable Data Management solutions Must have a strong work ethic, positive demeanor, and drive to see projects through to successful completion. Must have the ability to think logically and design data structures for applications. Must have excellent oral and written communication skills, and the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks and a heavy workload. Must possess the interpersonal skills necessary to lead and coordinate others to accomplish goals on complex tasks/ projects. Must be able to present information in a clear and concise manner to all levels of the organization. Must have the ability to work both autonomously and with appropriate collaboration among other team members and applying Data Management concepts to a variety of “real-life” business scenarios. Must be assertive and proactive and have the ability to bring out the best in others. Must have strong project management skills. Experience Minimum of Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience required. Minimum of 7 years overall experience in information systems is required. Preferred background experience in Application Development, ETL Development, Report Development and/or other Data Warehouse Projects. Minimum 5 years data modeling experience. Minimum of 2 years working with ERwin Data Modeler. Experience working within an Enterprise Data Management role including transactional Data, Analytical Data, and Data Governance/Administration. Experience with Oracle is highly desired. Strong experience with Data Modeling and Data Integration tools. WORKING CONDITIONS: Normal office environment, subject to stressful situations. Will require occasional overtime. Must be able to provide routine off-hours support from home. May require very limited travel.
IT Skills: Data modeling, Relational Database Design, Dimensional Database Design, Hub and Spoke Database Design, Data Vault Modeling, ERwin Data Modeling Software, ETL and Data integration techniques, Informatica Power Center, SQL, rd Normal Form OLTP Databases/ Models, Dimensional Models (Star Schema, Kimball, Inmon), Business Intelligence Tools (Cognos), Data Management disciplines (Data Vault, Master Data Management, Data Virtualization, SOA, XML, Web Services, Hadoop), Big Data methodologies
Soft Skills: Oral and Written Communication Skills, Analytical Skills, Ability to identify Patterns in Data Relationships, Strong organizational skills, Facilitation skills, Critical thinking abilities, Positive demeanor and strong work ethic, Logical thinking and design skills, Prioritization skills, Interpersonal skills, Leadership skills, Project management skills

Description: Req. ID: 122612 As a Field Application Engineer – Packaging Specialist at Micron Technology, you will be in a customer facing engineering role representing Micron’s Packaging expertise. Your role is to be the primary contact with Tier1 and OEMs that are working on integrating Micron’s products into their automotive applications. You will be expected to establish a relationship with the packaging engineers and engineers at the customers, discuss their requirements and work with them in understanding and tuning their SMT processes. You will also be interfacing with Micron assembly engineering, packaging R&D; and Business Unit teams to feed customer packaging requirements into product development. Responsibilities : Ensure smooth integration of Micron products into OEMs in the area of SMT and packaging, to secure Design Wins. Be the packaging technical advisor to customers on behalf of Micron to determine best practices Manage customer issues when they see failures related to packaging, be the technical debug expert in the field to advise customers and to work with internal FA teams. Provide technical engagement with other organizational partners to ensure customer approach, deliverables, and priorities are being met Influence both internal and external customers and partners on package development and integration to enable successful high-volume manufacture of Micron products Maintain knowledge in the areas of reliability and environmental systems, including Moisture, ESDs, Thermal, BLR, and Handling Maintain and develop knowledge of how systems are integrated, including SMT, insertion technologies, handling, heat sink attach, design, and materials (anything that comes in contact with the package temporarily or permanently) Required Skills: Looking for a semiconductor packaging engineer with knowledge of automotive manufacturing practices SMT process experience including; under-fill application, screen printing, stencil design, pick and place, PoP assembly techniques, SPI, rework, heat sink/spreader assembly, etc. Semiconductor package thermal and mechanical analysis or design through the use of analytical methods such as CFD and FEA. Knowledge of semiconductor package materials including solder alloys Knowledge of semiconductor package and assembly quality and reliability. Strong experience in problem solving and engineering debug is required Excellent verbal, written, and customer communications skills The ability to be self-motivated, take initiative, and to work equally well independently and in a team environment Ability to travel for up to 25% of time Degree Required: BSEE / BSME or equivalent foreign education Academic Discipline (s): Engineering discipline Experience Required: 5 years experience developing SMT processes and establishing packaging specifications Location: Detroit, Michigan We recruit, hire, train, promote, discipline and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person's race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, pregnancy, veteran’s status, or other classifications protected under law. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for team members' disabilities or religious beliefs and practices. Each manager, supervisor and team member is responsible for carrying out this policy. The EEO Administrator in Human Resources is responsible for administration of this policy. The administrator will monitor compliance and is available to answer any questions on EEO matters. To request assistance with the application process, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 (or 208-368-4748). Keywords: Detroit || Michigan (US-MI) || United States (US) || SGA || Experienced || Regular || Sales || Not Applicable ||

Description: Supports analytic and business intelligence efforts within LegacyTexas. Primary responsibility will be to ensure the availability and usability of high quality data throughout the company. Through data acquisition, documentation, and standardization, the candidate will enable internal stakeholders to work more efficiently and effectively with data. Through self- serve analytics and training, the candidate will play a central role in driving a strong data culture at LegacyTexas. This position is not about solving a well-defined set of tasks but rather an independent individual with a talent for structuring solutions to broad, ambiguous questions related to data governance, and who shares our passion for improving lives through learning. The candidate will be the subject matter expert for analytics. RESPONSIBILITIES: Serve as subject matter expert on all aspects of LegacyTexas’ data reporting and analytics infrastructure. Leverage all aspects of BI technologies and architecture such as delivery mechanisms (i.e. portals, dashboards, OLAP), data model/architecture, data integration/ETL and reporting tools. Develops standard processes for business user requests for BI and analytics. Develops and maintain other BI and analytics standards for LegacyTexas including data sources and a data dictionary Develop, implement, and maintain change control and testing processes for modifications. Actively participate as an analytics and BI advocate and expert on teams to help promote the development of an analytics and BI culture within LegacyTexas. Analyzes data, design and develop complex reports and dashboards using industry standard reporting platform with little or no supervision. Collaborate with analysts, line-of-business owners, and other data-driven internal stakeholders to identify opportunities for better data access and usage. Validates report results against requirements for consistency and accuracy. Troubleshoots and analyzes data issues. Regularly updates management of development status. Other duties as assigned. PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENT: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Ability to withstand moderate physical activity throughout the work day (standing, walking, reaching). Ability to sit for extended periods of time. Ability to lift or move up to 25 pounds on occasion. Ability to maintain attention and concentration for extended periods of time. Ability to work overtime when required to meet deadlines Work environment – This position resides at the corporate office. The noise level is usually low to moderate. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: Does not manager others but may provide technical leadership, guidance and direction to other team members. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & SKILLS): Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information. Technology or related discipline from an accredited four-year college or university or 7 years equivalent technical experience is required. Minimum five years of experience with business intelligence tools such as SSRS, SSAS, Power BI and Cognos. Minimum five years of passionate experience in developing Dashboards, Governed Reports, Embedded-Analytics, Visualizations etc. Minimum five years of experience with development processes tools, SSIS preferred. Minimum two years leading technical implementation teams. Expert level of proficiency with IBM Cognos. Expert level of proficiency with Microsoft Power BI. Experience with dimensional modeling and OLAP tools using Cognos Framework Manager and Cognos BI. Proficient with Data Warehouse technologies and concepts such as dimensional modeling and cube development. Proficient with SQL, Complex SQL Tuning, Stored Procedures, and other techniques to develop highly performant. Cubes and other means of assessing data quickly. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Proficiency estimating work assignments and delivering to these estimates. Demonstrated ability to keep up with an ever-changing technical environment. Strong technical knowledge of data management systems, data warehousing platforms, data quality, data modelling, data governance, analytics, and predictive analysis. Extensive experience in multidimensional data modelling, such as star schemas, normalized and de-normalized models, handling “slow-changing” dimensions/attributes. Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communications, organizational and multi-tasking skill. Able to establish a constructive and informative relationship with team members, management and vendors. Thorough business skills, including stakeholder management, preparing and delivering presentations and workshops, and collecting and challenging requirements. Full lifecycle perspective (requirements gathering through production deployment and support) in aspects of Business Intelligence solutions. Ability to work with Enterprise Architects and Data Architects to develop BI roadmap, repeatable development and deployment frameworks etc. Proficient with working in a highly Agile (SCRUM) environment. Ability to advise senior IT management on BI & Analytics trends. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is helping us to create not only a great place to work, but also an environment where our employees, our customers and our communities can reach their goals and connect with each other. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or protected veteran status. We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Drug free work environment. CB

Description: We work at the intersection of bright pixels of creativity, sharp use of data points, innovative tech, and cutting-edge digital know how. That's how we turn brand potential into business performance. And that’s why we stand out. We believe our biggest asset is our combination of different backgrounds, cultures, and disciplines that come together to form one epic unit. What we do starts with our people. We are part of the Hearst Corporation, the world’s leading media, entertainment, and content company, which gives us access to the most valuable insights, talent and audiences. Your Impact: As a Media Operations Assistant, you will support the digital media (programmatic, planning, ad ops) teams in the organization and execution of digital media campaigns. Your support will be critical in the accurate and timely delivery of digital media campaigns. What you will do: Coordinate campaign details Manage and create insertion orders Prepare and maintain traffic sheets Ensure data integrity QA campaign setups Manage verification and viewability tracking Troubleshoot technical issues Check delivery and pacing Who you are: You will have 6+ months in digital marketing, preferably in the area of digital media You will have some experience working specifically within a digital media department Your Passion for digital marketing and understanding of the different digital media channels will be evident You will have some experience working with Google’s Campaign Manager or other relevant 3rd party ad server preferred You are known to be detail oriented and organized You will be proficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and with general Web based interfaces You will have completed your Bachelor’s degree or have equivalent work experience

This role is within the Information Technology Cyber Security group which supports the company’s cyber security services. Response Plan Coordinate with external consultants on security assessments, including developing and implementing action plans to address any findings Perform other duties as required and assigned, or GIAC Experience with the following is highly desirable: network management, understanding of packet dumps, data parsing, system logs, basic scripting languages, and SIEM Please go to Description: What does a Best Buy Customer Service Specialist do? The Best Buy Customer Service Specialist provides fast, accurate and friendly processing for all customer transactions at Checkout, Customer Service and Store Pickup while providing velocity solutions to customers. Develops strong relationships with customers while becoming a trusted advisor and partner in assisting them in making technology more functional in their lives. Partners with other employees to ensure customers' end-to-end needs are met and that no customer is left unserved or underserved. Utilizes all relevant sales tools to drive profitable growth and exceed department and individual goals. Helps answer questions and resolve customer issues. Job responsibilities include: Flex as coverage between Checkout, Store Pickup and Customer Service as necessary Accountable for driving positive NPS results at Checkout, Store Pickup and Customer Service. Maintain professional communication with customers and peers while using cross-functional company resources and tools. Engage customers using soft skills while solving issues, providing end-to-end solutions with fast and accurate processing of transactions. Ensure Front of Store cleanliness and merchandising standard execution. What are the Professional Requirements of a Best Buy Customer Service Specialist? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Strong ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Preferred Qualifications High School Diploma or equivalent 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits? Surrounded by the latest and greatest technology, a team of amazing coworkers and a work environment where anything is possible, you’ll find it easy to be your best when you work at Best Buy. While you’re making technology work for our customers, we’re making sure Best Buy works for you with our pay for performance philosophy. At Best Buy we offer top salaries for management, including both short and long term incentive plans based upon business results, as well as endless opportunities to grow in a dynamic work environment that’s part of an industry that never sleeps. From tuition reimbursement to deep employee discounts, to health, wealth and wellness benefits, we believe the success of our company depends on the passion of employees for learning, technology and people.
IT Skills: Processing customer transactions, Sales tools utilization, Cross-functional company resources and tools, Front of Store cleanliness and merchandising standard execution
Soft Skills: Fast and accurate processing, Strong customer relationships development, Trusted advisor, Partnering with other employees, Strong communication skills, Problem-solving skills, Prioritization and multi-tasking, Flexibility in work schedule
Education: Education-Related Skills:, High School Diploma or equivalent

Knowledge of ITIL Foundations, Configuration / customization of ServiceNow, including creating workflows Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Basic Visio skills Strong working knowledge of ServiceNow components such as Service Catalog, Change/Incident/Problem Management, Asset Management, CMDB Excellent knowledge of ServiceNow Best Practices and ongoing knowledge of latest ServiceNow features Knowledge of ITIL Foundations EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Description: General Information JOB TITLE: Data Analyst FTE: 1.0 Job Description: A recent study by EY-Parthenon Education revealed numerous challenges in BPS related to monitoring the progress of students who demonstrate early warning indicators for becoming off-track in high school. We know that there are high concentrations of these students in a small number of open-enrollment high schools. And we know that the vast majority of these students show risk factors in middle school and/or 9th grade that are highly correlated with their potential for dropping out of high school. We seek a Data Analyst who can help us more strategically leverage this information to plan appropriate interventions for and communication with this population of students and their families. We are particularly interested in developing dashboards to help the Headmasters of open-enrollment high schools better plan for the arrival of incoming 9th graders who have concerning early warning indicators based on their prior academic and social-emotional history. Additionally, we anticipate that the Data Analyst will be used to help us track the efficacy of any new interventions that are tested out over the next two years to intervene with this population, including district-wide initiatives to combat chronic absenteeism, which is a key metric for monitoring progress toward keeping more students on-track to graduate high school. REPORTS TO: Tommy Welch, Associate Superintendent RESPONSIBILITIES: Conduct analysis, develop reports, and build tools to support work for the Office of the Superintendent Provide support and thought partnership to other teams in across central office and schools Develop a predictive model for analyzing elementary and middle school Early Warning Indicators (EWIs) that can be leverage by high schools for prioritizing tiered interventions with 9th grade students. Work with a cross-section of Headmasters to develop and pilot data dashboards for monitoring student progress and informing short-term decision making about programming and resource allocation. Study the challenges associated with increasing exam school access and diversity, including documenting where the greatest opportunity gaps exist among K-5, K-6, 6-8 and K-8 feeder schools (i.e. where we have the highest concentrations of potential exam school candidates who are not receiving proactive supports to reduce entry barriers). Participate in other district-wide efforts to gather, analyze and present data relevant to risk factors associated with monitoring the progress of middle and high school students. QUALIFICATIONS - REQUIRED: Bachelor’s degree Strong analytic capabilities, familiarity with research design, and leadership skills Data expertise and outstanding communication skills Most importantly, candidates must be committed to education and believe in the importance of data-informed decision making Current authorization to work in the United States - Candidates must have such authorization by their first day of employment QUALIFICATIONS - PREFERRED: Master’s degree and at least four years of full-time work experience Experience as a researcher and/or analyst Experience working in a school-based setting (teacher, administrator, external partner, etc.) TERMS: Managerial Tier C. _This position is subject to the City of Boston residency requirement._ Please refer to www.bostonpublicschools.org/ohc (under "Employee Benefits and Policies") for more information on salary and compensation. The Boston Public Schools, in accordance with its nondiscrimination policies, does not discriminate in its programs, facilities, or employment or educational opportunities on the basis of race, color, age, criminal record (inquiries only), disability, homelessness, sex/gender, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, genetics or military status, and does not tolerate any form of retaliation, or bias-based intimidation, threat or harassment that demeans individuals’ dignity or interferes with their ability to learn or work.
IT Skills: Data analysis, Research design, Data modeling, Dashboard development
Soft Skills: Leadership, Communication, Decision making
Education: Bachelor's degree, Master's degree

Description: POSITION SUMMARY The Data Analyst position is responsible for consolidating, sharing and helping to interpret data from several internal business systems and customer- focused products to provide insights to virtually all departments, including our senior management team, customer success team, product management and sales teams. The successful candidate will be able to focus on data quality to ensure the accuracy of reports and dashboards, as well as work through integration challenges when dealing with different data sources, formats and conventions. Primary aspects of the job are: 1\. Working with internal production systems to extract data necessary to report on KPI's and produce operational dashboards. 2\. Working with data extracted for our products to support our customers success team with analyses of individual customer success stories, ROI and future opportunities. 3\. Working with historical consumer activity and demographic data to identify behavioral trends and classifications. 4\. Assist internal users with interpretation of reported data, and provide general support for data integration needs across the organization. Experience in the health care industry is desirable. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES 1\. Produce high quality reports and analytical dashboards, using existing data visualization and reporting tools. 2\. Contribute to and enable a data-driven culture and decision making process. 3\. Be a self-motivated team member who is willing to identify and respond to needs. 4\. Manage time and priorities across multiple initiatives. 5\. Provide documentation on reporting systems, dashboards, etc. 6\. Respond to requests from various departments regarding data integration and reporting needs. 7\. Ability to work in small collaborative teams with minimal supervision. 8\. Maintain and improve technical skills over time, taking advantage of new technologies and methodologies when appropriate. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/KNOWLEDGE 4-Year Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field 2 + years of data reporting or analytics experience Experience with multiple analytics software packages EO/AA
IT Skills: Data extraction, Data interpretation, Data quality, Dashboard creation, Data integration, Data analysis, Data visualization, Reporting tools
Soft Skills: Communication, Problem-solving, Time management, Self-motivation, Collaboration
Education: Education Related:, Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
