Description: Redfin is redefining real estate in the consumer’s favor by combining our own technology and agents to create a service that’s better, faster, and costs less. As a Redfinnian, you'll make a difference in one of life’s most important events—buying or selling a home. Our hiring standards are high, yet our culture is humble. No matter what role you have, you’ll be both challenged and inspired every day. We’ve got all the perks, but if what you value most is doing great work in a creative, collaborative, and disciplined environment, join us. As a Senior Data Analyst focused on People, you’ll use a wide array of data sources, including some of the most robust real estate data in the world, to build tools and answer questions that drive key business decisions across the entire company. We need an expert in translating qualitative aspects of an employee’s experience into tangible, quantitative improvements. The Role Work on a small team conducting analyses and building robust analytical reporting for our business leaders to plan both for the long and short-term. Analyze real estate agent data to understand key drivers of high performance and how they relate to factors of an employee’s journey at Redfin (training, tenure, attrition, etc). Partner with Human Resources, Recruiting, Finance, Real Estate Operations and Program Management teams to answer tough questions that inform the business and drive strategic data-driven decision making. Use your technical and business expertise to make our operations more analytical, and our analytics more efficient. Desired Skills & Experience 3-6 years working in an analytical role in a business context is required. Experience in People/HR analytics a plus. Expert-level SQL and Excel skills are required. Significant experience using data visualization/BI software (Tableau, Power BI) is required. Specifically, Tableau experience is a plus. Brilliant communication skills and ability to explain complex ideas clearly to a nontechnical audience. Strong consultative and influencing skills to help leaders make decisions and move the business forward. Bachelor’s degree in business, statistics, operations research, economics, computer science or a related field is required. Master’s degree is a plus. What We Offer Competitive compensation packages with a salary, bonuses, and stock grants Generous benefits, including three weeks of paid vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, and fully paid family leave Strong startup culture with catered lunches, casual dress code, happy hours, and more To make sure we hire the most qualified people, we’ve designed a multi-step selection process which may include interviews, a homework assignment, and a reference check. We’re excited to get to know you and hope you’re ready to give this opportunity everything you’ve got! Redfin is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce.
IT Skills: SQL, Excel, Data visualization/BI software (Tableau, Power BI)
Soft Skills: Communication skills, Consultative skills, Influencing skills
Education: Skills related to education:, Bachelor’s degree in business, statistics, operations research, economics, computer science, or related field

Description: We are looking to fill a key role in our Advanced Analytics team, which is the analytic hub of NVIDIA's business data organization. Be at the forefront of the fourth industrial revolution to learn and apply groundbreaking data science techniques to the development of product solutions and business strategies. If you are highly motivated, love gaming, and relish working on big-data scale problems to make a significant impact on business, we want you! What you’ll be doing: Mine massive amounts of data and perform large-scale data analysis to derive useful business insights into product, customer, and market behavior Understand business problems, translate them into quantitative models, and choose the best applicable statistical and analytical tools to drive a solution Develop descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive models using deep learning/machine learning algorithms. Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations, and influence the direction by effectively communicating results to many crucial groups within the company What we need to see : PhD in a quantitative discipline such as Machine Learning/AI, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, etc. (Would consider Masters for extraordinary applicants) 5+ years of experience in using statistical, analytical, and ML techniques to solve business problems Strong applied experience with Deep Learning frameworks like TensorFlow, Theano, Keras, Caffe preferably on large consumer datasets. Strong understanding of Deep Learning methodology and math. Strong intuition for applying Deep Learning to practical problems. Vast knowledge and experience with machine learning algorithms and statistical tools like Python scikit, R, MLLib, etc. Knowledge of Hadoop and SQL are required, Spark is a plus Experience with algorithmic work on NLP datasets would be great Strength in collaboration with an ability to take the initiative and lead when needed A practical mindset If you have a passion for problem-solving, developing creative solutions, and continuous learning, a willingness to work with whichever machine learning algorithm is the most practical and effective for solving a specific business problem, and an understanding of the importance of data preparation, you'll be a great fit for this important team. Common sense is required in order to develop mathematical models that match the reality of the business process and business data. Does the following sentence apply to you? You are governed by curiosity, motivation, and a desire to work hard and to develop production-ready models within the target timeframe. If so, you're our ideal team member. NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people on the planet working for us, as well as vast amounts of computing power for our Data Scientists to utilize in developing your models. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you! Deeplearning NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.
IT Skills: Data Mining, Data Analysis, Quantitative Modeling, Statistical Tools (Python scikit, R, MLLib), Machine Learning Algorithms, Deep Learning Frameworks (TensorFlow, Theano, Keras, Caffe), Hadoop, SQL, Spark, NLP Datasets
Soft Skills: Problem-Solving, Collaboration, Initiative, Leadership, Creativity, Continuous Learning, Common Sense

Description: Jack Link’s Protein Snacks began with treasured family recipes passed from generation to generation, transforming a small North Woods business into one of the fastest-growing meat snack manufacturers in the world. Over the years, as consumer demand for convenient, high-quality snack foods increased, so has the company’s product offerings. Today Jack Link’s is the fastest-growing meat snack manufacturer in the world, and sells more than 100 different meat snack products in more than 40 countries. The Link family principles and traditions remain the same: hard work, integrity and a commitment to earn consumer respect by delivering the best-tasting meat snacks in the world. The Master Data Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for developing, maintaining, and improving Master Data quality data reports and KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) to ensure data integrity, and data accuracy. In addition, this position performs research and analysis on master file requests and ensures compliance and changes are made in accordance with business policies and procedures. The BA will be responsible for providing a variety of project management functions including: business requirements gathering, business process documentation, training/documentation creation and other related work responsibilities as required. BA will work to ensure that business process outcomes are in harmony with an organization's strategic goals, and work collaboratively across all departments of the organization to help improve Master Data processes and accuracy. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES The duties and responsibilities of this position shall consist of, but not be limited to, the following: Define, develop, champion best practices for Master Data for SAP MM and APO Responsible for updating SAP ECC material master, BOM, and recipes Evaluate business gaps and process requirements for users/functions Evaluate business application modification requests Recommend and implement business process modifications Create specifications for custom integration needs and data loads Create and maintains Master Data Governance processes, policies and procedures Manage, ensure and approve all systems requests Work with IT to review SAP configuration options and identify most appropriate solutions Identify reporting needs and proper utilization of data warehouse capabilities to turn data into business intelligence Work with IT to execute test plans Define applications security needs and work closely with IT Security to determine Master Roles within the system Work with the Master Data team to automate processes Develop training materials, work aids, and process flows Assist the MD Lead on conducting training sessions Perform other duties and responsibilities as necessary. Minimal travel may be required
IT Skills: Master Data Management, Data Quality Reports, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), Business Analysis, Business Process Documentation, Project Management, Business Requirements Gathering, Data Governance, Data Integration, Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence, SAP ECC Material Master, SAP Configurations, Process Automation, Training Development
Soft Skills: Communication, Collaboration, Problem-solving, Attention to Detail, Analytical Thinking, Time Management, Adaptability, Strategic Planning

Description: Scrum Master (Los Angeles) Ability to lead an Agile team on a day-to-day basis; SCRUM certified; need minimum of 4 to 6 years of experience; need to be able to work in the high intensity teams. Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes and not limited to Agile Applications Development, Support and Deployment. Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Capgemini. Qualifications Business Analysts enable the transformation and performance improvement of an enterprise or its parts, with respect to people, process and technology, by providing relevant capabilities, assets (human and non-human), processes and tools. Business Analysts structure, analyze and visualize an enterprise’s current state. They design and visualize the future state. They also design and guide the change process from current to future state. Developing sector knowledge is extremely important for all Business Analysts. Functional analysts can specialize in Business, ERP, Application Management or Custom Software Development (CSD). You have mastered at least one methodology in-depth and have an advanced knowledge of either one or more business domains; one or more ERP solutions; or one or more technical tools/ languages. You have wide knowledge of industry innovations and competitor activity and actively engage in, and contribute to, internal and external knowledge developments. Possible positions could include being a Business Process Consultant in process improvements; a Business Analyst performing “as- is/ to-be” analysis on business processes and/ or IT; or an experienced Functional Consultant who is able to advise clients on the implementation of one or more package modules. Should be proficient in Business knowledge, Business Change Management, Functional Architecture Design & Project Financials, KPI´s & Reporting. Description: Your main responsibilities as HR administrator will be mainly administrative duties such as maintaining and updating employee records, managing HR documents and employee electronic records (e.g. employment, and onboarding paperwork, etc.) and updating internal databases.  Create and maintain electronic employee records in our HRIS ADP and Financial systems (new hires, promotions, transfers, terminations, job and personal changes).  Ensure the relevant HR database is up to date, accurate and complies with legislation  Perform employee data research and analysis to answer to questions as needed (as per request, mainly by HR Business Partners, HR Coordinators)  Perform regular database audits to ensure data accuracy and alignment of systems  Assist payroll department by auditing data during payroll transmission, answering to questions and providing relevant employee information as needed  Process/respond to employment verifications and unemployment claims in coordination with HR Coordinators and HR Business Partners as needed.  Comply with government regulations related to employment, and respond to government and other inquiries and reporting requirements.  Revise HR processes/guides as needed  Prepare training documentation as required  Understand SGS HRIS architecture and SGS Organization structure to be able to assist in the implementation of new or revised systems and/or processes.  Participate in HR projects (as needed)  Analyze current HR processes and procedures and recommend improved methods  Liaise with third party service providers and process invoices.  Prepare and send routine correspondence and notices internally and externally.  Perform other duties as assigned.  At all times, comply with the SGS Code of Integrity Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or relevant field  Minimum of 6 year experience of proven work experience as an HR Administrator, or relevant HR role  SHRM-CP or PHR credential highly regarded  Experience with HR software (HRIS or HRMS, ADP preferred)  Computer literacy (MS Office applications, in particular Excel if possible intermediate level, Word)  Thorough knowledge of labor laws  Excellent organizational skills, with an ability to prioritize important projects/tasks  Strong phone, email and in-person communication skills
IT Skills: Maintaining employee records, HR documents management, Updating internal databases, Creating and maintaining electronic employee records, HR database management, Employee data research and analysis, Database auditing, Payroll data auditing, Employment verifications processing, Government regulations compliance, HRIS knowledge, Training documentation preparation, HR processes improvement, Third-party service provider liaison, Invoice processing, Communication skills
Soft Skills: Organizational skills, Prioritization skills, Communication skills
Education: Education-related Skills:, Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or relevant field, SHRM-CP or PHR credential

Description: Description The Naval Nuclear Laboratory is seeking a highly motivated professional to join our Information Technology team. Apply to this position if you're seeking to work in a mission-driven, technically diverse and dynamic environment with a strong technical team focused on learning and continuous improvement. If you are hired into this position, you will help maintain Oracle databases and database infrastructure across multiple sites with support from senior DBAs. You will provide support to users and developers, monitor system performance, security, and configurations, and improve operations. You will serve as an interface between the IT organization and the Lines of Business to ensure the information technology needs of the user communities are addressed. As your skills and experience grow, you will be encouraged to take increasing responsibility for operational and project work. Your impact will be limited only by your ability and interest. A partial list of duties you will have: Proactively ensure production databases and underlying infrastructure are secure, running properly, and are responsive. Work with colleagues, users, and others to debug issues and restore or improve service as needed. Collaborate with developers and other stakeholders to ensure use of databases is consistent with best practices, policies, and intentions. Maintain recurring operational rhythm for backups, disaster recovery, resource utilization, and other operational tasks. Document your work and partner with teammates to ensure work is validated and repeatable, and that what we learn is useful consistently and repeatedly. Requirements Intermediate: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university and a minimum of two years of relevant experience; or Masters degree from an accredited college or university and relevant experience. Advanced: Bachelor's degree and a minimum of four years of relevant experience; or Masters degree from an accredited college or university and a minimum of two years of relevant experience Preferred Skills Bachelor's or Masters degree in Engineering, Science or Information Technology from an accredited college or university We will work with motivated applicants who have a solid technical foundation combined with an interest and ability to learn these skills: Fundamental knowledge of computing, preferably with Linux systems and relational databases. Awareness of computer infrastructure and associated fields, like hardware, networking, storage, virtualization, etc. Communicate clearly and listen sincerely. Use constructive approaches to solving problems and improving existing approaches. Collaborate openly and broadly to find and implement the best ideas regardless of their source.
IT Skills: Oracle databases maintenance, Database infrastructure management, System performance monitoring, Security monitoring, Configuration monitoring, Debugging, Disaster recovery procedures, Documentation, Linux systems knowledge, Relational databases understanding, Hardware knowledge, Networking knowledge, Storage knowledge, Virtualization knowledge
Soft Skills: Communication, Problem-solving, Collaboration, Continuous learning
Education: Education-Related Skills:, Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Science, or Information Technology, Master's degree in related fields

Description: From Innovations to Solutions. Camelot Innovative Technologies Lab is the leading SAP consultancy for digital value chain management. With more than 20 years of experience we lead our customers in their digital transformation. Our capabilities range from the strategic dialogue around current challenges in the digital world to the implementation and support of innovative solutions. Professional Artificial Intelligence / Data Science Artificial intelligence (AI) aims to create value for its user. This value is delivered either through automation of repeated tasks or through the improvement of the so-called “user experience” through the preparation of cognitive user interfaces. Developers of such AI Systems are referred to as Data Scientists, combining several competencies: Functional knowledge, programming know-how and statistics/Machine Learning. Would you like to work as a developer in exciting and innovative projects related to artificial intelligence? Then become part of our dynamic team. What's your future business? Carrying out exciting data science projects as a developer for our national and international clients Conception and development of machine learning methods (Python or R) to be integrated into business applications Involvement in the development of innovative topics and linking AI services (IBM Watson, SAP Leonardo) Support in training as well as setting up of a data science community Location: Conshohocken (PA) Who are you? Masters or graduate degree in business computing/computer science, maths, physics or a comparable course of study, ideally with postdoctoral experience At least two years of experience in data science Knowledge of the programming languages R or Python and knowledge in data analytics / machine learning methods Outstanding communication and presentation skills What do we believe in? Triggering innovation by collaboration – this is our mission. Consultancy is people business and knowledge is key. That is why we value our employees as much as our clients. Together, we develop skills mutually matching our visions and ideas by constantly learning, growing and innovating. Camelot colleagues take responsibility from the moment they join us. Entrepreneurial attitude is as important to us as strong teamwork, knowledge sharing, diversity and corporate social responsibility. How hungry are you?
IT Skills: Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Machine Learning, Programming (Python, R), Data Analytics, IBM Watson, SAP Leonardo
Soft Skills: Communication, Presentation, Collaboration, Innovation, Entrepreneurial Attitude, Teamwork, Knowledge Sharing, Diversity, Corporate Social Responsibility
Education: Skills related to education:, Masters or graduate degree in business computing/computer science, maths, physics, or a comparable course of study

Description: Job Description: Summary Plans, designs, and installs computerized databases to include data definition, structure, documentation of databases, long-range requirements, operational standards and guidelines, and protection. Essential Job Functions Monitors database activity and file usage, and ensures necessary resources are present so that databases function properly by removing or deleting old or obsolete files. Develops data retrieval queries and optimizes data queries within programs for performance for performance and maintainability. Determines data to collect and analyzes information as appropriate. Analyzes and determines informational needs and elements, data relationships and attributes, proposed manipulation, data flow and storage requirements and data output and reporting capabilities. Assists development teams in defining logical attributes and inter-relationships and assists in designing data structures to accommodate database production, storage, maintenance and accessibility to enhance performance. Tests designed applications utilizing database management software or general programming software to enhance performance. Installs, implements and supports systems within user base; creates and updates database installation instructions and design changes for client use. Installs new systems or new releases of database systems; determines table attributes, primary, and alternate keys for multiple databases. Installs and upgrades hardware and software as necessary to enhance database performance. Researches various hardware and software products; recommends solutions and implements approved products. Utilizes standard corporate tools to record change and problem activities for tracking purposes. Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems, or related field preferred Zero or more years of experience in database design, administration, or maintenance Experience working with software installation/upgrading procedures Experience working with multiple logical entity modeling techniques Experience working with database creation techniques Experience working with relational databases Other Qualifications Good analytical and problem solving skills Good programming skills for database management and general software Good communication skills for providing documentation to support personnel, customers, and managers Good technical infrastructure design skills Ability to work in a team environment Willingness to travel Work Environment Office environment May require occasional evening or weekend work
IT Skills: Database design, Data retrieval queries, Data analysis, Data manipulation, Database management software, Programming (general software), System installation and support, Hardware and software upgrades
Soft Skills: Analytical skills, Problem-solving skills, Communication skills, Technical infrastructure design skills, Teamwork, Willingness to travel

Description: Los Gatos, California Data Engineering and Infrastructure Netflix is the leading online video subscription service, reaching millions of US and international households. Netflix became well known as a data driven company for our personalized recommendations, but our use of data doesn't stop there. From testing new features for the website to measuring performance across many devices to making wise choices about content, we use our petabytes of data to move the business forward. To do that we have built a big data platform that, along with the rest of our infrastructure, lives in the cloud and will continue to grow with us as we expand. This platform is used by engineers, analysts and data scientists to leverage our data to do interesting and impactful analysis and allow Netflix to continue to innovate. The Data Experience team is working to make it as easy and efficient as possible to work with all of this data. We’re building a cohesive experience to make information more accessible, insightful and actionable by improving discovery, surfacing context and enabling self- service. To deliver a meaningful user experience, we are building a lightweight browser-based application that provides our stakeholders a consistent way to interact with the big data platform. Our work will enable engineers to leverage complex relationships between massive datasets while providing them a way to extend the platform by reusing features and patterns. We are looking for someone who is deeply technical, obsesses over tiny details, and has an unwavering passion for building delightful products. The ideal candidate should be an expert in developing reusable components and features for browser-based apps. This may be your dream job if you: Value simplicity and clarity in design. Our engineering strongly reflects this value. Have a strong background in front-end development and familiarity with working across the stack. Want to build a stunning front-end experience. Enjoy staying up to date with the changing JavaScript ecosystem. Want to build a platform to solve interesting data problems. Passionate about microinteractions that lead to delightful experiences. Pride yourself in building reusable assets that the community can leverage. Are self-led but highly aligned with your teammates; we develop fast, and align daily. We’re looking for you to have experience with: Modern JavaScript standards and web fundamentals. Building data-intensive and interactive web applications. Contributing to a reusable style guide and UI toolkit. Leveraging HTML5 and CSS and can make the right choices when building responsive UI applications. The intricacies of the DOM and have command over the APIs and their performance implications. Design tools like Sketch, Adobe XD as a plus. We need you to bring strong development expertise and an appreciation for delivering delightful designs to help us build meaningful solutions. You will need an excellent ability to communicate across our team and the organization. Your experience can come from a variety of places including work experience, formal or informal education. You will have ample opportunities to grow professionally, to contribute both inside and outside of Netflix, and to enable Netflix to bring moments of joy around the world. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
IT Skills: Modern JavaScript standards, Web fundamentals, Front-end development, Reusable style guide and UI toolkit, HTML5 and CSS, Responsive UI applications, DOM, Design tools like Sketch, Adobe XD
Soft Skills: Value simplicity and clarity in design, Passion for building delightful products, Enjoy staying up to date with the changing JavaScript ecosystem, Passionate about microinteractions for delightful experiences, Pride in building reusable assets, Self-led but highly aligned with teammates, Excellent communication skills

Description: Recruit ‘best-fit’ candidates for key roles in both business and technical functions. Manage a set of open reqs, working creatively to screen candidates, identify finalists and successfully close offers (full life-cycle recruiting). Mandatory should have proven track record of finding top notch technical talent with Big Data, Data and Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing skills along with past experience hiring for life science/pharma organizations. Recruit ‘best-fit’ candidates for key roles in both business and technical functions. Manage a set of open reqs, working creatively to screen candidates, identify finalists and successfully close offers (full life-cycle recruiting) Work closely with hiring managers to ensure a responsive recruiting and hiring process that builds Saama’s brand as a great place to build a career. Define the career and organization value proposition to candidates in a compelling way. Understand and articulate business and technology roles using carefully crafted messaging to engage and qualify potential talent. Build relationships with candidates to create a pipeline of talent for key skills and future needs. Identify effective recruiting sources for Big Data expertise, Data Science and other strategic skill sets; build pipelines of talent. Accurately assess candidate fit through a thoughtful, effective interview methodology. Propose and implement ongoing innovations and improvements to recruiting process including using leading-edge methods to attract diverse talent. Participate in University Recruiting, representing Saama at campus events. Maintain a high level of professionalism and confidentiality at all times..… Impact on the business: At Saama, our business is delivering solutions with world-class talent and services with lowest bench cost and most consultant satisfaction key relationships: With all internal department heads Onsite and Offshore teams (in Pune, India) Vendor Relationships COMPETENCIES: Accountability: consistent track record of successfully meeting and exceeding expectations. Communication & Influence skills. Able to communicate effectively and credibly with executive management. Effective in both written and spoken communication Negotiation. Able to negotiate with right resources, scope and timing of the tasks. Perseverance. Stays the course despite challenges & setbacks. Credible: builds trust and maintains it over time. Thrives in fast paced, high pressure environment. Results-oriented and a self-starter who enjoys a challenge, gets things done and needs minimal support and direction. Highly effective judgment and interpersonal skills. Leadership: Strong leadership qualities with the ability to coach, develop and motivate a team Excited by change; adjusts well to dynamic expectations and timelines. Able to independently root out problems and develop solutions Integrity: Delivers on commitments; practices the highest ethical standards Innovation: Willing to think ‘outside the box’ to define and implement processes. Collaboration: Working well with others to achieve shared goals. LI-AG1
IT Skills: Full life-cycle recruiting, Big Data, Data and Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Life science/pharma industry knowledge, Talent pipelining, Interview methodology, Recruiting process improvement, University recruiting
Soft Skills: Communication skills, Negotiation skills, Perseverance, Credibility, Results-oriented, Self-starter, Leadership, Adaptability, Problem-solving skills, Integrity, Innovation, Collaboration

Description: AppZen has developed the world’s first artificial intelligence (AI) solution for business process automation. AppZen’s AI for business solutions uses patent-pending Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision and machine learning algorithms to analyze data and automate functions. Our technology is used to automate business processes for both small and large enterprises, including fortune 50 organizations. The data science-based technology automatically detects accidental and intentional fraud, providing real-time compliance to IRS rules, FCPA regulations, and general company policies. This position’s primary laser-focus is providing Tier I support to customers. You own the problem and the solution. The secondary responsibilities will include product demonstrations, creating support articles and blog posts for new features, and communicating with the development team with suggested improvements. If you are looking to make an immediate impact this is the role for you! About You: You are a patient and caring person, highly organized and driven. You want to help our customers get the most out of AppZen’s audit solution and get joy out of watching a customer really succeed. You have GREAT communication skills and know how to get the message across. You are action oriented; no task is too small or insignificant for you. You have a finely tuned sense of urgency, you know when you can fix something, and when and how to ask for help. Responsibilities: Provide a positive, personalized experience via phone, live chat, and email to each customer who reaches out. You are not a robot; we want each customer to know how important they are. Identify, troubleshoot and resolve Tier I technical issues. Communicate suggested product improvements to the development team. Requirements: Humble and Friendly personality with an open and honest communication style. 2+ years of experience with SAAS software support. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Ability to understand our business applications quickly with little hands on training. Bonus Points: Previous experience in fraud and compliance
IT Skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine learning algorithms, Data analysis, Fraud detection, Compliance regulations, SAAS software support, Business applications
Soft Skills: Communication skills, Problem-solving, Customer service, Organization, Drive, Patience, Empathy, Urgency, Action-oriented, Open and honest communication
Education: Skills related to education:, None

Description: Manager, Customer Success & Strategy, BPO’s (Austin, Texas candidates only) Tethr’s vision is to help the world learn from its voice conversations. We help companies uncover never-before-seen insights from their business and customer phone calls. This entirely new set of data leads to improved customer loyalty, increased revenue and betterment of their products and services. Human conversation is complex. We strive to unlock the potential of this dataset for users of all skill levels. We’re looking for a Manager of Customer Success & Strategy to add to our growing and talented team. The Tethr Customer Success Manager is responsible for maintaining a portfolio of Accounts that include the world’s leading Business Process Outsourcers. This individual proactively governs customer relationships and consistently illustrates the value delivered through Tethr’s software & services. The Customer Success Manager serves as the internal voice of the customer while working with other Tethr teams to exceed customer expectations. Customer Success Manager performance is based on specific metrics associated with customer on-boarding, product adoption, expansion & retention. This role will take work direction from the Customer Success Director and report to the Chief Customer Strategy and Success Officer. Key Responsibilities: Proactively serve a portfolio of assigned accounts so that customers may achieve their positive business outcomes via Tethr insights, software & services Drive customer software engagement & development of power users across customer organizations Develop Tethr “Best Practices” for key customer stakeholders to enable speed to benefit Perform account reviews and implement Customer Success Plans for assigned accounts Proactively provide relevant insight and reporting against customers’ critical business objectives Effectively and timely solve ad-hoc customer issues as needed Collaborate with sales & business development team to expand customer relationships Maintain communication & tailored business rhythms for each customer Develop and manage predictive renewal analytics to identify customer expansion opportunities & churn risks Collaborate with Marketing to leverage customer use cases and case studies Provide continuous customer feedback to Product team Stay current on industry trends and provide thought leadership to customers and partners Adopt & contribute to Customer Success team best practices Core Skills & Talents: Passion for serving customers Establish credibility with key customer decision makers & influencers Strong verbal/written communication & presentation skills; exceptional listening skills Strong problem solving & analytical skills; formulates solutions that deliver real business value Innovative with the ability to recognize and maximize new business opportunities Comfort with negotiation Well organized; manage multiple accounts & assignments simultaneously A drive to exceed goals that is internal, constant & self-imposed Ability to lead via influence and effective at all organizational levels Qualifications: B.S. or B.A. in business management, finance, economics or similar study At least 3-5 years of prior account management and/or customer success experience, preferably within enterprise software or SaaS Demonstrated leadership and strategy development within a Contact Center BPO provider, or managing Contact Center BPO’s Preferred: Experience with CRM’s and/or BI tools, call centers and/or their related technology At Tethr, we only hire great people. We love our product and take hiring very seriously. We enjoy working together and the feeling that we accomplished something everyday. Our fast-paced environment means you’ll be able to quickly see the impact of your contributions on the success of our company, and see the product of your time and energy make a difference in peoples lives. In return for your contributions, you’ll be rewarded with excellent compensation, equity, and incredible opportunities for career growth and development in a vibrant, growing culture! Learn more about us and our product and apply at https://tethr.com Tethr is committed to diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
IT Skills: Customer Success Management, Account Management, Business Process Outsourcing (BPO), Software Engagement, Customer Success Planning, Customer Feedback Analysis, CRM & BI Tools, Call Center Technology
Soft Skills: Strong Communication, Problem-Solving, Innovation, Negotiation, Organization, Leadership, Goal-Oriented, Influencing Skills

Description: Discover is looking for a talented, enthusiastic and proactive individual who is ready to take their next challenge in full stack software development with built-in-quality. Why work at Discover? Because we strive to be the leading direct bank and payments partner. You will want to work as part of a close-knit team in order to deliver results without the constraints of cubicles. Responsibilities: Developing and delivering enterprise applications and shared components. You will design and develop systems by using Agile development methodology and support existing and new product features. Develop, build, test, automate and deploy Enterprise applications. Diagnose, troubleshoot and fix issues in the production environment. Identifies problems and possible solutions, and takes appropriate action to resolve production issues. Participate in R &D, Analysis and Proof of Concept in new technology initiatives. Team members are expected to support production and pager rotation, after hours or weekend work is expected occasionally, and we have a flexible schedule to support work-life balance There is an expectation that this Chicago based person will need to visit Discover’s Riverwoods Headquarters1 to 2 of days a week for project related meetings. Strong skill in Application, UI and Web development Hands on programming experience with Java, JavaScript/HTML/CSS, Web, PHP, JSON, REST Working knowledge and experience with systems integration as well as object-oriented design patterns and development Effective oral and written communication skills Excellent interpersonal skills Ability to work under pressure of multiple projects and deadlines Ability to effectively prioritize workload and manage changes in direction Ability to interpret and apply required policies and procedures Ability to work in a team environment An interest to gain hands-on experience with highly scalable and reliable applications Understanding of Java, JavaScript/HTML/CSS, Web, PHP, JSON, REST based applications Familiar with software development methodologies Strong understanding of object oriented principles Ambitious, self-motivated, and willing to grow in a challenging environment LI-MF1 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Description: Job Summary The IT Systems Administrator is responsible for administering, optimizing and supporting company-wide IT systems of a multi-site manufacturing organization. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals and projects. In addition, this position is also responsible for the Administration & management of all company Servers & related infrastructure, Active Directory, DNS, Office 365/Exchange environment, VMWare, NetApp, Backup and Disaster recovery. Stays current with technological developments and recommends ways to take advantage of new technologies. Must be familiar with ITIL Change and Problem Management Processes, Project Management as well as work well within a collaborative environment. Job Responsibilities Administers Windows servers at all locations (including Active Directory in a large environment, DNS, file/print servers, storage, domain controllers, production applications, Office 365, Email environment, builds, high availability, Disaster Recovery, batch scheduling, security administration, patch management, alert notifications, user administration, operational support, and backup/recovery) Install new / rebuild existing servers and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups Provide Tier III/IV support per request from various constituencies. Investigates and troubleshoots issues. Repairs and recovers from hardware or software failures Coordinates and communicates with impacted constituencies Coordinates, collaborates and communicates with IT 3rd party service providers Perform ongoing performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization as required. Configure CPU, memory, and disk partitions as required Plan and undertake regular maintenance work across all IT systems Participates in the evaluation and recommendation of new technologies Must be on-call and available on a 24X7 Provide tier II/III support Other duties as assigned Skills/work Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or a related field; or the equivalent in education/certification and work experience Requires minimum of 4 years’ experience in System Administration role Experience in the administration and technical support of LAN, replication software, and virtualization software such as VMware / Citrix Experience in SAP administration and Security Experienced in Windows OS Systems administration, with DNS, WINS, file access methods, system utilities, and Active Directory in a large environment. To include backup and recovery utilities Thorough ‘hands-on’ understanding of SAN/NAS management and configuration (NetApp preferred) Thorough understanding of all Microsoft Office products. Comprehensive knowledge to support SQL platforms, to include ability to write simple queries, understanding of joins and sub-queries, ability to diagnose SQL server issues from operations stand-point. Understanding of log-shipping, replication and database backup strategy concepts Comprehensive knowledge of the technical systems procurement and implementation life cycles Comprehensive knowledge of hardware, telecommunications, network, and personal computer analysis Requires multi-tasking and organizational skills, as well as stress management skills Project management skills a plus Good knowledge of IT Governance processes supporting problem management and change management a plus Excellent written and oral communication skills to effectively interact with all levels of the organization (including IT professionals)
IT Skills: Windows server administration, Active Directory, DNS, Office 365/Exchange environment, VMWare, NetApp, Backup and Disaster recovery, ITIL Change and Problem Management Processes, Project Management, SAN/NAS management, SQL platforms, Hardware and network analysis
Soft Skills: Creativity, Collaboration, Problem-solving, Communication skills, Multi-tasking, Organizational skills, Stress management, IT Governance processes, Teamwork

Description: Purpose: The Lead Data Architect will help lead the transformation of RSLI’s Data Management and Analytics vision, and a connected data strategy to deliver common, secure and consistent data capabilities across the enterprise. This role will engage in strategic initiatives and be the gatekeeper for enterprise data standards, processes, best practices and frameworks. Key Responsibilities: NEXTGEN DATA ARCHITECTURE: Key member of development team for RSLI’s nextgen data architecture, which incorporates a mix of cloud and on-prem systems along with big data and rdbms technologies. Owns, creates and enhances processes, standards, best practices and frameworks to be used throughout nextgen data architecture. Analyzes and designs technical solutions that enhance legacy and nextgen data architectures. Reviews and analyzes new software tools and packages and makes recommendations where applicable. CUSTOMER SERVICE: Analyzes business processes in order to determine and develop technical solutions to meet business objectives. Interacts with Business Analysts and staff within business units to determine options for addressing business requirements. Supports the existing architecture, deliverables, new product releases, and plans for additional capacity as needed to support business needs. Analyzes issues and new business needs as required, and designs and develops new models and/or major enhancements to existing models and maintains current models to business specifications. Assists users with system testing. Rotates with team as on-call contact for production issues. ANALYSIS & REPORTING: Analyzes business processes in order to determine and develop technical solutions to meet business objectives. Interacts with Business Analysts and staff within business units to determine options for addressing business requirements. Supports the existing architecture, deliverables, new product releases, and plans for additional capacity as needed to support business needs. Analyzes issues and new business needs as required, and designs and develops new models and/or major enhancements to existing models and maintains current models to business specifications. Assists users with system testing. Rotates with team as on-call contact for production issues. Qualifications: • 4-year degree in computer science or related field 10+ years related experience experience developing and deploying complex data warehouse/data mart/ETL/BI deliverables to meet specific needs of business units Experience should include; o Oracle o PL/SQL o SQL o ETL Development in Data Warehouse o Data Modeling – Relational & Star Schema o Indexes, Views, Materialized Views, Triggers o Partitions & Frameworks 2-3 years' experience within a big data environment preferred (Linux, python) Comprehensive understanding of Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing processes and tools Experience with the Kimball Design Methodology including star schemas, bridge tables, staging tables, work tables Experience supporting semantic layer and metadata layer data products used for BI self-service Must have disciplined organizational skills and the ability to multi-task, organize, prioritize and meet deadlines as needed. Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills in order to develop relationships for attainment of mutual goals. Experience with reporting tools (Actuate, Tableau, etc.) preferred. Insurance background (e.g., claims, underwriting, sales, billing, or finance) preferred Option to work remotely (i.e. from home) available. Position frequently requires the following abilities: Sitting for prolonged periods of time, frequently standing, and extensive keyboarding. Employee is required to have visual acuity sufficient to perform activities such as preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing notes; viewing a computer terminal and extensive reading. Employee is required to have hearing sufficient to understand verbal instruction and answer telephones. Reliance Standard Life Insurance will provide qualified employees with a reasonable accommodation in accordance with applicable law.

Description: : As a Data Analyst on the Supply Chain Automation team, you will analyze data and visualize it so that we can make better decisions as a company. In particular, you will be main point of contact between enterprise-scale data sets and the global supply managers, material planners, logistics coordinators, business analysts, and quality team. You’ll also support the Supply Chain Automation team directly with insights and visualizations that will play a critical role in disrupting current supply chain practices. Responsibilities: Create reports and visualizations. Respond promptly, accurately and efficiently to data requests and questions. Update data as needed. Communicate your findings effectively to anyone in the company from executives to engineers. Proactively identify inconsistencies in the data through your visualizations and with statistical tests. Propose changes to the software development team. Continuously improve SQL and python skills with the support of our engineering team, helping you automate repetitive work and multiply yourself. Learn new statistical methods from our data science team. Experiment and learn rapidly. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field and/or equivalent experience or evidence of exceptional deductive ability. Expert in data analysis, visualization, and communication. Experience creating dashboards/visualizations using, e.g., Tableau (or similar). Comfort with SQL and Python. Basic understanding of statistics, e.g. continuous and discrete distributions, conditional probability, combinatorics, linear modelling. Detail-oriented / relentless, willing to find cracks in the system to expose problems. Ability to work in a fast-paced start-up technology environment and deliver excellent results. Apply Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program

Description: Job Description Essential Functions Creation and upkeep of process automation related to data maintenance. Complete documentation of datasets and processes following established industry standards Coordination of some short- and long-term projects including the organization, prioritization, review, evaluation and approval of project deliverables. Occasional oversight of subordinate and interning employees Preparation of written and oral reports, memos, visualizations and presentations to communicate project objectives or outcomes and the results of spatial or statistical analyses to executives, non-technical staff, and the public. Communication and explanation of technical issues, spatial concepts, data and methods to non-technical staff. Query and maintenance of spatial and non-spatial data within relational databases Writing of database views to support new and ad hoc reports and providing guidance to analysts on database analysis. Creation, management and editing of APIs of departmental data for internal and external uses. Engaging departmental (business or operational) stakeholders to define the objectives, goals, deadlines and deliverables for projects and prioritize ad hoc requests for maps and reports. Coordination with OIT on the creation, maintenance and update to spatial and non-spatial databases Execution and support of City policies for enterprise data sharing, data quality, metadata, spatial data updates/maintenance and open data sharing to the public. Proficiency in use and editing or creation of APIs for data extraction, transformation, loading (ETL) and analysis. Proficiency using ESRI ArcGIS 10.x software suite including Model Builder and Spatial Analyst extensions. Proficiency in spatial data creation, editing and maintenance in ESRI ArcSDE 10.x. Proficiency using ArcGIS Online or other web mapping platforms. Proficiency using Microsoft Office Professional Suite (Access, Excel, Word, Powerpoint). Experience with project tracking applications including Microsoft Project. Experience with data visualization and graphics tools for the creation of professional presentations reports, web content, or public relations materials.

Description: To provide intermediate level database administrator (DBA) services for Production, test, and development databases across multiple platforms. To provide intermediate level physical database design, creation, and maintenance services Duties and Responsibilities Provides intermediate level DBA services for Production, test, and development databases across multiple platforms. Works closely with developers and logical data modelers to perform physical database design for business applications/databases with an intermediate number of interfaces and users. May also work on small to mid-size, defined assignments on large scale, business-critical systems. Understands the business requirements for applications and implements supporting database technical capabilities. Helps to resolve issues elevated from staff with less experience. Performs database administration for mid-tier server databases, including installations, upgrades, configurations, and patching. Performs day to day monitoring and optimizing, and provides developer support for creation of databases, tables, and indexes. Builds backup and recovery jobs. Maintains database logs and bug lists. Administers and maintains the production, test, and development databases. Reviews application designs for compliance with production acceptance requirements. Complies with IT policies and procedures, especially those for quality and productivity standards that enable the team to meet established client service levels. Complies with Information Security policies and procedures. Verifies deliverables meet Information Security requirements. Participates in special projects and performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience. Minimum two years DBA, data modeling, business systems analyst, or development experience. Strong written and oral communication skills Strong analysis and problem solving skills Intermediate knowledge of the following DBA practices and concepts: database replication; database monitoring, optimizing, and maintenance; and database logs and bug lists. Intermediate knowledge of one or more IT platforms: Microsoft Windows NT; UNIX; See additional information for the specific requirements for this posting. Intermediate knowledge of current versions of the following products: Oracle; Microsoft SQL Server; UNIX Shell Scripting; SQL/PL SQL; Lotus Notes; Microsoft Office Suite. Familiarity with Data Modeling concepts. Special Factors Operations are 24 x 7. May be required to be oncall, work beyond normal business hours, including night shift, as needed. 3 day shift Thurs. Fri. Sat. 6:00 am – 6:30 pm Oracle: Exadata, RAC/RAC1, Data Guard, OEM And/or SQL Server: SCOM, SQL Server Management Studio, Power Shell, Availability Groups, SQL Server 2016 Remote and off hours support: Can be up to 15%. Vanguard does not offer VISA sponsorship for this role.

Description: Requisition Number: 67184 As a Data Center Architect you’ll lead discussions with clients around their cloud and data center initiatives. You’ll assist account executives with technical and business guidance on a variety of services and technologies within large enterprise customers. You’ll act as a trusted advisor to customers based on intimate technical knowledge of the customer environment. The DCA has the ability to leverage consulting services, managed services, field services coupled with technology to drive desired business outcomes. What you’ll do at Insight: Build relationships with clients at the manager and director level. Create and implement a solution roadmap and select the right infrastructure and technology platform or product based on in-depth knowledge of one and broad knowledge of other technologies. Ability to lead development of the technical solution or offering, in translating the business needs into technical requirements. Identifies gaps, strategic impacts, financial impacts and the risk profile in the technical solution or offering, and provides technical support. Assist clients with complex projects involved multiple disciples or business units. Recommend to client appropriate technological alternatives. Evaluate new technological developments and how they affect evolving client business requirements. What you’ll need to join Insight: Deep knowledge of data center and storage solutions. Excel at leading group client business discussions Solid experience in consultative / complex sales processes Deep knowledge and interest in major public cloud offerings (i.e. Microsoft Azure, AWS, OpenStack, DevOps) and related Infrastructure, Platform and Software as a Service capabilities. The position described above provides a summary of some the job duties required and what it would be like to work at Insight. For a comprehensive list of physical demands and work environment for this position, click here. Today, every business is a technology business. From IT strategy and design to implementation and management, our 6,800 employees help clients innovate and optimize their operations to run smarter. Discover more at insight.com. Global provider of Intelligent Technology Solutions™ for organizations of all sizes Ranked 417 on the 2018 Fortune 500, 12 on the CRN Solution Provider 500 Founded in 1988 in Tempe, Arizona; now celebrating our 30th anniversary and operating in 20 countries $6.7 billion in revenue for 2017 6,800+ teammates worldwide working with 5,300+ partners 2017 Arizona’s Most Admired Companies (AZ Business Magazine), 7 2017 Best Places to Work (Phoenix Business Journal) 2018 Dell EMC Server Partner of the Year, 2018 Intel Retail Solution Partner of the Year, 2018 IBM Geography Excellence Award as the Top National Strategic Business Partner in North America, Microsoft’s largest global partner Today's talent leads tomorrow's success. Description: Hulu is a premium streaming TV destination that seeks to captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking and embracing fun. It’s a mission that takes some serious smart, intense curiosity and determination to be the best. Come be part of the team that’s powering play. SUMMARY Hulu’s Web team is seeking a Senior Software Developer who will be an exceptional addition to our Non-Subscriber team. As a Senior Software Developer on the Non-Subscriber team at Hulu, you will build, deploy, and optimize the marketing campaign landing pages and search engine content and browsing experience to attract new users to the service. We’ve built a new system to allow our marketing team to create and manage custom landing pages, as well as generate fast, SEO-optimized content information pages for users to learn about everything Hulu has to offer. If you like full-stack web development and are interested in powering play and changing the landscape of television, this is a great role for you! WHAT YOU’LL DO Turn mock-ups and designs into full pages with CSS, HTML, and JavaScript using ES6, React, Redux, Node, Express, and other modern web technologies Work effectively in a fast-paced and ever-evolving environment Commitment to improving existing code, writing testable code, and mentoring junior developers on best practices Design and build a high-performance rendering and page delivery system for both marketing-driven and content-catalog-driven pages Work on headless content editing tool to support our Marketing team’s desire to customize pages quickly and independently Work with our Product Management team to help scope features, identify potential trade-offs, and ensure we’re building the right thing for our customers and our internal stakeholders Help enable A/B testing and rapid iteration to help the company meet its goals WHAT TO BRING Exceptional HTML, CSS and JavaScript skills Experience architecting large single page web applications in either React, Vue, Ember or another comparable JavaScript framework Experience with build tools, such as Webpack or Gulp, as well as transpiling, minification, concatenation and other build-time optimizations Experience with source code control, particularly Git Knowledge of security concerns when developing single page web applications Knowledge of optimizing client-side performance Strong testing discipline and experience using Jest, Karma, Jasmine, or another comparable testing framework Knowledge of technology trends such as ES6, web components, JavaScript frameworks and architectural designs and concerns Exceptional knowledge of JavaScript design patterns as well as object oriented and functional design Exceptional front-end debugging skills Strong organization and communication skills, verbal and written BS degrees in computer science or equivalent experience NICE-TO-HAVES Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and other containerization technologies Experience with Amazon Web Services and/or other cloud services Experience with PHP and Drupal Experience with React Native, NativeScript, and/or Progressive Web Apps Experience developing web applications outside of a traditional browser, i.e. living room devices
IT Skills: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ES6, React, Redux, Node, Express, Webpack, Git, Jest, Karma
Soft Skills: Problem-solving, Mentoring, Communication, Organization
Education: Education-Related Skills:, Bachelor's degree in computer science

Description: Job Information Job Summary: The CIBMTR Data Manager will perform a variety of data management duties of a complex and technical nature in support of clinical research studies conducted by principal investigators (PIs) for the clinical research program to ensure adherence to protocols and quality of information received. Maintain a close, collaborative working relationship with the PIs in your department to effectively manage research studies, with the department, with the administrative team, and the department staff. You will build and maintain effective relationships with key study personnel, clinical resources and colleagues throughout. Responsibilities: Maintaining on-going communications with Information Services and physicians and staff for data collection needs. Reviewing and abstracting the medical records for patients. Entering the clinical data into the REDCap database. Accessing patient demographic and clinical information from the clinical systems. Entering information into the database. Reviewing data for quality and completeness using reporting software. Assist principal investigators and staff in the creation of data reports for quality assurance measures. Reviewing and abstracting the medical records for patients and the monitoring of patient status pre- and post- transplant. Responsible for maintaining long-term outcomes data and locating past transplant patients who are long-term cancer survivors Reviewing data for quality and completeness and assisting with QI/QA of the transplant data base. Competencies: Demonstrated ability to abstract subject data from medical record/source documentation and enter into care report forms and/or databases required. Experience generating and resolving queries and/or monitoring data required. Ability to handle competing demands with diplomacy and enthusiasm required. Ability to perform research data management with minimal supervision required. Strong data management skills and attention to detail required. Ability to work collaboratively and with divisional research offices required. Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Adobe Acrobat required. Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality with clinical data and client's proprietary data required. Adaptability to changing working situations and work assignments required. Ability to work independently and as part of a team required. Analytical skills required. Strong attention to detail required. Excellent multi-tasking skills required. Knowledge of medical and/or /clinical trial terminology required. Knowledge in relevant scientific field required. Ability to train junior data managers required. Additional Requirements Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree and one year of experience or five years of relevant experience required. Technical Knowledge or Skills: Knowledge of medical terminology/environment preferred. Required Documents: Resume Cover Letter NOTE: When applying, all required documents MUST be uploaded under the Resume/CV section of the application Benefit Eligibility Yes Pay Frequency Hourly Pay Range Depends on Qualifications Scheduled Weekly Hours 40 Union Non-Union Job is Exempt? No Drug Test Required? Yes Does this position require incumbent to operate a vehicle on the job? No Health Screen Required? Yes Posting Date 2018-07-23-07:00 Remove from Posting On or Before 2019-01-23-08:00
IT Skills: Data management, Database management, Data quality assurance, Reporting software, Medical record abstraction, Data entry, Research data management, Microsoft Word, Excel, and Adobe Acrobat, Confidentiality management, Clinical data management
Soft Skills: Communication skills, Collaboration, Attention to detail, Adaptability, Problem-solving, Analytical skills, Multi-tasking, Training, Teamwork

Description: Requirements: Education— Bachelor’s degree required. Professional experience considered in lieu of education. Strongly preferred: CISSP certification, or other security certification. Skills— Preferably within a financial services environment, knowledge and experience with documenting and formalizing the security risks and controls surrounding enterprise data centers, network technologies, virtualization, unified communication, and mobility. Knowledge of enterprise control structure architecture and aligning security architecture controls, processes, and tools within that enterprise framework. Ability to perform managerial tasks like meeting coordination and project oversight. Strong communication skills to support the development of deliverables to the Board of Directors and for all levels of Bank management and staff. Preference for keen knowledge of security controls within a hybrid environment between AWS and traditional networks. Experience— Repeated experience in security policy development or broad security operations management, and in developing and managing a security governance program. Security policy and architectural project management or security auditing background may be considered. Repeated experience in successful security incident monitoring and breach response management. Function: Oversee the efforts of information security professionals in all aspects of information security and physical security for the Bank. This covers policy, strategy, administration, governance, monitoring, compliance, guidelines, and standards. Develop and maintain a comprehensive enterprise wide Information Security Program for the Bank. Proactively promote the enhancement of information protection through the identification of risk themes by working collaboratively with all areas of the Bank. Essential Duties: 1\. Provide security perspective on Bank projects during Project Gate Reviews when required and upon request. Be able to draft the ISO assessment of the project with assistance. 2\. Ensure information is protected across the Bank and that effective information security programs, strategies, practices, processes and systems are in place and functioning as required. 3\. Maintain access to independently verify and observe operational performance in a broad oversight perspective for information security, physical security, and all matters of cyber risk across the Bank and to carry out any special investigative requirements. 4\. Help manage the independent security review process: vendor selection, fieldwork, and assist with the drafting of reports suitable to the Head of Enterprise Services, senior management, and the Board of Directors. 5\. Maintain appropriate professional associations and certifications for the purpose of keeping abreast of security trends, issues, solutions, events, emerging threats, and having a perspective on the relevant industry advances. 6\. With guidance, develop training, awareness campaigns, specific scenario modules, documents, white papers, and other artifacts that help: a. Raise awareness all employees regarding their role in securing information in all forms. b. Articulate the choices of the Bank relative to information protection. c. Document what is secured and how we do the protection. d. Advise and alert all Bank employees on information security matters. e. Present current security topics in perspective for the Bank audience. 7\. Help define the Bank’s information security program, policy, and standards. As assigned, guide operational areas across the Bank on procedures, guidelines, and instructions to support the Bank’s policy and standards. 8\. Serve on Bank committees, teams, and efforts as assigned, 9\. Assist in the security incident response management process at the Bank: help manage the oversight of incident response, and the control of information events. 10\. As assigned, independently prepare reports capable of being delivered to the Board of Directors, CEO and senior management on information security, information protection, and information risk matters. a. As assigned, guide business unit managers and staff to ensure that their performance is within current exposure tolerances. b. As assigned, guide IT operational security unit managers and staff to ensure that their performance is within current exposure tolerances. 11\. Guide the planning of information security projects and annual budget. a. Monitor the security operations functions of the Bank. This is to be done with the goal of identifying themes in the events observed, ensuring the escalation of incidents, and answering questions that arise through oversight of how the Bank’s security efforts are functioning. b. With assistance, review vended security offerings, recommend solutions, and review contracts. 12\. Gather the data to support the proper reporting of security measures and metrics. With guidance, draft reports that highlight these metrics. 13\. Assist with audits and examinations regarding information security and controls. 14\. Perform special tasks as assigned by the Director of, or a manager in, the Information Security Office.
IT Skills: CISSP certification, Documenting security risks and controls, Enterprise control structure architecture, Security control architecture alignment, Security incident monitoring, Security policy development, Security operations management, Security governance program development, Security policy and architectural project management, Security auditing, Information Security Program development, ISO assessment drafting, Security review process management, Security training development, Security incident response management, Security reporting
Soft Skills: Strong communication skills, Managerial tasks, Collaboration, Awareness campaigns, Report drafting, Committee participation, Budget planning, Data gathering, Problem-solving, Task management

Working knowledge of Lean Manufacturing or Six Sigma-based continuous improvement methods. Leonardo Helicopter Product Experience is a plus. Leonardo Quality System Experience is a plus.
