Description: Work Location : Chandler, AZ Functional Area : Distribution and Warehouse Number of Openings : 1 Current Openings : 1.00 ____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Blount International, Inc. has an exceptional opportunity for a Shipping and Receiving Specialist to be located at our Chandler, Arizona location. We are committed to excellence in our people, products, performance, and profits. We believe our team members are the foundation of our Company's success, and we are committed to continuous improvement and learning, exceptional quality, connecting with our customer, and good relationships with our team members. BUSINESS CONTRIBUTION: The successful candidate will supports the shop by leading the day-to-day activities of receiving and shipping materials. Directing proper flow of product to specific locations within the warehouse in a safe, timely, and accurate manner. Key responsibilities include executing day-to-day operations within a warehouse / shop environment. Daily operations include: receiving product from suppliers into SAP, picking and packing customer orders, accurately selecting parts from storage locations, and assembling & consolidating the order in a manner that meets the Company’s standards for safety, quality, and productivity. RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: Perform warehouse functions including picking and packing orders, and stocking finished goods inventory Prepare, package and palletize as required to ensure product will arrive to customer location without damage Meet quality standards in preparation of shipments to ensure correct quantity and part numbers Unload containers and trucks in timely manner using a fork truck or pallet jack and break down and organize incoming/outgoing freight Verify incoming/outgoing shipments against purchase order Complete SAP transactions and confirm transfer orders in SAP Verify count and condition of incoming/outgoing product and insure accurate inventory Identify and report safety hazards Understand and apply proper motorized equipment operation and pedestrian safety Prepares manifests, bills of lading, packing lists, and other documents as required for shipments Organize and file completed shipping documents to comply with all regulations and requirements Track and report damaged shipments inbound/outbound and any delivery quality issues Perform weekly Cycle Counts Investigate discrepancies in shipments or inventory and label and put inventory in proper bin locations Communicate information on recurring issues, to team, supervision, and/or Shared Service team Communicate inventory issues with appropriate person or department Interact with ICS CSRs and Sales personnel to determine priorities, best shipping methods, estimates, customer information, shipping advice, and track and trace issues Interact with customers regarding will-call orders, warehousing issues, etc. EDUCATION: High school diploma or GED required QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS REQUIRED: A minimum of six months’ experience in a warehouse/distribution setting, preferably small parcel distribution Effectively determine proper storage methods, identification, and stock location based on turnover, environmental factors, and physical capabilities of facilities Keep accurate records on the use and/or damage of stock or stock handling equipment Examine and inspect stock items for wear or defects, reporting any damage to supervisors Provide assistance or direction to other warehouse workers Able to complete responsibilities in a timely, professional and quality manner Solve problems analytically; search out relevant information and gauge its importance when making decisions Effective written and oral communication skills; able to express oneself clearly and in technical and non-technical terms Collaborative and effective team player and able to work with teams who are globally dispersed Set a good example of personal integrity Demonstrate ability and willingness to learn; seek out development activities to improve skills and increase knowledge; learn from other team members and own mistakes Take initiative, seek and act on opportunities to improve organization performance Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Word, Excel) and data management software (SAP preferred) Available to work on site as required by job; eligible for domestic and international travel ABOUT BLOUNT INTERNATIONAL, INC: Blount is a global manufacturer and marketer of replacement parts, equipment, and accessories for consumers and professionals operating primarily in two market segments: Forestry, Lawn, and Garden (“FLAG”); and Farm, Ranch, and Agriculture (“FRAG”). Blount also sells products in the construction markets and is the market leader in saw chain and guide bars for chain saws. We also supply original equipment manufacturers (OEM) with cutting attachments. Blount offers products under the brand names of OREGON®, Carlton®, Woods®, KOX, SpeeCo®, ICS®, and Pentruder. For more information, visit www.blount.com . Blount will only employ those who are legally authorized to work. Any offer of employment is contingent on the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.
IT Skills: SAP, Warehouse operations, Fork truck or pallet jack operation, Inventory management, Shipping and receiving procedures, Microsoft Office suite
Soft Skills: Problem-solving, Communication skills, Teamwork, Integrity, Continuous learning, Initiative, Organizational skills

Job Title: Diversity Events Specialist, Talent Programs and Events
Description: Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. As a Programs Specialist, you will enthusiastically represent the Google brand and build our talent pipeline. Whether it’s making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you will have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You'll be focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. The Talent Programs & Events team, part of Global People Services, is focused on promoting YouTube and Google as an exceptional place to work for potential talent; building a robust and diverse pipeline of outstanding candidates and collaborating cross-functionally and globally to build and refine partnerships and outreach. Whether you are developing events that will engage a target engineering profile, building relationships with external organizations or developing strategy to attract talent to YouTube’s workforce, you will have an eye on Google’s short-term and long-term growth needs and a pulse of the broader brand landscape. Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. Responsibilities Plan and execute recruiting and employment branding events, ranging from small intimate programs to large scale productions. Build solid relationships with vendors, internal team members, and a wide range of stakeholders across Google to manage expectations and ensure high-quality event management. Partner with internal entities to create comprehensive program and event strategies. Contribute to our online presence and public messaging by creating interesting and informational web and collateral content. Manage post-event reporting, detailed tracking and analysis. Manage relationships with key external organizations and groups to cultivate a strong partnership and enhance Google’s brand in the employment marketplace. Develop and implement events including program mapping/planning, budgets, stakeholder engagement, logistics, messaging (internal and external), developing content with partners, and other core elements to successfully meet event objectives. Travel as required. Qualifications Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 4 years of experience in program/event planning, marketing, HR, or a related area. 1-year of experience with diversity event planning and managing events targeted. Ability to travel as required by role. Preferred qualifications: Experience working with large amounts of data. Ability to handle, analyze, visualize and present data to influence decision-making. Experience using G Suite (e.g. Email, Calendar, Docs, Spreadsheets and Sites. Focused on providing client support for the coordination and seamless delivery of events. Able to grow positive working relationships with colleagues at all organizational levels. Ability to prioritize and multitask, and follow through with team members to achieve individual and group goals. Flexible, proactive, responsible, and detail-oriented. Highly motivated and creative professional with demonstrated event, project/budget management, organizational and communication skills. At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other company location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
IT Skills: Program/event planning, Marketing, Data analysis, G Suite (Email, Calendar, Docs, Spreadsheets, Sites)
Soft Skills: Relationship building, Stakeholder management, Communication, Organization, Prioritization, Teamwork, Creativity

Description: About sweetgreen: sweetgreen is on a mission to build healthier communities by connecting people to real food. We passionately believe that real food should be convenient and accessible to everyone. Every day in each sweetgreen, our 3,500 team members make food from scratch, using fresh ingredients and produce delivered that morning. And in our local communities, we’re committed to leaving people better than we found them. We’re in the business of feeding people, and we’re out to change what that means. Summary: As our data project manager at sweetgreen, you will keep the data analytics and science team on track to deliver both external customer-facing data products - like personalized recommender engines and CRM solutions - and operational tools for our internal customers, the corporate office and our store teams. You will heavily collaborate with all disciplines at sweetgreen to ensure organizational coordination, proper prioritization and communication. Core Work Activities: Project Management: Manages the complete lifecycle of moderately-to-highly complex data projects ensuring adherence to timeline and scope. Discipline Management: Manages the resource allocation and proper function of the data team in coordination with the established priorities and timelines. Relationship Management: Builds strong working relationships with internal and external partners to ensure successful ways of working and the subsequent success of long-term goals. Agile Coaching: Coaches teams within the Agile methodology and promotes the adoption of Agile values and principles to improve both Agile practices across the company and organizational performance. Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, + Other Characteristics Required for Successful Performance: 3+ years’ project management, product management, resource management or equivalent experience 3+ years’ experience with Agile or equivalent methodologies 1+ years’ experience in working with data teams Organizational skills to manage competing demands and ensure timely implementation Written and verbal communication + presentation skills Personal and team time management skills Ability to work and influence cross-functionally to meet deliverables What you'll get: Competitive pay + bonus plan granted based on performance Health, dental + vision insurance Flexible PTO, because we respect the need for work/life harmony An opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you, both by growing them and by connecting them to real food To live the sweetlife and celebrate your passion + purpose A collaborative family of people who live our core values and have your back A clear career path with opportunities for development, both personally and professionally Our annual Impact Retreat offsite Free sweetgreen swag Complimentary sweetgreen Come join the sweetlife! sweetgreen provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.
IT Skills: Project Management, Data Analytics, Agile Methodologies, Resource Management
Soft Skills: Communication Skills, Organizational Skills, Time Management, Relationship Management, Team Collaboration

Description: Solution Architects within the Life Time Technology group at Life Time are responsible for delivering the technical design and development of software components for assigned projects. Examples of Work Performed 10% of their time on management tasks, 40% on technical design and mentoring, 50% on writing code. Design, code, and test technical solutions with an emphasis on TDD. Use appropriate technical design methods to explain your approach. Strive to eliminate defects as early as possible by actively participating in code reviews. Understand the necessity of coding standards and lead effort to ensure delivery based on the coding standards. Increase efficiency of team by mentoring other team members. Proactively work with Business Analysts to understand project requirements. Estimate development effort to deliver. Understand and communicate technical and functional design requirements to other team members. Recognize and effectively communicate risks to project timelines and quality. Understand, challenge and support architectural expectations. Support and help guide the evolution of the system's architecture Identify system deficiencies and proactively recommend solutions. Ensure technology, legal, security and process standards are followed across all development efforts. Remain current on technology trends applicable to Life Time's business Qualifications Education: Four-year college degree in related field or equivalent combination of education and experience Experience: 10+ years of experience in the software industry 4+ years of experience using .NET 2+ years of experience leading or mentoring team members Experience with as many of the following as possible: Strong experience with Agile and Scrum Strong experience with REST services Strong experience with AngularJS, Vue.js or a similar JavaScript framework MuleSoft or other similar integration platform Azure API Management or another similar API gateway platform Azure Service Bus or other similar cloud messaging platform Integration tools & techniques (Orchestration, SOA, XML, JSON, SOAP, REST, etc.) CI/CD helping to move the team forward in maturity Licenses / Certifications / Registration: None required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Other Characteristics Strong communicator able to explain complex technical situations to relatively non-technical co-workers and key business stakeholders. Cool under pressure, able to simultaneously manage many details and priorities. Able to lead a complex technical project through to completion. Solution oriented mindset creative use of technology and alternative approaches. "No"is not in your vocabulary. Able to work with teams to balance solution vs. budget, schedule, and tools. Equally at home working with creative, business, and technical people. Appreciation of marketing strategy and business strategy and ability to determine the best technical solutions to support these strategies. Focus on broad technical expertise. Enthusiasm to learn new technologies, and ability to do so quickly, on the job. Physical / Mental Requirements and Working Conditions Work is performed in an office setting. This position is required to regularly: Talk and hear Use hands and fingers to organize, place and move workflow Read, write, type and comprehend text Visually observe objects up close and at a distance Effectively communicate and interact with others Use reasoning and solve problems through analytical deduction
IT Skills: TDD, Coding standards, Agile and Scrum, REST services, AngularJS or similar JavaScript framework, Integration platforms (MuleSoft, Azure API Management), Cloud messaging platforms (Azure Service Bus), Integration tools & techniques (Orchestration, SOA, XML, JSON, SOAP, REST), CI/CD, Technology trends awareness

Description: Job Description IBM Research is seeking a semiconductor process integration Engineer to explore and evaluate technologies for future computing systems. The successful applicant will pioneer process and technology innovations to build future computing systems. Day to day responsibilities include designing and executing experiments to fabricate and characterize advanced semiconductor materials and devices for high performance and low operating voltage applications and collaborating with the process, integration, device, circuit, and systems communities. This role provides the opportunity to join a world class team responsible for defining and delivering future CMOS technology nodes using a state of the art research lab. It also provides the freedom to work on leading edge technologies in new areas during their earliest stages. The World is Our Laboratory: No matter where discovery takes place, IBM researchers push the boundaries of science, technology and business to make the world work better. IBM Research is a global community of forward-thinkers working towards a common goal: progress. Required Technical and Professional Expertise At least 2 years of experience with advanced semiconductor processing At least 2 years of experience with advanced semiconductor integration Basic understanding of advanced semiconductor materials Basic understanding of the scaling limits of advanced CMOS technology Basic understanding of the device physics of advanced CMOS technology Preferred Tech and Prof Experience At least 2 years of Back End of Line Integration Experience At least 2 years experience with MOSFETs At least 2 years experience in characterizing FET devices EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
IT Skills: Semiconductor processing, Semiconductor integration, Semiconductor materials, CMOS technology, Device physics, Back End of Line Integration, MOSFETs, Characterizing FET devices
Soft Skills: Collaboration
Education: Skills Related to Education:, Basic understanding of advanced semiconductor materials, Basic understanding of the scaling limits of advanced CMOS technology, Basic understanding of the device physics of advanced CMOS technology

Description: General Summary of the Purpose of the Position The Communications Coordinator is responsible for social media support, internal and external communication creation, PR activities, internal and external event support and writing duties. The Communications Coordinator will work closely with the Communications Manager and Communication Specialists to implement communications strategies for Starkey Hearing Technologies – including the Starkey brand and other brands. Approach and Deployment (What to Do & How to Do It) Provide social media strategy and implementation support Execute on social media campaigns, contribute to a monthly calendar of social media content; work with Communications Specialists to ensure a cohesive message, voice and seamless integration between websites, social and other communication channels Provide strategic thinking, creative and engaging content for social media activities. Integrate communication strategies across public relations, internal, online and social media avenues Write and distribute social media materials to retail and professional teams Demonstrate performance improvement of social media program via reporting Write and/or edit social content when needed across all retail social channels, both customer and consumer-facing Under guidance of Communications Specialist, offer online customer service support for social media inquiries Create and support internal and external communication under the mentorship of the Communications Specialist Support, create and manage various internal and external email campaigns as needed Manage and create StarNet posts, which are integral for employee engagement Provide support of public relations activities Provide strategic thinking and input on public relations activities and work with the Communications Manager to integrate communication strategies across public relations, internal, online and social media avenues Help write and distribute targeted press materials to trade and consumer media Provide planning, writing and editing support for _Innovations_ on an as needed basis Write and edit articles Provide planning support during monthly meeting Provide proofreading support for all marketing materials as needed Proofread as needed Provide back-up to Marketing Proofreader when needed Contribute to the strategy and writing of various blogs and articles Contribute to content; work with Communications Specialists to ensure seamless integration between blog, articles and other communication channels Support content for social media, blogs, articles, press releases Support events through social media Events would be internal employee events, customer-facing events and community engagement/sponsorship events (some evenings and weekends required) Results – Performance Measures (How to Measure Success) Completes projects in a timely fashion and provides clear communication to the Communications Specialist and Communications Manager about project status Able to self-manage multiple projects Successfully navigates public relations and social media space and understands communication standards Writing requires few major edits Picks up skills quickly to help provide support for email campaigns Is detail-oriented and methodical when proofreading Other Duties (Non Measurable) Support Starkey Employee Corporate and/or Department Guidelines. Check and verify quality. Support corporate health and safety objectives. React to change productively and handle other essential duties as assigned. Hearing industry experience preferred. Agency experience preferred. Job Title: Assistant Manager of Analytics and Donor Research
Description: Description: Reports to: Director of Advancement Services, Analytics and Membership Department: Development Classification: Exempt, Full-time Benefits: Full Museum Benefits Scope of position: The Dallas Museum of Art is in a period of exciting growth as it implements a strategic plan centered around a new mission – art and engagement. The expansion of the Development Department—including several newly created positions—is a key element towards success of the plan and the Museum’s future as a national leader. The Assistant Manager of Analytics and Donor Research will report to the Manager of Advancement Services, and will have primary responsibility for reporting and conducting analyses that support efforts to track, measure and enhance revenue generating initiatives, and implementing a strategy for conducting ongoing and effective donor research processes. Working closely with the Manager of Advancement Services, the Assistant Manager will support efforts to assess and analyze current systems, data quality, and database architecture to enhance the Museum’s ability to create ad hoc reporting, automate and schedule reports electronically, and build complex analyses through modeling, data mining, and other analytic techniques. In addition, the Assistant Manager will also be responsible for conducting prospect research and provide prospect management support to front-line fundraising staff. Prospect research functions include identifying, collecting, and analyzing prospective and existing donors. The Assistant Manager will conduct biographical, wealth, financial and philanthropic research. Using information, analysis and management tools, and other resources provide strategic and effective support to achieve fundraising goals. Assist in assessing and creating efficient workflow processes to better manage prospect data and pipeline management. Essential Functions: Think strategically about data and analyze data for strategic decision-making to improve ability to fundraise Support all aspects of the donor system (Raiser’s Edge) and applications (Importomatic) including security, structure, usage, reporting, functionality, ease of use, and accuracy of extracted and imported data. Work closely with the Director of Individual Giving, the Manager of Circle, the Director of Advancement Services, Analytics and Membership, and the Manager of Advancement Services to develop and implement donor prospecting strategies and provide recommendations on reporting needs and methodologies. Develop, design, maintain and implement donor prospecting strategies and processes to create donor segmentation and ranking systems, and build detailed donor profiles. Develop, design, and maintain reports that track key performance measures of membership growth, retention, movement, upgrades, downgrades, visitation and more. Provide advanced query reporting and export processes. Develop, design, maintain and implement complex analyses though modeling, data mining efforts, and analytic techniques to support strategies. Coordinate and fulfill data requests and list pulls from across the Museum. Provide assistance and consultation to staff on the effective use of applications, systems, and tools and how to utilize for their respective needs. Ongoing monitoring of industry related developments in the area of analytics and donor research best practices across industries. Represent the Department on internal projects that involve donor data, prospecting and reporting. Other duties as assigned . Requirements: Education, Experience, and Certification: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in database management, report writing, data analysis or research in a fundraising environment 2 years of experience in database management and donor research in a fundraising environment is preferred Experience with the following systems and databases is preferred: Advanced working knowledge of Blackbaud’s Raisers Edge database or other relational database (Raisers Edge certification or similar/ related system) Blackbaud applications e.g., Importomatic Etix or other ticketing systems LexisNexis, Wealth Engine, or other donor prospecting tools or platforms Experience and working knowledge of SQL (structured query language) and SQL Server administration, and other computer languages to support the design and automation of reports. Key Qualifications: Proficiency in information management and knowledge of standard Windows applications (Excel and Access) Proficiency and experience with analytical and visualization software such as Tableau preferred. Experience with conducting and presenting data analysis and research reports preferred. Experience with data-focused work and knowledge of statistics preferred. The ability to exercise discretion and maintain constituent confidentiality is required. Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills Strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated experience working with cross-functional teams and leading teams Strong communication skills Outstanding organizational, multi-tasking, and problem-solving skills Sense of humor The Dallas Museum of Art is committed to building a culturally diverse staff and is and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.
IT Skills: ****, Database management, Report writing, Data analysis, Fundraising, Raiser's Edge, Importomatic, SQL, SQL Server administration, Windows applications, Excel, Access, Tableau, Statistics
Soft Skills: ****, Strategic thinking, Interpersonal skills, Teamwork, Communication, Organizational skills, Problem-solving, Discretion, Humor

Description: Coordinate the processing of resident student housing applications and license agreements. Assign rooms and roommates to resident students. Provide administrative support to University off-campus leased and owned properties and supervise student employees as assigned. Position Specific Responsibilities: Produce and disseminate all information pertaining to University housing, including: application, license agreement, cost sheet and general information. Process housing requests for new and returning students according to established criteria. Assign students to apartments and residence halls (3,300+ beds). Work with Admissions, Athletics, Disabled Student Services and other University departments as necessary to place special needs students. Serve as primary contact for parents and students concerning assignments and related issues. Maintain housing student data. Provide information necessary for billings, mailings, confirmations, rosters and charts. Manage production of reports and statistics, including occupancy reports and resident rosters. Compose appropriate responses to daily correspondence. Process requests for room changes. Coordinate placement and assignment of new students and room selection processes for returning students. Assist with accounts payable operations as related to University off-campus housing leased and/or owned properties. Provide administrative support to all University off-campus housing leased and/or owned properties Experience/Qualifications: 3 years of progressively responsible administrative and general office experience, preferably in a higher education environment. Exemplary communication skills (both written and oral) evidenced by background in preparing correspondence, publications, and comprehensive reports incorporating complex, highly technical information. Ability to work effectively with all levels of the University community including students, parents, faculty, and staff. Demonstrates computer competency in word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, database and desktop publishing software and student information systems. Ability to manage large volumes of requests and prioritize workload. Ability to compose correspondence and other written materials independently. Work effectively with a diverse population of students, parents, faculty, and staff. License/Certification/Registration Requirements: Physical Demands (if applicable)

Description: Overview American Science and Engineering, an OSI Systems Company is seeking a Supply Chain Data Analyst in its Billerica, MA Facility. In this role the Supply Chain Data Analyst will analyze global supply planning activities that can include material sourcing, supply chain and planning. AS&E is an industry leader in detection technology, providing cargo and vehicle inspection systems and services for ports, borders, military, high- threat facilities, and checkpoints to help customers combat terrorism, drug smuggling, illegal immigration, and trade fraud. We offer a broad array of scanning system configurations that leverage low-, medium-, and high-energy X-ray technology—or multiple X-ray technologies—to address each customer’s unique security application requirements. Our commitment to excellence in imaging performance, innovative design, and uncompromising quality ensures our solutions consistently deliver best-in-class imaging, high reliability, and operator satisfaction, to help customers find threats and contraband with ease and confidence. The Supply Chain Data Analyst uses analytical methods and a variety of tools to understand, predict, improve and/or control various Supply Chain operations and processes. Responsible for analyzing performance, identifying insights, and developing recommendations that support management and maximize operational efficiency. Must be a self-starter, detail oriented, able to support and lead multiple projects, possess excellent communication skills, work well with a team, interact with multiple levels and functions within the Supply Chain and Operations organizations, and able to manage vendor/business relationships. This role reports directly to the Senior Manager of Supply Chain Responsibilities Collect and analyze data reflecting supply chain activities - purchasing, demand and supply planning, manufacturing, and warehousing. Participate and/or assist in larger studies and reviews. Conduct analyses to interpret and explain activities; identify trends and patterns. Conduct cost optimization, trend and cost/benefit analyses. Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures. Identify opportunities for cost savings. Prepare reports to allow for the identification of trends, demands, constraints, and changing conditions. Use technology to develop and introduce an AS&E wide Supplier Scorecard process. Ensure the process is robust and that the monthly cadence is supported with good data. Be able to follow up with suppliers and Supply Chain groups to ensure the process helps improve communication and supplier performance. Develops dashboards to allow the business to maintain awareness of world markets, emerging material related issues and currency changes and position the supply chain to respond promptly and effectively. Work closely with AS&E Supply Chain teams to help develop suitable reporting and documentation to support annual planned KPI’s. For example, build tracking tools for Cost Savings, On Time Delivery or Inventory reduction. Collects & organizes data for Supply Planning monthly metrics as well as Supply Dashboards; creates charts for trending comparisons. Creates queries and reports to aid Supply Planning managers in highlighting delivery risks. Collects & organizes data for Supply Planning monthly metrics as well as Supply Dashboards; creates charts for trending comparisons. Generates reports, and aids in transforming transactional base sourcing data into meaningful information to drive informed dialog and strategy development within the sourcing and quality operations departments. Provide analytics support through combination of data mining, data modeling, data analysis, cost/benefit analysis, process mapping, and/or problem analysis. Uphold the Company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork. Demonstrate behavior consistent with the Company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct. Ensure that direct report(s) are trained and evaluated on their knowledge and adherence to the Company’s values, Code of Ethics and Conduct, and applicable compliance policies. Manage, evaluate and develop team of employees to meet functional deliverables and responsibilities. Complete company people management requirements. Exhibit manager core competencies. It is the responsibility of every Spacelabs Healthcare employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem. Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering or 1-3 years Supply Chain experience with knowledge of SQL, Python, R ect. preferred Understanding of using strong analytical, problem solving and statistical skills with an understanding of building KPI’s, Dashboards, Spend Cubes, Inventory Models, and Capacity Models, ensuring accuracy of data for tracking to the metrics and being able to draw fact based conclusions. Knowledge of Supply Chain including, replenishment, sourcing, logistics, related to data analytics. 1-3 years’ experience with Business Intelligence Crystal Reports, Power BI, Tableau. Prefer experience in Power BI 1-3 years. SQL, Python, R experience preferred. Advanced EXCEL skill required. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task. Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct It is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business. Description: BIG RED DOG places great importance on training and imparting knowledge to the next generation of engineers. BRD selects current college students to work in offices across the state and in varying market sectors and directly with Project Engineers and Graduate Engineers. These interns are exposed to every stage of a project and given hands on opportunities to be a part of the success of BIG RED DOG. Responsibilities \---------------- Our interns take on similar tasks and responsibilities as full-time entry-level staff. We provide planning and engineering services associated with all modes of transportation. We are a team of entrepreneurial individuals empowered to collaborate, innovate, and develop creative solutions that improve communities. Transportation interns will work closely with more senior staff to learn the basics of advanced transportation planning and traffic engineering practices. Interns aid with data collection, roadway and intersection analysis, multi-modal studies, and creation of reports and graphics. Education/Experience \-------------------- All applicants must be current students in good standing with their university. Interns with BIG RED DOG work between 15 and 29 hours per week.

Description: About Us St. John Providence Health System is a member of Ascension Health, the largest not-for-profit Catholic Health system in the United States. Our Mission, Vision and Values: St. John Providence Health System, as a Catholic health ministry, is committed to providing spiritually centered, holistic care which sustains and improves the health of individuals in the communities we serve, with special attention to the poor and vulnerable. Our Values: We are called to: Service of the Poor, Reverence, Integrity, Wisdom, Creativity and Dedication Our Vision: Our passion for healing calls us to cultivate trust, advocate wellness, and transform healthcare. Job Description Summary: The Exercise Physiologist implements and supervises physical exercise programs for patients. Responsibilities: Provides patient testing and assessment before and after rehabilitation. Plans and teaches exercise therapy for patients utilizing test data, patient status and current medication regimen. Monitors patient's response and revises plan accordingly. Recognizes contraindications and abnormal patient responses to exercise. Responds appropriately to all situations including exercise cessation and referral to medical professionals. Provides exercise information for patients, peers and the community which may include public speaking and education classes. Explains program test procedures to patients for whom services are appropriate, which may include, but are not limited to, those with cardiovascular, pulmonary, metabolic, immunologic, inflammatory, orthopedic and neuromuscular diseases and conditions. Interviews patient to obtain vital statistics, medical history and records information. Collect, analyze and interpret pre and post exercise electrocardiograms. Supervises and monitors patient during both exercise (treadmill, bicycle ergo meter), pharmaceutical stress testing and tilt table testing. Applies appropriate testing modalities as ordered. Medication administration as delegated by physician. Administers and monitors IC's according to established protocols. Performs duties as delegated and supervised by the Michigan Public Health Code. http://www.msms.org/Content/ContentFolders/Advocacy2/ScopeofPractice/ScopePracBook.pdf Qualifications Licenses/Certifications/Registration: Required Credential(s): Certification specializing in Advanced Cardio Life Support obtained within 6 Months (180 days) of hire date or job transfer date. One or more of the following: Basic Life Support Provider certification from the American Heart Association (AHA) required. American Red Cross (ARC) CPR for Professional Rescuers card will be accepted upon hire but renewal must be a BLS Provider card from AHA. Preferred Credential(s): American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM) certification preferred. Education: Bachelor of Science or Applied Arts in Exercise Physiology or Kinesiology required Master's degree preferred Work Experience: 1 year of experience with stress testing preferred How To Apply If you are interested in joining the St. John Providence Health System team, click here https://ascension.ttcportals.com/jobs/search/ to search for a job and complete an online application. We urge you to apply for any/all positions in which you are interested. If you fit the qualifications for the role, we will reach out to you. Please ensure you complete all required fields within the application (indicated with an asterisk), as well as, additional information that is requested of you. Information that you offer us will better assist us in understanding your qualifications and fit for the position(s) for which you've applied. Equal Employment Opportunity St. John Providence Health System is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all associates and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, height, weight, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, veteran status or any other legally protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. The information requested on this application will not be used for any purpose prohibited by law. If you require assistance or an accommodation to complete this application, please let us know.
IT Skills: Exercise therapy, Patient testing and assessment, Monitoring patient response, Electrocardiogram analysis, Stress testing
Soft Skills: Communication, Empathy, Adaptability, Attention to detail
Education: Education-Related Skills:, Bachelor of Science or Applied Arts in Exercise Physiology or Kinesiology, Certification specializing in Advanced Cardio Life Support

Description: Summary Responsible to manage and analyze the inputs of the data and output of the feedback from the Call Miner (CM) voice analytics tool. This includes establishing the relevant reports and distributing feedback throughout the management team in the organization. Help facilitate Direct Energy to drive a better customer experience, stay within Compliance, and facilitate expectations pertaining to Sales/Churn. Responsibilities/Skills & Qualifications Establish a detailed understanding of our strategies, vendor requirements, and regulatory concerns as they apply to our business Look for opportunities where gaps may exist between our stated practices and actual practices. Elevate significant gaps to executive management Based on your detailed understanding of our practices, calibrate Call Miner tool so it best reflects the content of our calls, highlighting areas of concern within our calls, as well as best practices Learn the mechanics of the CM product with the goal of being Direct Energy’s content expert on this tool While this is not an IT role, you should have familiarity with the mechanics of the CM and how it relates to our various collection databases. This includes how data is accumulated and how it flows through the process all the way from the call itself to the CM output Analyze the daily data input into CM to ensure its completeness and accuracy. Recommend process or improvement to the data feed into the CM tool to maximize the value of using this tool Improve our CM scripting to ensure our calls are properly graded by the CM software. This will entail learning the scripting “language” as well as writing the scripts to both capture potential call issues, as well as to minimize “false positives” on the calls Analyze the feedback within the CM environments looking for areas of consistent high performance, as well as areas of operational improvements. Look for trends in the data, and isolate patterns by client, site, collector, etc. Use this data to enhance the collector scorecard and provide regular feedback to the executives as well as the management team Determine weaknesses in our compliance and/or training program through the feedback received in the CM analytics. Recommend logical next steps to improve our processes to close any gaps or areas of concern Establish a set of executive level reports to bring forward the most relevant data Present the most relevant data in a clear and consistent manner to easily display any trends, etc. Develop a dashboard that includes trending information Education/Experience Computer skills in the following areas: CallMiner, Excel, Power Point, etc. Bachelor Degree from four-year College or University, four or five years of related business experience or administrative skills or professional functions. PLEASE APPLY ONLINE by hitting the ' Apply ' button. Applications will ONLY be accepted via the ‘Apply’ button. This role is being handled by the Centrica recruitment team and NO agency contact is required.
IT Skills: CallMiner, Excel, Power Point, Data Analysis, Scripting
Soft Skills: Communication, Problem-solving, Attention to detail, Analytical skills, Presentation skills
Education: Skills related to education:, Bachelor's degree, Computer skills

Description: The IT Systems Administrator is responsible for creating and maintaining the company’s computer systems and networks. As a systems administrator you will be responsible for figuring out an organization’s needs in terms of computers and network infrastructure and then implementing that plan. It involves defining requirements for end-user devices and connectivity to network services, maintaining the hardware and systems, and keeping software up to date. The systems administrator is ultimately responsible for business continuity by maximizing systems’ uptime and ensuring a viable disaster recovery plan is in place. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Develop and update the network’s environment architecture and documentation. Monitor and maintain business critical network services. Troubleshoot software, hardware and network issues. Support the IT help desk system. Enforce all required cybersecurity elements. Backup and restore an organization's data files and systems. Direct all IT-related contractors and consultants. Coordinate with all other company’s IT staff, other IT sys admins and support specialists. EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS BS in computer engineering or similar with significant experience in an IT role such as user support, networking, and/or security. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES Well-versed with computer hardware and software. Knowledgeable with network and cybersecurity technologies and best practices. Equally comfortable with the do-it-youself or outsource approach to deployments or solving problems. A strong communicator in order to effectively communicate and advise staff on network and computer issues. A methodical problem-solver with an aptitude for learning and quickly adapting new skills. Patient and resourceful. Ability to inspire global collaboration. Ability to have fun! US Citizen _Please note this description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice._ _Orolia is an equal opportunity employer who does not discriminate based on race, color, citizenship, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran’s status or any protected category. We encourage veterans and people with disabilities to apply._
IT Skills: Network architecture design, Network services maintenance, Software troubleshooting, Hardware maintenance, Software updates, Disaster recovery planning, Data backup and restoration, Cybersecurity enforcement, Knowledge of computer hardware, Knowledge of computer software, Network technologies, Cybersecurity best practices
Soft Skills: Communication, Problem-solving, Adaptability, Patience, Resourcefulness, Global collaboration, Fun-oriented attitude

Description: Who You Are: You are a talented and results driven Product Manager, with strong experience working in fast paced e-commerce environments, who is eager to support business growth by supporting internal data strategy, enabling the business to more quickly access actionable insights. While you are excited about data you are even more excited about the business opportunities that can be leveraged from easy access to quality data. You create simplicity out of complexity. You collaborate, always. You measure progress in terms of days and weeks. Most importantly, you are looking for an opportunity to make a measurable difference for the business. Your Next Challenge: We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager to partner closely with analytics and technology stakeholders to take our internal data & analytics platform strategy to the next level by improving the speed, accuracy, and quality of insights. Work with enterprise reporting & analytics, technology, and organizational leadership to identify and define key business problems related to our current data and analytics platform, and to drive alignment against goals and key performance metrics that will illustrate our success in solving them. Develop and own a data and analytics platform product strategy and roadmap, with a clear ranking of priorities to align the organization and for technology teams to effectively plan and deliver against. Create and lead cross functional teams that deliver against key priorities, in a way that supports both analytics platform and team maturity, and that maximizes the company’s overarching strategies and approach. What You’ll Need: 5+ years of web or digital product management experience driving internal data and analytics platform strategies and executing across multiple technology teams. Strong analytics background, including experience working with financial data, customer segmentation, behavior, targeting, and traffic analysis. Experience with organizational initiatives and processes centered on improving data quality, including management of or partipcation in data governance frameworks. Experience building or evolving analytics platforms that support large data sets, multivariate testing, predictive modeling, and data visualization, across multiple database environments, leveraging Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc. Outstanding strategic aptitude, with a high level of maturity and confidence in working with senior management and executives across the organization. Experience developing a visible prioritization framework that enables clear and consistent decision making. Strong bias for action; ability to juggle multiple priorities and create a sense of urgency in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams through influence versus direct management; excellent interpersonal skills. Experience building technology solutions using lean agile methodologies. Bachelor’s degree required, MBA preferred. LI-AC1 Who We Are: Getty Images is the most trusted and esteemed source of visual content in the world, with over 200 million assets available through its industry-leading sites www.gettyimages.com and www.istock.com. The Getty Images website serves creative, business and media customers in almost 200 countries and is the first place people turn to discover, purchase and share powerful content from the world's best photographers and videographers. Getty Images works with over 200,000 contributors and hundreds of image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 130,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography. Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of still and moving imagery in communication and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life. For company news and announcements, visit our Press Room, and for the stories and inspiration behind our content, visit Stories & Trends. Find Getty Images on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest and Tumblr, or download the Getty Images app where you can explore, save and share the world's best imagery. Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.
IT Skills: Product Management, Data & Analytics Platform Strategy, Financial Data Analysis, Customer Segmentation, Predictive Modeling, Data Visualization, Database Management (Hadoop, Hive, Spark), Lean Agile Methodologies
Soft Skills: Collaboration, Strategic Thinking, Decision-Making, Leadership, Interpersonal Skills, Prioritization, Urgency Management

Description: Date Opened: 2018-08-02 Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. ENTERTAINING IS OUR PASSION EA was founded over 30 years ago by individuals with a deep passion for making games. Many things have changed over the years as the gaming industry—and the company—has expanded immensely, but we are still driven by the same passion for developing, publishing, and distributing the world’s best games. Our history has been one of great success, and our future looks even brighter. Gaming has come a long way from Pac-Man & Space Invaders to modern EA favorites like Burnout, Battlefield, Mercenaries, Dead Space, Spore, FIFA, Madden, Need for Speed and the world’s most successful game franchise, The Sims. Fuelled by our talented staff at locations right across the Globe we are united in our passion to continue shaping the future of interactive entertainment. Together we can make a difference. _Business Analyst – Global Brand Partnerships_ Role Overview EA’s Global Brand Partnerships team is searching for a Business Analyst that will play a pivotal role in providing business intelligence to the Global Brand Partnerships’ management team and business partners. The Business Analyst will report directly to the Director of Business Management, and the successful candidate will have an analytical background and be familiar with desktop, mobile, and digital advertising. The Business Analyst will combine that experience with data analysis to provide key business insights that will help the Global Brand Partnership team expand its rapidly growing advertising business, and maximize its revenue potential. Key responsibilities include: Preparing standard KPI & ad hoc reports for GBP management, and key business partners Analyzing data and trends to make recommendations to the team on product implementation, and business strategies Forecasting advertising revenue for annual and quarterly fiscal planning, as well as for new ad products and opportunities Reviewing data to identify issues as quickly as possible Partnering with external business partners to improve the flow of data to EA Leading initiatives to automate and streamline reporting processes Building and maintaining strong relationships with business partners Required Skills: Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree 3-5 years prior work experience in an analytical role Strong MS Excel skills Familiarity with gaming and digital media Experience with forecasting Comfortable dealing with large sets of data from multiple sources Strong analytical, strategic, and creative problem-solving skills Ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects with tight deadlines Thorough understanding of digital advertising ecosystem, monetization trends, technologies and pricing models Strong decision-making, organizational, and planning skills with proven ability to identify and prioritize critical issues Thoroughness and high attention to detail Solid interpersonal skills to build key relationships with partners Ability to work both independently as well as a strong team player Cross Platform experience – Mobile, Desktop, & Console EA is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
IT Skills: MS Excel skills, Data analysis, Forecasting, Digital advertising knowledge, Analytical skills, Cross-platform experience, Report preparation, Automation of reporting processes
Soft Skills: Strong decision-making skills, Problem-solving skills, Organization and planning skills, Attention to detail, Interpersonal skills, Relationship building, Ability to work independently and in a team, Prioritization skills

Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started. Infrastructure is the foundation that powers the building of this community and our data centers are the backbone upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure operates. The Strategic Planning and Analytics team is responsible for establishing the roadmap for Facebook's Data Center footprint, enabling the business to execute, and developing analytics programs to measure and optimize the health of our operations. We are seeking an experienced thought leader to run forensics for the organization to further optimize our operations as we rapidly scale the footprint. In this role, you will be expected to forge strong partnerships with the leadership team and leverage the Strategic Planning and Analytics teams to deep dive into various parts of the organization and solve hard business problems that will better position the org to scale. The ideal candidate will have experience working in white space and creating impact from the ground up in a fast-paced environment. They will also be a seasoned thought leader with a proven track record of identifying and driving optimization efforts. This is a full-time role based in our Menlo Park office. RESPONSIBILITIES Form strong partnerships across the org to deep dive and surface opportunities for optimization Leverage data and business principles to identify and drive efficiency opportunities for the wider Infra Data Center Organization Partner with multiple cross-functional teams in order to define problem statements, collect data, and make recommendations Identify and implement streamlined processes for establishing a pipeline of efficiency projects and communications Leverage analytical models to identify insights that are used to drive key decisions across the organization Routinely communicate opportunities, trends and other key indicators to leadership Provide leadership and mentorship to members of cross-functional teams Generate clear problem statements and gap analysis for opportunities that will position the org to scale Establish key performance and progress measurements Review cross-functional org processes to improve efficiency Lead and support various ad hoc projects, as needed, in support of Facebook's Infrastructure strategy MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Management Science) 7+ years of experience in solving org-wide business problems 10+ years of hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholders Experience in leading cross-functional projects that engaging multiple organizations Experience communicating data to all organizational levels Demonstrated experience driving improvement in operational and business processes Demonstrated experience leveraging data-driven models to driving business decisions Demonstrated experience in working with white space with minimal guidance Technical knowledge of data center operations
IT Skills: Data analysis, Operations research, Analytical modeling, Data-driven decision-making, Data interpretation
Soft Skills: Leadership, Problem-solving, Communication, Strategic planning, Teamwork, Mentoring, Collaboration

Job Title: Linux guru – Big Data Systems Support Engineer
Description: The Linux guru – Big Data Systems Support Engineer will also configure and deploy large, complex clustered systems, calling for an ability to quickly grasp client-specific IT environment needs and adapt deployment to suit, including developing an advanced understanding of the general business requirements supported by the Dtex solution. The successful individual will also work closely with the development team and will have the opportunity to have a high level of impact for many years to come. The Linux guru – Big Data Systems Support Engineer must be a team player as well as an individual contributor. Whether working independently or as part of a team, the individual in this role must be able to successfully complete deliverables and meet or beat expectations. Requirements Minimum of 7 years of experience as a Linux System Administrator, NOC Engineer, DevOps Engineer, level-3/tier-3 support engineer or developer of application(s) on clustered Linux servers. Strong Linux knowledge, including networking and security domains Understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases, e.g. postgresql, ElasticSearch Excel at working directly with customers to plan and perform new installations/upgrades/migrations, then maintain, troubleshoot, and resolve issues Proficient in at least one programming and scripting language, e.g. python Hands-on experience with large distributed systems from deployment, maintenance, and scaling perspectives Knowledge of information retrieval and/or analytics domain Preferred Qualifications Deep understanding of any of RHEL/CentOS, Elasticsearch, complex distributed computing, data flow statistics, monitoring Experience configuring and maintaining big data solutions BS / MS Computer Science or related engineering discipline Experience and interest in delivering and/or developing product training Experience contributing to documentation Experience working in start-up environments and worldwide teams Bonus Experience working in large, complex enterprise or government environments directly or with this clientele

Job Title: Managing Delivery Architect - Solution Architect - Cloud Native
Description: About Capgemini With more than 190,000 people, Capgemini is present in over 40 countries and celebrates its 50th Anniversary year in 2017. A global leader in consulting, technology and outsourcing services, the Group reported 2016 global revenues of EUR 12.5 billion (about $13.8 billion USD at 2016 average rate). Together with its clients, Capgemini creates and delivers business, technology and digital solutions that fit their needs, enabling them to achieve innovation and competitiveness. A deeply multicultural organization, Capgemini has developed its own way of working, the Collaborative Business ExperienceTM, and draws on Rightshore�, its worldwide delivery model. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com. Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law. This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory or environmental demands may be referenced in an attempt to communicate the manner in which this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, Capgemini will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship. Click the following link for more information on your rights as an Applicant - http://www.capgemini.com/resources/equal-employment-opportunity-is-the-law Qualifications Enterprise cloud architect who has done cloud native transformation. Specialize in one or two cloud deployment platforms and get architect certification: AWS, Azure, private cloud, PCF, Bluemix Background and experience in app development and architecture Experience in at least SOA based applications in Java, microservices, better would be microservices based apps Experience in principles and techniques of Cloud Native (microservices/BDD , containers/Dockers, Agile, BDD) and DevOps (CI/CD) Experience in one or two PaaS platforms and get architect certification: PCF, AWS Delivery Architects assess a project’s technical feasibility, as well as implementation risks. They are responsible for designing and implementing a project’s technical architecture. They define the structure of a system, its interfaces, and the principles that guide its organization, software design and implementation. The scope of the Delivery Architect’s role is bounded by the business issue at hand. A Delivery Architect needs to have knowledge of all the different aspects of the technical Delivery as well as robust business knowledge. This includes the Software Architect. Day to Day Responsibilities: You are responsible for designing and validating a complex architecture and ensuring its successful implementation. You should be able to identify and challenge several IT scenarios by taking into account the business environment. You work as a stream lead at CIO/CTO level in major client organizations. You lead Capgemini operations relating to market development and/or service delivery excellence. You are seen as a role model in your community. Candidates should be flexible/willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes and not limited to Agile Applications Development, Support and Deployment Required Skills and Experience: _Certification: Has TOGAF 9 and has IAF level 1 and is seeking level 2._ Should be experienced in foundation, People Leadership, service & delivery. Should be proficient in client acquisition & development and business leadership. Should be masters in Technology Awareness & Leveraging and Innovation & Capability Growth. Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Capgemini. LI-KH1

Description: Position Description: Act as an internal consultant supporting our global customers and dealers, Credit and Marketing, Sales and Service data strategy. Work closely with business partners, data scientists and data analysts to better understand and evaluate data requirements and the type of data needed. Provide visibility to data quality issues and work with the business owners to fix data issues. Manipulate and profile data to form quality, unified data sets for analysis and consumption. Enable tactical and strategic data standardization transformations for data visualization. Apply understanding and analysis of complex data problems, devise methodical action plan, and implement robust solutions. Cleanse, curate and standardize data with quality to support sustainable and scalable data interaction, analysis and insight development. Understand, wrangle, transform, and visualize large data sets from many sources, using a variety of tools. Evaluate, explore and select the appropriate data platform technologies including Big Data, RDBMS & NoSQL to meet the analytics requirements. Serve as data subject matter expert and demonstrate an understanding of key data management principles and data use. Experience in data design, data architecture or data modeling (both transactional and analytic). Additional Information : Strong team player, with the ability to collaborate, solve problems and actively incorporate input from various sources and team members. Demonstrated customer focus, with the ability to evaluate decisions through the eyes of the customer, build strong customer relationships, and create processes with customer viewpoint. Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to communicate in a clear and succinct manner and effectively evaluates information / data to make decisions. Ability to anticipate obstacles and develop plans to resolve those obstacles. Change oriented, with the ability to actively generates process improvements, support and drives change, and confront difficult circumstances in creative ways. Resourceful and quick learner, with the ability to efficiently seek out, learn, and apply new areas of expertise , as needed. Highly self-motivated, with the ability to work independently.
