Description: The Customer Experience Advocate for Lennar will be a key member of the Corporate Customer Care Team, which is responsible for strategic planning and operational support for 40 divisions across the country. The primary role of the Customer Experience Advocate is to help drive Customer Satisfaction and referrals through the development and use of metrics and data visualizations to measure performance, identify gaps and lessons learned, provide relevant and timely feedback, and make recommendations for process improvement and corrective actions. This position will assist in evaluating internal and external customer experience trends to identify best practices with the goal of continuous improvement. The Customer Experience Advocate will also provide an advanced level of support, responding to increasingly escalated customer communications in a timely and effective manner, and working to analyze and determine root cause and opportunities for improvement. Principal Duties and Responsibilities: Assist in the development and design of process improvement feedback mechanisms to evaluate and continuously refine Customer Care programs. Define performance challenges and design performance measurement solutions to inform management decision making. Review performance data to measure productivity or goal achievement and identify areas needing program improvement. Work with IT and Business Analytics team to incorporate dashboard analytics into operational control center and other areas, as requested. Provide advanced level customer support in a creative, proactive manner to resolve customer issues consistent with Lennar’s policies, procedures and quality standards. Focus on generating referrals and identifying brand ambassadors through the development of a robust customer management strategy. Collaborate on design and development of innovation projects, such as interactive voice recognition, chatbot, Alexa skills and other initiatives. Build out unique, creative and impactful solutions by integrating insights across Lennar’s expert functional resources supporting collaborative solution development. Establish support FAQs and work collaboratively to define the workflow for use with IVR (interactive voice recognition), CTI (computer telephony integration) and chatbot platforms. Help define and automate processes and communications related to the Homeowner Experience. Identify opportunities for enhanced training to support Best Practice initiatives. Work collaboratively with Learning and Development to develop and refine training materials for Customer Care team. Work cross-departmentally to leverage internal resources ensuring the successful execution of assigned projects. Support communication of success stories to the larger community. Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s degree required 5+ years of experience in related field Physical Requirements: _This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the Customer Experience Advocate to have the ability to operate computer equipment, speak, hear, bend, stoop, reach, lift, and move and carry up to 25 lbs. Finger dexterity is necessary._ _This is a position which requires the Customer Experience Advocate frequent walking, standing and climbing of stairs in/around homes, models and properties. Must also have the ability to operate computer equipment, speak, hear, bend, stoop, reach, lift, and move and carry up to 25 lbs. Finger dexterity is necessary._ Additional Requirements: Proficiency with computer programs including Microsoft Office Familiarity with Salesforce is a plus Strong analytical, problem solving, conflict resolution and mediation abilities Ability to clearly communicate with diverse audiences Committed to fostering and supporting a proactive, customer-driven approach to service Ability to manage multiple complex projects simultaneously and with little or no supervision Ability to work well under pressure and with a diverse range of personalities Capable of inspiring trust and confidence through effective and professional communication and interpersonal skills, both written and oral Ability to build effective working relationships across functional areas Innovative, creative and flexible thinker who enjoys searching for the next right answer Bilingual a plus This description outlines the basic responsibilities and requirements for the position noted. This is not a comprehensive listing of all job duties of the Associates. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
IT Skills: Data Visualization, Performance Measurement, Customer Support, Process Improvement, Dashboard Analytics, Interactive Voice Recognition (IVR), Chatbot, Computer Telephony Integration (CTI), Training Development, Microsoft Office, Salesforce
Soft Skills: Analytical Skills, Problem Solving, Conflict Resolution, Communication Skills, Proactive Customer Service, Project Management, Ability to work under pressure, Relationship Building, Innovation, Flexibility, Bilingualism (a plus)

Description: Description The Accounting Assistant will assist with the daily processing of Accounts Receivable and other General Accounting and Administrative duties as assigned. This person reports to the Accounting Manager. The individual in this role is a reliable Accounting Assistant who will assist primarily with processing and reconciling customer invoices, payments and related account reconciliations. Responsibilities: Processes Accounts Receivable invoices for Business, Wholesale and Wholesale Inter-Company Customers Processing manual credit card payments via Virtual Terminal Applying customer payments and processing refunds Monitor non-sufficient funds payments made Perform Account Analysis including Prepaids, Account Analysis, Fixed Assets, etc. Perform other duties as assigned Requirements REQUIREMENTS: Experience with Oracle software is preferred, but not required. Ideally, Associate's Degree or equivalent from a two-year college or technical school. Experience with Microsoft Office Products including Outlook, Excel and Word. Experience with AS400 software would be helpful in this role, but is not required. Good analytical, problem solving and organization skills, along with being dependable and adaptable to changing priorities. About Us 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. is a leading provider of gifts for all celebratory occasions. For the past 40 years, 1-800-Flowers.com® has been helping deliver smiles to customers with a 100% Smile Guarantee® backing every gift. The 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. family of brands also includes everyday gifting and entertaining products from Harry & David®, The Popcorn Factory®, Cheryl's Cookies®, 1-800-Baskets.com®, Wolferman's®, Moose Munch® premium popcorn, Personalization Universe®, Simply ChocolateSM, and FruitBouquets.com SM. The Company also offers top-quality steaks and chops from Stock Yards® and gift baskets and towers from its DesignPac Gifts, LLC division. Loyalty programs, such as Celebrations Passport®, Celebrations Rewards® and Celebrations Reminders® are designed to deepen relationships with customers across all brands. The Company's BloomNet® international floral wire service and Napco SM floral gifts and seasonal décor division provide a broad-range of products and services designed to help professional florists grow their businesses profitably. 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. was named to the Stores® 2017 Hot 100 Retailers List by the National Retail Federation and also received the Gold award in the "Best Artificial Intelligence" category at the Data & Marketing Association's 2017 International ECHO Awards. Shares in 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. are traded on the NASDAQ Global Select Market, ticker symbol: FLWS.

Description: Role Summary: The Manager – Data & Analytics will function as a leader in managing both the pipeline of new concepts and the tactical execution of life cycle cost analytics projects. The Manager – Data & Analytics is charged with executing the established data analytics strategy to drive life cycle cost improvements for MSA accounts. This role will require collaboration with GE Digital, GE Global Research and the Life Cycle Cost Team. Essential Responsibilities: Program management of leap analytics projects, focused on delivering the biggest value in growth and cost Coordinate with cross functional teams to create use cases to fill product backlog Prioritize program work based on business priority & resource availability Introduce process rigor around data science projects, recognizing when to pivot or stop quickly Create product roadmap, complete with features and user stories for the data engineering & visualization teams to deliver Be responsible for investigating potential analytics value by methods that may include data mining and data analysis Demonstrate the ability to quickly, effectively, and accurately determine analytics project benefits Build a deep domain expertise of GE and GE Transportation’s technical capabilities Monitor and communicate project status, business issues, and significant developments Communicate process to all levels of the organization Qualifications/Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Applied Statistics OR in "STEM" Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) Minimum of 3 years of experience working with Data Management, Business Intelligence, or Data Analytics Minimum 7 years of functional experience with some/any of the following functions such as finance, risk, services operations, field service, commercial, marketing, and product management GB/BB certified - Able to use tools (analytics, CAP, Six Sigma) and techniques to drive change Strong program / project management skill Willingness to travel up to 20% of the time Desired Characteristics: Ability to manage large programs with a variety of project work, with demonstrated ability to switch gears quickly Big data program management, including projects involving data science Experience with Agile methodologies Experience using SQL, R, Python, SAS Demonstrate analysis and problem solving skills Solid project management skills and ability to monitor and communicate project status, business issues, and significant developments Demonstrated ability to drive projects to completion Strong oral and written communication skills Strong interpersonal and leadership skills About Us: At GE Transportation, we move the world. We are a global digital industrial leader and supplier to the rail, mining, marine, stationary power and drilling industries. Our solutions help customers deliver goods and services with greater speed and greater savings using our advanced manufacturing techniques, industry expertise and connected machines. Established more than a century ago, GE Transportation is a division of GE that began as a pioneer in passenger and freight locomotives. That innovative spirit still drives GE Transportation today. It's the engine of change that puts us at the forefront of transportation technology, software, and analytics. And it's why we continue to find-and realize-the potential that keeps our connected world moving forward. The GE Transportation Global Headquarters is located in Chicago, Illinois. There are over 65 service sites worldwide. GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Description: Postman builds the worlds leading API Development Environment. We help everyone from individual developers to teams at organizations like Adobe, Salesforce, Cisco, Okta and Autodesk, collaboratively design, build, test, document, publish, consume and share both internal and external APIs. Over 5,000,000 developers and 100,000 organizations worldwide use Postman. Our customers LOVE our product and we continue to grow rapidly. As an expert in delivering business intelligence for Postman, you will work with our team to answer critical business questions in a data-driven manner. This role will require an informed and critical eye, someone who questions and reviews the validity of data from several perspectives, not just someone who fires a query and blindly forwards the results. Responsibilities Design, build and maintain analytical infrastructure across the organization Work closely with business stakeholders and engineering to make sure data definitions and technical logic specifications align with business requirements Handle data extractions and translations from multiple data sources in order to build and support sustainable, high-performance data model solutions Automate ETLs to acquire, process, and curate data, with an eye for reproducible analysis Recommend data standards and best practices to improve quality of data and speed to insight Design and build business metrics for our corporate reporting; build dashboards in analytical/BI tools for business stakeholders Translate analytical insights into actionable recommendations for business and process improvemen requirements 3 + years of relevant experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics, or other quantitative disciplines Experience solving ambiguous and complex data problems Experience mapping business objectives into actionable analyses, and explaining technical concepts, and implications to a broad audience Analytics industry Knowledge with a comfortable sense of the tooling landscape Proficient in SQL and working with large datasets, and knowledge of system architecture Knowledgeable in one or more leading BI Analytics platforms Plus: Experience with Looker benefits Postman is a small company, with 50 employees in San Francisco and Bangalore, and customers around the world. As at any startup, everyone wears many hats! Flexibility and a willingness to do what needs to get done are important. The position will require working with customers and colleagues in different time zones and cultures, within a collegial and supportive team.
IT Skills: ****, Data Analysis, Data Modeling, ETL Automation, SQL, BI Analytics Platforms
Soft Skills: ****, Critical Thinking, Problem Solving, Communication, Collaboration, Flexibility

Description: Company Overview : REsurety is a mission-driven organization solving the challenge of resource intermittency for renewable energy. We work in partnership with the world’s leading energy and risk management providers to enable renewable energy consumers and producers to manage the fuel risk of the present and future: the weather. As a high-growth, profitable company that has already supported over 3,500 MW of transactions, we are a small team making a big impact! Our culture is open and collaborative. We expect excellence from our team members and reward it with high ownership and flexibility. If you’re a high-achiever with a passion for clean energy, then we look forward to receiving your application. Position Overview: As an Autumn member of the Engineering team, you will help us advance our analytical capabilities through advanced modeling, efficient software architecture, and high-quality implementation. Key Responsibilities: Support the analysis and quality control of REsurety’s weather and market risk assessment engine Continue the advancement of REsurety’s data analytics and visualization capabilities Required Qualifications: Experience with the R language (secondary preference for MATLAB/Python) Knowledge of modeling, simulation, or data science Major in computer science, engineering, applied math, geoscience, or a related field Preferred Qualifications: Applied experience and demonstrated success in wind energy and/or power markets A passion for driving down the cost of energy from renewable sources Details: Travel: None Commitment: Up to 40 hours/week for a 10-week period beginning in September 2018 REsurety, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

Soft Skills: Collaboration, Communication, Analytical skills, Passion for clean energy, High-achiever

Description: IT Operations Coordinator Chicago, IL To be part of the AMA is to be part of our Mission to promote the art and science of medicine and the betterment of public health. Join the AMA team as the IT Operations Coordinator in Information Technology. As part of the team, you will assist IT Leadership in providing department support in delivering the highest quality of service to business units throughout the AMA. You will support the IT Procurement area and anticipate administrative needs of IT leadership while initiating action to support management of projects and finances of the IT group. You will provide administrative support and services for IT staff and consultants. Other Responsibilities will include: Oversee the IT Equipment receiving process. Physically receive, inspect, and check in all IT ordered equipment and accessories. Asset tag equipment as required. Coordinate IT asset reporting to Finance. Manage EZOffice inventory software. Serve as IT purchasing agent backup. Provide administrative support for budgeting, capital requests, and invoice management as needed. Oversee completion of daily administrative activities. Manage calendars and scheduling of meetings, including coordination and negotiation with service providers. Complete necessary correspondence and reports in a clear, concise and timely manner. Support coordination of staff training and participation at conferences. Provide administrative support to IT management, staff and consultants. Work with Human Resources to ensure that IT confidential employee records comply with processes and procedures. Work closely with other departments to monitor IT Compliance. Process IT contracts and invoices in collaboration with IT project managers and IT procurement staff according to AMA standards in a timely manner with a high level of accuracy. Track status of all contracts. Inform VPs, Directors, Team Leaders, and Project Managers of contract expiration dates and maintain copies of Finance reports on a monthly basis. Serve as IT Administrator for DocuSign. REQUIREMENTS: High school diploma required, bachelor’s degree preferred. 4+ years of administrative experience required, including support of executives; 1 year of experience providing administrative support for budgeting processes and contract procedures or equivalent. Demonstrates an attention to detail, good judgment and the ability to work independently. Advanced working knowledge of Outlook, Microsoft Word and Excel software. Working knowledge of PowerPoint, Visio and Sharepoint preferred. Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills, including interaction with executives and the ability to influence colleagues to complete tasks as requested by IT leadership. Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and sensitivity. Demonstrated ability to function successfully in a team environment as well as to be a strong individual contributor. Strong decision-making skills, including business and technology problem solving. Exhibits the ability to work in a fast paced environment, reprioritizing assigned tasks as needed based on importance and urgency. Must possess a good sense of humor and a positive, “can-do” attitude. The AMA offers competitive salaries, including an incentive plan; excellent benefits and progressive technology. Our office is a business casual environment and we respect work-life balance. The American Medical Association is located at 330 N. Wabash Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611 and is convenient to all public transportation in Chicago. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity in our workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. As an EOE/AA employer, the American Medical Association will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and veteran or disability status. THE AMA IS COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE HEALTH OF THE NATION
IT Skills: IT Procurement, Financial Management, Budgeting, Asset Management, Inventory Management, IT Compliance, Contract Management, Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook, Sharepoint, DocuSign

Description: A rising startup here in South Bay who make AR and VR Software for smartphones is looking for a Senior Data Scientist. Their technology uses computer vision and deep learning to capture hand motion with full skeletal tracking. They are looking for a Data Scientist with a strong background in Deep Learning and Computer vision. The projects you work on will involve developing and deploying deep learning models for augmented reality, gaming, and automated driving. So they need someone who is up to date with modern deep learning and computer vision technologies and concepts, who has completed three or more projects in deep learning, tracking, 3D reconstruction, optical flow or any related domains. Skills required are Python and C++, along with TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Caffe. Required Skills & Experience Masters or Ph.D in Computer Science. Strong experience with Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch Developing and deploying Deep Learning models Strong experience with Computer Vision. Projects in object detection, motion tracking, activity recognition, 3D reconstruction, or deep reinforcement learning Strong communication skills. Project management skills Desired Skills & Experience Experience with C++ Background in robotics, AR and VR, kinematics, or physics. Enjoy challenging work What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown 40% Algorithms 30% Research 30% Deployment Daily Responsibilities 80% Development 20% Team Collaboration The Offer Competitive Salary: Up to $200K/year, DOE You will receive the following benefits: Health Benefits 401(k) Plan Free team lunches Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future. This position does not offer sponsorship. Workbridge Associates, part of the Motion Recruitment network, provides IT Staffing Solutions (Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Direct Hire) across 11 major North American markets. Our unique expertise in today’s highest demand tech skill sets, paired with our deep networks and knowledge of our local technology markets, results in an exemplary track record with candidates and clients.
IT Skills: Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Python, C++, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe
Soft Skills: Strong communication skills, Project management skills
Education: Education Related:, Masters or Ph.D in Computer Science

Its portfolio includes 35 outstanding contracts, such as Port Miami Tunnel and maintenance of the Chevron refineries in California. With more than 1,500 employees and a presence in 14 states, Ferrovial Services North America, generates true value and growth for its clients while maintaining a strong commitment to safety and social responsibility. Description: Upstart is the first lending platform to leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning to price credit and automate the borrowing process. Our Forecasting and Risk function is a newly formed team that is looking to expand by hiring a Data Analyst. As Upstart’s first Data Analyst, you will be a critical member of Upstart Risk team. You’ll take ownership of the credit performance data analysis and reporting by developing reports and building repeatable and scalable data quality audits. Through your efforts, we’ll be able to ensure reporting accuracy and consistency across company to monitor credit risk. You If you are naturally curious, have good SQL skills, love data, and can communicate complex concepts with technical and non-technical people, this could be a great opportunity for you. Here is what we're looking for: BS/MS Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or other highly quantitative field 2+ years of practical experience in SQL querying and proven ability to work with large and complex data set Knowledge to translate business requirements to Data Warehousing and ETL Experience in data analytics tools such as Python, Pandas or R Strong communication and client-facing data presentation skills Proven ability to learn quickly, work independently, and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment Organized and able to juggle multiple tasks while still meeting deadlines Bonus points Experience with Amazon Redshift Experience with BI/reporting tools such as Looker or Tableau Previous consumer marketplace lending industry experience on capital market, finance or compliance is not required but a plus
IT Skills: SQL querying, Data Warehousing, ETL, Python, Pandas, R, Amazon Redshift, Looker, Tableau

Description: Job Description: Sr Architect, Business Responsibilities: Seek to understand how people, processes, and technology interact to perform the fundamental activities of the business in both current and future states, and model these interactions to guide technology Portfolio strategy in order to better achieve the strategic goals and objectives of the business. Work cross-functionally to understand the linkage between T-Mobile's business goals, business architectures, and technology portfolio. Apply a structured approach and methodology for capturing the key views of the business unit in the context of the enterprise. Capture the tactical and strategic business goals that provide traceability through the organization and are mapped to metrics that provide ongoing governance. Describe the primary business functions of the assigned business unit in the context of the enterprise and distinguish between customer-facing, supplier-related, business execution and business management functions. Enumerate, analyze, catalog, and suggest improvements to the strategic, core and support processes of the business unit, as needed, to support strategic and operational goals. Understand the data elements shared between this business unit and other units in the enterprise and the relationships between those data elements and processes, people, systems, and other data elements. Responsible for facilitating the management and process for analyzing value; evaluating risk; prioritizing; and onboarding new technology project requests to ensure alignment with organizational strategy. Continuously improve the IT governance and planning capability by integrating optimal ways of planning and organizing. Build trusted and effective relationships working with project managers to ensure they deliver on-time, on-budget, on benefit and on-quality (and intervening to resolve issues as required) Qualifications: 6+ years related work experience Experience understanding business processes using a variety of tools and techniques Extensive experience planning and deploying either business or IT initiatives (preference for both) The ability to articulate the relationship between business strategy and technology strategy The ability to recognize structural issues within the organization, functional interdependencies and cross-silo redundancies. Those issues may exist in role alignment, process gaps and overlaps, and business capability maturity gaps A broad, enterprise-wide view of the business and varying degrees of appreciation for strategy, processes and capabilities, enabling technologies, and governance Experience using these high-level views as required to collect, aggregate or disaggregate complex and conflicting information about the business Team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus. Strong facilitation and problem solving skills are necessary Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, and the ability to convey results in a summarily and persuasive manner Fluency in the use of all MS Office applications _Desired_ _Education_ _Minimum Required_ Bachelors Degree Additional work experience considered in lieu of degree LI-DB1 Minimum Qualifications: • At least 18 years of age.• Legally authorized to work in the United States.• High School Diploma or GED.• Pre-employment background screen. The company’s advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile US provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and MetroPCS. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com EOE Statement: We Take Equal Opportunity Seriously - By Choice T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Description: Job Description Enterprise Data & Analytics is responsible for providing Districts and Customers with exceptional data analytics support for planning, root cause analysis and process improvement activities that accelerate Expeditors’ business. The Data Analyst position is a broad-spectrum analytics role responsible for leveraging all available data and has a wide range of responsibilities including the collection, cleansing, analysis, reporting, interpretation and presentation of data. Data Analysts have the ability to develop end-to-end data solutions. Key Responsibilities:﻿ Scope, plan, develop and deploy impactful data-driven solutions for our Districts and Customers Adhere to a defined analytics development procedure and fully document solutions Participate in project requirements gathering and solution design Complete projects on-time and provide frequent progress updates to project stakeholders Prepare, cleanse and augment data in preparation for analysis and usage Develop meaningful and intuitive reports, summaries and dashboards Provide support for data and reporting infrastructure such as scheduling and access Leverage advanced analytics tools and techniques to extract insights from data Share solutions and collaborate with other analysts in the network Manage projects, tasks, time and timelines within our standard project management tools Provide ongoing training to Districts on available reporting and self-service analytics tools Cross-train team members on new tools and analytics procedures Support our District as a subject matter expert on our data, tools and environments Ensure solutions are built to scale and use enterprise approved technologies Qualifications minimum 3-5 years or related experience Bachelor degree or higher in the area of information systems or analytics Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (formulas and pivot tables) Advanced proficiency in various analytics tools (i.e.; Microsoft Excel, SAS, R, Python, SQL, Java) Advanced proficiency in various business intelligence platforms (i.e.; Inetsoft, PowerBI, Oracle BI) Ability to clearly communicate and present to small and large groups Additional Information Successful candidate must pass the company's defined background check. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Description: Job Description Thomson Reuters combines industry expertise with innovative technology to deliver critical information to leading decision makers in the financial, legal, tax and accounting and media markets, powered by the world’s most trusted news organization. Legal Tracker (formerly Serengeti) is a SaaS solution that helps our clients’ corporate legal department perform better. Legal Tracker is the most widely used spend and matter management solution in the corporate legal department market. This position is an opportunity to work in a fast-paced, exciting, and growth-oriented business within Thomson Reuters. Job Description The BI Analyst role will work cross functionally within the Legal Tracker Client Relations Group (CRG) to identify, create, report, and analyze strategic business data. The role will focus on optimizing business performance from problem identification to building actionable data insights and solutions. This role will also work directly with customers to negotiate high-value renewals. The ideal candidate is a problem solver with experience in building business intelligence solutions who can manage multiple time-sensitive projects with minimal direction and is motivated by customer success. Responsibilities: Capture, report and provide analysis on key business data Provide strategic insight on business and customer operations Work with cross-functional teams to drive simplification in deployed technologies Work with customers in negotiation of strategic client renewals Understand customer success trends and drive adoption of market leading customer-success initiatives Handle and identify priorities for multiple projects at the same time Assist in the growth of Legal Tracker and Thomson Reuters’ product and services business Qualifications Data visualization & reporting software experience (Power BI/Tableau/Etc.) Demonstrated experience delivering actionable insights from large and complex data sets Ability to understand and translate business and product questions into analytics projects Experience working directly with customers in a B2B environment Familiarity and comfort with technology and databases to develop an expert level understanding of the Legal Tracker product and the corporate legal department customer segment Project management skills, aptitude or experience Ability to manage multiple projects of varying complexity, scale and priority simultaneously Education: Bachelor’s degree required Advanced degree preferred At Thomson Reuters, we believe what we do matters. We are passionate about our work, inspired by the impact it has on our business and our customers. As a team, we believe in winning as one - collaborating to reach shared goals, and developing through challenging and meaningful experiences. With more than 45,000 employees in more than 100 countries, we work flexibly across boundaries and realize innovations that help shape industries around the world. Making this happen is a dynamic, evolving process, and we count on each employee to be a catalyst in driving our performance - and their own. As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace. Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us. To learn more about what we offer, please visit thomsonreuters.com/careers. More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com. Locations Eagan-Minnesota-United States of America;Bellevue-Washington-United States of America
